de las chos ni thos pa dang / / mchod pa'i las la brtson par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba 'khor los sgyur gsungs pa'i/ / 'dir ni las rnams gzhan yod de/ / mar me yon du dbul ba ni/ / mar bcas snying po gtsang ba ni/ / gser dang dngul gyi snod dag dang / / zangs ma sa dag nyid yin na/ / der ni mar me rab sbar te/ / skyes bu grangs ni 'bum dag gis/ / grangs kyi tshad tsam nges bzhag ste/ / brgya phrag stong las lhag pa min/ / bud med spangs pa'i skyes pa yis/ / kho ra khor yug mar me 'dzin/ / mchod pa'i las kyi don du ni/ / ston pa'i ras ris sku la dbul/ /

“He will hear their Dharma teachings And will eagerly worship them. There are also other rites That originate from the victorious wheel turner.[1089] “One should offer one hundred thousand lamps[1090] With wicks fed with pure ghee,[1091] Set in golden or silver dishes, Or perhaps copper or clay. “When these have been lit By one hundred thousand men And placed by this whole group On one hundred thousand floats,[1092] “And only men, without women, Stand around with lamps in their hands,[1093] They should make an offering to the Teacher in the painting In an act of worship.
sngags rnams re re'ang 'dod bzhin du/ / thams cad mnyam par rab zhugs nas/ / ston pa la ni 'bul byed na/ / de yi mod la grub par ston/ /
“With all of them simultaneously engaged, If each one recites the mantra And makes offerings to the Teacher while reciting, Accomplishment will manifest instantly.[1094]

kun nas sgra ni sgrogs byed cing / / rnga bo che yi sgra yang sgrogs/ / gang phyir lha tshogs du ma ni/ / legs so zhes pa'i sgra rab 'don/ / sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yang / / de tshe nam mkha' la bzhugs nas/ / shes rab can khyod legs so legs/ / legs byas las ni yongs su byas/ / 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa dang / / sdug bsngal yang ni mthong mi 'gyur/ / bde dang zhi ba mya ngan 'das/ / 'jigs med sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'thob/ / lam ni dge dang dri ma med/ / yan lag brgyad la legs par spyod/ / yi ge gcig pa mnyes byas nas/ / sngags kyi ngo bo'i mgon po mnyes/ /

“All around the sound of thunder will be heard, And the drumming of drums. Many hosts of gods Will exclaim, ‘Good!’ “The buddhas and bodhisattvas Will appear in the sky and say, ‘Good, O wise being! You have made your ritual performance work! “ ‘You will not experience again The suffering that saturates saṃsāra. You will remain in the state of a buddha, In safe, happy, and fearless nirvāṇa. “ ‘You have embarked upon The path that is auspicious and pure, Eight branched, based on the right livelihood, And guarded by the wheel-holding One Syllable in his mantra form.’[1095]

gzhan yang las ni 'di yod de/ / dam pa'i 'gro ba la gnas nas/ / mthu chen por ni rnam shes pa'i/ / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs/ / nim pa'i rang bzhin shing blangs nas/ / rtse gsum rdo rje gnyis mthar bya/ / dbus kyi phyogs su bya ba ni/ / rdo rje rigs te mi bskyod pa/ /

“There is yet another rite, Which leads to the highest birth; It has been taught by all the buddhas And is known to confer great powers. “One should take a piece of neem tree wood And make from it a vajra scepter With three prongs at either end. The middle part should represent the buddha of the Vajra family.[1096]

de nas sngags kyis dag byas nas/ / de ni ras ris sngon du bzhag / de nas sngags pas lag reg nas/ / sngags ni mnyam par bzhag nas bzla/ / rtsa brgyad 'bum phrag bcu drug ni/ / yongs su rdzogs nas grub par 'dod/ / de nas rdo rje gcig 'bar te/ / kun nas de ni rab tu 'bar/ / de nas rdo rje de blangs nas/ / 'di ltar de ni steng 'gro'o/ / de nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam/ / gzhan yang lha gnas gang 'dod 'gro/ /

“One should then purify the vajra with the mantra And place it in front of the painting. The practitioner should then recite the mantra, Fully concentrated, while touching the vajra. “After completing 12,800,000 recitations What is desired will be accomplished. The vajra will then emit a single flame And illuminate everything all around. “Then, by picking up the vajra,[1097] One will thus ascend upward. One will visit the world of Brahmā, Or any other celestial realm equal to it.[1098]

de nas nam mkhar 'gro 'gyur te/ / grub pa kun gyi sngon du 'dren/ / grub pa'i rig 'dzin la sogs kyi/ / bdag po nyid kyang byed par 'gyur/ / lha yi 'dus pa mang po yi/ / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur/ / bdag nyid kyi ni spyod pa yang / / rnam pa sna tshogs byed par 'gyur/ / bar gyi bskal pa bcu yi bar/ / yun ring gnas te bar chad med/ / bde ba la brten rtag tu mchod/ / rtag tu skyes bu dam par ldan/ / byang chub sems kyi yang dag spyod/ / skye ba'i sdug bsngal rnam par spangs/ / grub pa'i dbang phyug 'gyur ba ste/ / sdig pa thams cad rnam par spangs/ /

“One will travel through space As the foremost of siddhas. One will become the master Of siddhas, vidyādharas, and so forth. “One will become a wheel-turning monarch Reigning among a host of gods. One will be able to assume different forms, Based on the correct ascertainment of the nature of the body. “One will be able to remain in this condition For ten intermediate eons, without deviating from it, Always enjoying pleasures and venerated, Always endowed with a beautiful form and qualities. “One will follow the conduct of bodhicitta, Free from the sufferings of repeated birth. One will become a celestial siddha,[1099] Free from all negativity.

de las shi 'phos mir skye zhing / / bde ba mang la rab tu gzhol/ / 'gro ba ma lus skyo byas nas/ / byang chub yang dag gzhol bar 'gyur/ / rnam pa sna tshogs las mtha' yas/ / mang po 'jig rten don mchod pa/ / sngags kyi rgyal po 'dir brjod pa/ / cho ga rgya chen cho gar bcas/ / sa bdag brgya byin nyid dang ni/ / 'khor los sgyur nyid yang dang yang / / rig 'dzin rnams dang de bzhin du/ / lha nyid dang ni bdag po'ang byed/ / rnam pa du ma'i ngo bo 'am/ / las ni gang dag 'di gsungs pa/ / thams cad grub pa thob 'gyur te/ / sngags pa legs par sbyor byed na'o/ /

“Passing on from there, one will be born a human Destined for a life of many pleasures. Not straying toward any other destiny, One will wholly pursue the goal of awakening. “One’s activities will be diverse and infinite, And one will be venerated, bringing benefit to many. When this king of mantras is recited As part of the full ritual, “One will obtain a suzerainty over the earth, A state of Śakra, or that of a universal emperor. One may also assume the condition Of a vidyādhara or a god, “Or any other numerous forms, And perform the types of activities here described.[1100] If a mantra practitioner applies himself to the task thoroughly, He will attain every accomplishment.
mtshan mo skyil mo krung bcas te/ / sdom can don yod bzlas byas na/ / tho rangs grub pa thob 'gyur te/ / zlos pa mngon shes lnga thob 'gyur/ /

“At night, seated with crossed legs, The vow holder should recite the mantra uninterruptedly.[1101] The reciter will attain accomplishment by the next morning And will obtain the five superknowledges.
dur khrod ro la 'dug nas ni/ / sdom can 'gul med zlos pa ni/ / yi ge gcig po don chen te/ / tho rangs grub par 'dod pa yin/ /
“Stepping upon a corpse in a cemetery, The vow holder should recite the mantra without moving. The One Syllable being able to accomplish great aims, One can expect accomplishment by morning.

rig pa'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul che/ / gal te dur khrod gnas nas bzlas/ / zla ba drug gis grub thob ste/ / ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu byed/ / gang yang rung ba'i gnas dag tu/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po zlos byed na/ / der gnas grub pa thob 'gyur te/ / sngags pa legs par sbyor byed pa'o/ /

“If this lord of vidyās, of great power, Is recited in a cemetery, The reciter will attain accomplishment within six months And obtain the desired result. “At whatever place the One Syllable, Of great power, is recited, At that place will the reciter attain accomplishment, If he employs the mantra in the right way.

gdugs dkar de bzhin ral gri dang / / nor bu'i lham dang gdub kor dang / / mu tig phreng ba dpung rgyan dang / / gdu bu dang ni sor gdub dang / / 'og pag dang ni de bzhin gos/ / so shing dang ni spyi blugs dang / / mchod phyir thogs dang zhwa dang ni/ / khrab dang go cha nyid dang ni/ / g.yang gzhi dang ni ril ba dang / / phreng ba dang ni mchil lham dang / / 'jig rten gnyis na 'dod pa yi/ / rgyan gyi gtso bo thams cad de/ / lha dang mi dang de bzhin du/ / gzhan yang rgyan 'gyur 'di la brgyan/ / de dag thams cad thob 'gyur te/ / ras ris mdun du zlos byed la'o/ / rdzas rnams kun dang 'byung khung dang / / rgyan dang nor bu rnams dang ni/ / mtshon cha thams cad du ma ni/ / ras ris mdun du bzhag nas ni/ / dag byas cig car bzla bya ba/ / 'bum phrag brgyad kyis g.yo ba dang / / thams cad bcas te 'bar ba dang / / zlos pa reg pas gyen du 'gro/ /

“A white parasol, a sword, A jewel, a pair of shoes,[1102] earrings, A garlands of pearls, an armlet, a banner,[1103] A bracelet,[1104] a ring, “A girdle, clothes, Tooth sticks, a water pitcher, A sacred cord, a turban, A coat of mail, leather armor, “An antelope skin, a water pot, A rosary, a pair of shoes, All the best adornments To be desired in both worlds, “The adornments worn By the gods, men, or others‍— All of them will be accomplished If one recites in front of the painting. “All the substances, minerals, Adornments, jewels, And the different kinds of weapons, If placed in front of the painting “And incanted once, will become pure. If incanted eight hundred thousand times, They will all emit light together. The reciter will rise[1105] upon being touched by them.

rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs ldan pa/ / sems can rang bzhin yin yang rung / / rgyan dang mtshon cha yin yang rung / / ngo bo nyid dam sa rang bzhin/ / rang tshul spyod dam bcos ma dang / / 'dab chags sna tshogs tshogs kyang rung / / gang dag 'byung po kun la grags/ / bcos ma'am bcos ma ma yin pa/ / 'du shes can nam 'du shes med/ / sngags pa mchod pas grub par 'gyur/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rdzas bzhag dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs khams las byung / / rang byas byed du bcug pa dang / / 'gro ba'i skye gnas dag na bsngags/ / sngar bstan cho ga bzhin du ni/ / ras ris mdun du rnam par gzhag / lan ni drug gam bdun dag gis/ / sngags pas reg nas bzla bar bya/ / bzlas mthar de dag rab 'bar te/ / grub pa rgyas pa thob par 'gyur/ / de ni de la reg tsam gyis/ / phyogs bzhi dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur/ / 'dir ni lha yul thob nas ni/ / ring du 'tsho zhing bde bar 'gyur/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po rig rgyal la/ / ji lta ji ltar rab sbyor ba/ / de lta de ltar dga' 'gyur zhing / / rtag tu mchog kyang ster bar 'gyur/ / gzhan yang las la rab sbyor ba/ / las rnams dus ni yun ring ba/ / rig pa'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul che/ / de nyid kyis ni myur 'grub 'gyur/ /

“Different types of beings With different features and forms, Adornments, and weapons, Whether made of clay or real, “Either self-animated or fabricated,[1106] And different types of birds‍— All entities that are described As artificial or natural, “Beings that have names, and those that do not‍— Will be accomplished when purified by the mantra.[1107] Beings that live in different mediums And are composed of different elements[1108] “Will have the courses of their births Purified by the mantra, If they are placed in front of this painting, Following the procedure as previously described. “Touching them,[1109] a mantra practitioner should recite The mantra six or seven times one hundred thousand.[1110] If, at the end of the recitation, they emit light, One will attain full accomplishment. “Upon merely touching them, One will be able to fly throughout the four directions. One will live happily for a long time And obtain, in this life, the status of a god. “Reflecting the manner in which This very powerful vidyārāja is employed, He will become pleased And will always grant boons. “When employed in other rites Whose ritual instructions are very extensive,[1111] This very powerful vidyārāja Will swiftly accomplish them.

gtsang zhing sems ni gtsang ba dang / / gtsang ba'i las la rtag tu dga'/ / gtsang ba'i phyogs dang sngags shes pa/ / gtsang ba'i grub pa thob par 'gyur/ / las gang byed pa de 'bras thob/ / mchog gi mchog tu 'gyur ba dang / / 'bring gi las kyi 'bring du 'gyur/ / tha mas kyang ni tha mar ro/ / ma bsgrubs las kyis grub pa yang / / cung zad tsam gyis 'bras 'byin te/ / bu mo'am nor ni mang po dag / yang dag spyod pas byed par 'gyur/ / rtag tu bzlas pa tsam gyis ni/ / longs spyod che zhing stobs kyang che/ / rgyal po dga' zhing blon po nyid/ / rtag tu bzlas pas byed par 'gyur/ / sngags kyi rgyal po lan cig bzlas/ / de yis sdig pa rab tu 'jig / gnyis su bzlas sam bdun bzlas pas/ / bdag nyid srung ba chen por 'gyur/ /

“A mantra adept pure in mind and activities, Who always delights in purity And stays in a pure place, Will attain a pure accomplishment. “One will reap the fruit according to the activity: From the highest comes the highest; For activities of medium type, the fruit will be medium; If it is of the lowest type, the fruit will correspond in nature. “A rite, if performed properly, Will yield great wealth.[1112] However, if the rite is not accomplished properly, It will yield only a small result. “Merely by reciting continually, One will attain great prosperity and power. A reciter will invariably obtain A king’s affection and ministerial office. “If this king of mantras is recited but once, He will destroy all negativity. If recited twice or seven times, He will provide a powerful protection for oneself.

lan brgyad de ni bzlas pa yis/ / grogs po thams cad srung bar byed/ / gos la lan gnyis mngon bsngags na/ / sngags pa dag ni rtag tu yang / / nad rnams kun las shin tu grol/ / gos ni gnyis ka la bsngags nas/ / gos dag la ni reg byas na/ / lus can nad ni med par 'gyur/ / gdong dang mig gnyis dag la ni/ / 'bad pas mngon par rab bsngags na/ / khros pa rnams kyi khro ba ni/ / sngags pas bltas pa tsam gyis 'jig / gang yang 'byung tshogs ma rungs pa/ / 'tshe byed sdig pa'i las can la/ / sngags rgyal sum cu rab bzlas te/ / de dag gdong la blta ba 'am/ / rang lag nyid la yang dang yang / / mngon par bsngags pa byas nas ni/ / de dag thal mo brdabs na ni/ / lus can kun ni grol bar 'gyur/ /

“If he is recited eight times, One’s companions will be protected in all respects. Furthermore, a mantra practitioner Should incant both his garments.[1113] “When both garments are incanted, He will have removed all disease. Touching these garments, after the mantra was recited, Will destroy all bodily fever. “If mantra practitioners carefully incant Their face or eyes, or both the face and the eyes, They will destroy the anger of the angry Merely by being looked at. “For any host of evil spirits, Violent and engaged in negative actions, The practitioner should look them in the face [With his eyes] incanted thirty times with the king of mantras. “Also, if he incants His own hand repeatedly And delivers with it a blow, He will liberate any embodied being.

byis pa la ni rtag bya ba/ / khrus dang bza' dang btung ba la/ / sngags mchog drug cu bzlas nas ni/ / lha yi dam pa mchod byas na/ / sha za ma mo dag gi gdon/ / ma rungs kun las grol bar 'gyur/ / sngags kyi 'jigs pas 'jigs byed cing / / rtag tu byis pa gtong bar byed/ / de ltar rnam pa du ma'i las/ / sa steng myur du rtag 'jig na/ / mi rnams la ni de bzhin byed/ / gang dag 'byung po sdig sbrul ni/ / rnam pa sna tshogs gnas 'gro ba/ / dug bcas dug ni med pa nyid/ / sngags kyi mthu yis 'jig par byed/ / gang dag sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang / / gang dag 'tshe ba thams cad ni/ / sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas pa yis/ / myur du zhi bar rab tu 'gro/ / rnam pa sna tshogs gnod sdug bsngal/ / mang po 'chi ba 'go ba'i nad/ / sngags kyi rgyal po drug brgya bzlas/ / myur ba nyid du sel bar 'gyur/ / sbyin sreg las ni bya ba la/ / zho dang mar gyis thams cad bsre/ / ut+pal sngon po dri bzang ni/ / rtsa brgyad stong gis bzlas pa bya/ /

“Regarding children, he should always Bathe them and give them food and drink, Having incanted these articles sixty times With this exalted mantra, worshiped by the gods. “All evildoers will then depart‍— The mātṛs, the kravyādas, and the grahas; Frightened by the mantra they will perish, And certainly abandon the children. “There are many rites of this kind; If they target [troublesome] humans on earth, They will, likewise, Swiftly repel them. “Whatever beings swim in rivers, And the different species that roam the dry land, Be they venomous or not, Will perish, burst by the mantra.[1114] “Whatever types of suffering And whatever unpleasant experiences beings may have Will be repelled by this king of mantras And swiftly become pacified. “Whatever kinds of terrible pestilence there are, Which are attended upon by suffering, Will swiftly vanish away If this mantra[1115] is recited six hundred times. “One should perform the rites of homa Offering one thousand and eight Fragrant blue lotus flowers Smeared with honey, curds, and ghee,[1116] mixed together.

zhi zhing 'byung po rnam song nas/ / 'gro ba rnams ni bde gnas thob/ / de ltar rnam pa du ma ni/ / mang po'i las ni yang dag 'byung / / sngags pa legs par rab sbyor na/ / myur du thams cad byed par 'gyur/ / bzlas pa tsam gyis byed pa ni/ / dgra rnams kyi ni khro ba sel/ / sngags 'di don dang ldan gyur pas/ / cho ga mang po rgya che ba/ / de dag cho ga mthong ba yis/ / de dag 'dir ni grub pa yin/ / 'dir ni sngags rnams zlo byed pa/ / phran tshegs las kyang don yod 'gyur/ / thams cad la yang bzlas pa yis/ / myur du don rnams rtag tu byed/ / 'byung po rnams ni dbang byed 'dod/ / dus gsum du ni bzlas pa yin/ / rtag tu sna ma'i me tog gis/ / sbyin sreg las kyang bya ba yin/ / tsan+dan dkar dang ga pur dang / / gur gum gyis kyang bya ba yin/ / bzlas nas sngags pa mchog sbyin zhing / / rtag tu 'bras bcas byed par 'gyur/ /

“Offering sesame will bring peace to spirits And well-being to human beings.[1117] The mantra practitioner will thus be able to swiftly accomplish All these different types of activities, “Brought forth by many different rites, If he applies himself well. Through merely reciting the mantra One will be able to appease the anger of one’s enemies. “There are many extensive rites Connected with the meaning of this mantra; It is said that if one follows the prescribed procedure, One will here obtain success in them. “The mantra that is recited Will certainly effect the minor activities here. When recited, it will always swiftly fulfill The aims of all ritual activities. “In order to enthrall all beings, It is necessary to recite the mantra at the three junctions of the day. One should always perform the rite of homa Using the blossoms of royal jasmine. “Prescribed also are white sandalwood, Camphor, and saffron. The mantra will always bring results For superior reciters.[1118]

rtag tu zlos pas sbyin sreg byas/ / yid la 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed/ / ga bur la sogs ldan pa yis/ / rtag tu sbyin sreg rab tu brtag / ji ltar 'dod par yongs brtags pa'i/ / rnam pa sna tshogs cho ga bsgrub/ / tha ma las ni tha ma dang / / chen po las ni chen po 'byung / / bar ma bar ma'i las dag las/ / rtag tu grub par bstan pa yin/ / de bas las rnams kun la ni/ / khyad par du ni sbyin sreg bya/ /

“One will accomplish desired aims If one recites along with the indispensable homa. The required homa should be prepared With the proper ingredients such as camphor and so forth. “One should perform various rites, Prepared the way one desires‍— If the homa is small, the rite’s success will be minimal; If it is big, the results will likewise be significant. “If it is medium, the result will be middling; The success of the rite is always explained in this way. One should therefore take special care to include Homa in all ritual activities.”

byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las/ 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi rtsa ba'i cho ga las/ le'u bcu bzhi pa 'khor los sgyur ba'i ras ris kyi cho ga'i dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i thabs rab 'byam rdzogs so// //

This concludes the chapter that provides the details of the practice of the cakravartin, including the painting procedure and the maṇḍala, fourteenth in “The Root Manual of Noble Mañjuśrī,” an extensive Mahāyāna sūtra that forms a garland-like basket of bodhisattva teachings.
las thams cad kyi bya ba'i don gyi le'u
Chapter 15

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje 'khor gyi nang der 'dus shing 'khod par gyur te/ 'dug pa de stan las langs nas lan gsum bskor ba byas te/ bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la btud nas/ bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ /

At that time, the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, the great being, was present in the midst of the same gathering. Seated, he rose from his seat, circumambulated the Blessed One clockwise three times, and, prostrating at the Blessed One’s feet, said this to him:

bcom ldan 'das legs so legs so/ / legs par rab tu bstan pa dang / mchog tu legs par gsungs pa'i rig pa thams cad kyi sngags kyi sbyor ba/ chos chen po'i sprin las nges par byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po/ rig pa chen po'i rgyal po 'khor los sgyur ba/ cho ga chen po rgya che ba don thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa/ 'bras bu dang bcas pa sgrub par byed pa/ byang chub kyi lam bla na med pa/ bya ba'i bye brag yang dag par sdom pa dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg dang / rig pa dang spyod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi lam 'bras bu brten pa'i las kyi rkyen skyed pa'i rgyu dang mtshan ma/ rmad du byung ba'i stobs bcu/ nod par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba/ byang chub kyi snying po nod par byed cing / nges par pha rol du 'gro bar byed pa de bcom ldan 'das de ni legs so/ / sngags sgrub par byed pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rmi lam na mthong bar byed pa'i mtshan ma de ston pas bshad du gsol/ gang gis rig pa thams cad sgrub pa'i rjes su dpyod pa'i sems can grub pa'i mtshan ma'i las rtsom par byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rig pa thams cad kyi mtshan mar 'gyur ba'o/ /

“Good, O Blessed One! For the sake of those who follow the conduct entailing the ritual divisions of vidyā and homa rites performed at the junctions of the day, you have clearly explained and elucidated with supreme eloquence the path that consists of rites involving vidyā mantras; the path that manifested from the great Cloud of Dharma; the path that comprises the detailed ritual instructions pertaining to the cakravartin, the great vidyārāja who is the heart essence of all the tathāgatas; the path that brings results and fulfills all aims completely; the unsurpassable path that leads to awakening; the path marked with the cause that generates the conditions, actions, and their certain results; the path that is the root of virtue that causes the attainment of the ten miraculous powers, and whose ultimate goal is to ascend to the seat of awakening. That, Blessed One, is excellent! May the teacher please instruct us on the signs that accord with the accomplishment of mantra that appear in dreams, signs indicating the time[1119] when the beings who engage in the practice of all vidyā mantras should commence the activities that cause accomplishment, so that all vidyā mantras‍—the causes that fulfill the rites‍—bear results.”

de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das shAkya thub pas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ / gnod sbyin gyi bdag po khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa dang skye bo mang po la bde ba dang 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i don dang phan pa dang bde ba dang rig pa thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir legs so legs so/ / de legs par rab tu nyon la zung shig dang ngas khyod la bshad do/ /

Thus addressed, Lord Śākyamuni said this to the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi: “Good, O lord of yakṣas! You act[1120] for the benefit and happiness of many people. You act out of compassion for the world, in the interest of great numbers of people, for their benefit and happiness. You act in the interest of all the practitioners of vidyā mantras. Listen well then, and carefully reflect upon what I will now tell you.

dang por re zhig las thams cad kyi sngar 'du 'dzi med pa'i gnas su song ste/ ri'i rtse'am chu bo'i 'gram mam phug gi nang ngam gtsang ba'i phyogs su lo ma'i spyil po byas la/ de nyid kyi cho ga snga ma bzhin du ras ris gzhag cing mchod pa chen po byas la/ las thams cad la yar ngo'i zla phyed dam/ cho 'phrul chen po'i zla phyed la nges par nyin zhag bzang po'i mtshan mo'i thun dang po la/ tsan+dan dkar po dang gur gum dang ga pur gcig tu byas la/ tsan+dan gyi shing gis me rab tu sbar zhing / ras ris kyi mdun du khru bzhi'i tshad tsam gyi me thab la du ba dang sol ba med pa'i me la sreg blugs stong rtsa brgyad kyis sbyin sreg bya'o/ / de nas yang sbyin sreg gi mthar pad+ma'i me tog tsan+dan dkar po'i chus bsang gtor byas pa stong rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o/ / sbyin sreg gi mthar yang bzang po'i gdan dang gdong bkab la rang gi lha la rang gi sngags kyis spyan drang bar bya zhing / sngags 'dis sbyin sreg bya'o/ /

“First, commencing the preparatory procedure as before, which is the same for all types of activity, one should go to a secluded place such as a mountaintop, a riverbank, a cave, or near a crossroad[1121] and build a hut at a clean spot. Following the same procedure as before for all types of activity, one should install the painting and worship it with sumptuous offerings. Then, during the bright fortnight or the prātihāra fortnight, always on an auspicious day, during the first watch of the night, one should prepare a mixture of white sandalwood, camphor, and saffron, and light a fire using sticks of the cutch tree. Sitting in front of the painting at a distance of four cubits,[1122] one should throw the oblation into the smokeless and flameless embers one thousand and eight times. Then, at the end of this offering, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight lotus blossoms smeared with white sandalwood.[1123] At the end of the homa, one should form the mudrā of the auspicious seat and offer a seat to one’s mantra deity, using the same mantra.[1124] One should, however, perform the homa reciting the following mantra.

na maHsarba bud d+hA nAM/ a pra ti ha ta shA sa nA nAM/ tad+ya thA/ oM ku mA ra rU pi Ne dar+sha ya dar+sha ya/ At+ma no b+hu mi mung+d+hA ba swa p+naM me ni be da ya wA b+hu taM/ hU~M hU~M phaT phaT swA hA/

“Homage to all the buddhas, the perfect teachers! The mantra is as follows: “Oṁ, you with the form of a divine youth! Show it, show! Reveal the truth to me in my dreams for the sake of my good fortune! Hūṁ hūṁ! Phaṭ phaṭ! Svāhā![1125]

sngags 'dis srung ba byas shing sbyin sreg gi las thams cad la las bya'o/ / de nas ku sha'i rtse mo gnyis ka phyi rol du bstan te bting la ku sha'i khres kyi sngas byas te mgo shar phyogs su bstan la ras ris kyi mdun nas ha cang yang mi ring ha cang yang mi nye bar nyal bar bya'o/ / thun dang po la mi nyal ba'i sbyor bas rjes su brtson par byas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag byas nas sdig pa rnams so sor bshags te/ sangs rgyas thams cad la bdag nyid phul la/ de nas ji ltar bde bar gnyid kyi dbang du 'gro bar bya'o/ /

“After performing the protection rite using this mantra, one should complete the required number of oblations in the homa rite as just described. Then, having spread around blades of kuśa grass that are pointed at both ends, one should go to sleep in front of the painting, not too far from it and not too near, with one’s head pointing east, using for a pillow a bundle of kuśa grass. During the first watch, while keeping oneself awake, one should salute all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, confess one’s wrongdoings, and offer oneself to all the buddhas. Then,[1126] one should surrender to the power of sleep as one likes.

dang po'i thun gyi rmi lam gang / / bad kan las byung shes par bya/ / gnyis par gang byung mkhris pa ste/ / 'jig rten la yod smad pa yin/ / gsum pa rlung byung shes par bya/ / bzhi pa bden par 'byung ba yin/ / bad kan rmi lam dang po ni/ / 'di 'drar rtag tu mthong ba yin/ / nor bu shel gyi khang pa ni/ / kun nas mu tig phreng ba can/ / a mra'i shing tshogs rab mang po/ / bdag nyid chu nang 'bying bar mthong / / kun nas 'bab chus khyab pa dang / / rgya mtsho chen pos khyab pa dang / / gang du bdag gi lus gnas pa/ / de nyid du ni mthong bar byed/ / gang du phyogs der rdzing dag gis/ / kun nas yongs su khyab pa dang / / gru dang chu ni 'thung ba dang / / btung ba'i khang pa khang pa dang / / kun nas yongs su 'khor bar ni/ / chu chen gyis ni khyer bar mthong / / kha ba can ni byis pa dang / / chu bo chen por shel gnas pa/ / shing dang ri yi rgyal po dang / / shel gyis yongs su bcings pa dang / / mu tig dra bas legs g.yogs dang / / mu tig phung po mthong ba dang / / char chen 'bab dang chu yi tshogs/ / mthong na bad kan las gyur yin/ / gdugs ni dkar po dag dang ni/ / rgyan rnams kun kyang dkar ba dang / /

“Dreams that occur during the first watch Are known to be generated by the humor of phlegm. Those of the second watch, as they arise from bile, Should be discounted as being of worldly origin. “One should know the dreams of the third watch to be generated by the humor of wind, And those of the fourth, to originate from truth. As for the phlegm-influenced dreams at the beginning of sleep, One should always watch out for the following: “One may behold numerous jewel mountains,[1127] Strings of pearls everywhere,[1128] Or oneself bathed In a mass of water, “Fully immersed in streams, Or floating in a great ocean. Wherever one perceives One’s body to be,[1129] “One may see that place as dotted With lotus ponds all around, Floating gardens, And tavern houses[1130] “Riding upon the waves That surround them on all sides. One may also see the Himalayas Made of crystal and abounding in great rivers, “Trees, and the king of mountains Fashioned from piled-up crystal And shaded by a latticework of pearls With masses of pearls. “Subjected to the influence of phlegm, One may see a great rain with masses of water, Or a bright white parasol With white adornments,

ban glang dag ni dkar po'i gzugs/ / bad kan rmi lam dag tu brjod/ / rnga ma dkar ram skyes bu 'am/ / yang na gos dag mthong ba 'am/ / lan tshwa la sogs reg pa ni/ / kun du gal te mthong ba ni/ / ras bal btso ma'i gos dag gam/ / ra gan dngul dang a ga ru/ / reg dang za bar byed pa nyid/ / bad kan rmi lam dag tu 'dod/ / mon sran gre'u za ba dang / / til btags bu ram 'bras can dang / / mon sran rnam mang za ba ni/ / bad kan rmi lam dag tu 'dod/ / swa sti ka dang u lo pi/ / kri sa ra dang 'o thug dang / / de dag za byed rmi lam ni/ / bad kan rmi lam bya ba yin/ / 'breng bu sa bcud bza' ba sogs/ / rnam pa sna tshogs snum khur ni/ / reg dang za bar byed pa nyid/ / bad kan 'phel ba'i rmi lam yin/ / snum khur rnam pa du ma ni/ / bza' dang spyad par rjes 'dod dang / /

“Or perhaps a white elephant.[1131] Such dreams are said to be influenced by phlegm. One may see a white yak-tail whisk, Or a man dressed in white. “If one touches sea salt, and so forth, Or salt in general,[1132] Or a strip of cotton or linen, Or perhaps iron, silver, or aloewood, “Touching or ingesting them Indicates that the dream is of the phlegm type. If one eats roasted beans, Sesame paste, sweet rice pudding, “Or different types of beans, This, again, indicates that the dream is of the phlegm type. Some say that eating svastikā cakes, Or other food, such as rice-and-grain pudding with milk, “Brings on dreams Of the phlegm type. The same goes for śaṅkulya or parpaṭa cakes, Or different types of soup. “Touching or eating them will cause An increase of phlegm in one’s dreams. It is agreed that there are many such types Of hard and soft foods, in many forms.[1133]

zos dang reg par byed de dag / bad kan rmi lam shes par bya/ / gnas dang gnas mal theg pa dang / / bzhon pa sems can las byung ba/ / reg dang 'dzeg par byed pa nyid/ / dang po'i thun la mthong ba nyid/ / gal te rmi lam mthong gyur na/ / thams cad bad kan can du brjod/ / rnam pa de lta'i rmi lam dang / / chu la 'byung dang spyod pa dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs bza' la spyod/ / mthong na bad kan can du brjod/ /

“If one eats or touches them, The dreams will be induced by phlegm. If one dreams of a seat, a bed, or a carriage for traveling That is fashioned from a living being‍— “If one touches, mounts, or sees such During the first watch of the night As objects in one’s dream, All such dreams are said to be influenced by phlegm. “Dreams of these types emerge from And are effected by water, And may be an indication of [having eaten] Any of the various hard or soft foods that produce phlegm.[1134]
de dag rmi lam dag tu mthong / / bad kan can gyi spyod pa yin/ / rmi lam ma lus du ma ni/ / 'jig rten mgon pos gsungs pa yin/ /
“Seeing these objects in one’s dreams Is due to the action of phlegm-producing foods. The guides of the world have described Many dreams that are hard even to conceive of.[1135]

gnyis pa'i thun la lus can gyi/ / rmi lam mkhris pa can gyi yin/ / 'bar ba'i me yi gzugs mthong dang / / sna tshogs rin chen mthong ba dang / / mes tshig skar mda' ltung ba dang / / ri dang phyogs ni rab 'bar ba/ / skye bo gang gis rab mthong ba/ / de ni mkhris par gyur pa yin/ / rin chen pad+ma rA ga dang / / gzhan yang rin chen gang yin pa/ / gang du rmi lam mthong na ni/ / lus can mkhris pa las gyur yin/ / me dang tsha ba sten pa dang / / reg dang za bar byed pa dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs kha dog ser/ / rmi lam mkhris pas brgyal ba yin/ /

“For living beings, it is in the second watch That dreams related to bile occur. A person may see in a dream a blazing fire, A light emanating from various jewels,[1136] “A conflagration, or meteors Flashing in all directions.[1137] Seeing these in a dream indicates that One is debilitated[1138] by bile. “Likewise, should one see in one’s dream a ruby, Or something else consisting of jewels,[1139] One should know that these objects appear To someone affected by bile. “Corresponding to the experience of the element fire, If one touches or ingests[1140] Different yellow articles in one’s dreams, One is debilitated by bile.

rtag tu tsha ba'i nyi ma dang / / nyi ma rtag tu 'de bar ni/ / gang gis rmi lam mthong gyur na/ / lus can mkhris pa las gyur yin/ / nam mkha' gser gyi mdog gyur dang / / sa yi steng ni kha dog ser/ / rmi lam na ni gang gis mthong / / mkhris pa las gyur na ba yin/ / me ni kun nas 'bar ba yis/ / nam mkha'i ngos nas rab gsal bar/ / rmi lam dus su mthong ba ni/ / mkhris pas gnod pa'i lus can yin/ /

“One whose body is debilitated by bile May see in one’s dream A sun that burns uninterruptedly, Continually spreading its intense heat. “One may also perceive, in one’s dream, The sky as being of golden color And the ground as yellow. This is due to the debilitating influence of bile. “If one dreams, during the same watch, Of a fire blazing all around And illuminating the firmament of the sky, One is flooded with the humor bile.

sa dang de bzhin ri bo dang / / brag ni mthon po'ang gser gyi mdog / shing chen de bzhin theg pa ni/ / rtag tu thams cad gser rang bzhin/ / rtag tu rmi lam gnas mthong na/ / mkhris pa las gyur rmi lam yin/ / theg pa rgyan dang bzhon pa dang / / snod rnams gser gyi rang bzhin dang / / stan rnams dang ni gnas mal rnams/ / sa le sbram gyi rang bzhin la/ / reg dang 'gro bar byed pa nyid/ / rmi lam mthong na mkhris gyur yin/ / phreng ba ser po thogs pa dang / / ser po'i gos kyis nyer mdzes dang / / ser po'i 'od dang dri yis byugs/ / ser po'i mchod phyir thogs pa dang / / bdag nyid ser po'i rnam pa dang / / gang gis rmi lam la mthong ba/ / gnyis pa'i thun du mthong na ni/ / mkhris pa las gyur shes par bya/ /

“One may see the ground colored golden, Or the mountains, piles of rocks, A great elephant for riding,[1141] Or everything made entirely of gold. “If one sees these persistently while asleep, One is debilitated by the movement of bile. If one dreams of a vessel made entirely of gold; Or a golden carriage with similar adornments; “Or a seat, or perhaps a bed Made entirely of gold‍— If one touches or mounts them in one’s dream, This indicates that the dream is of the bile type. “One may see oneself in a dream as wearing Yellow garlands and clothes, Covered in yellow unguents, And provided with a yellow sacred cord; “One may also see in one’s dream One’s own body as yellow. This is due to the debilitating influence of bile, Which manifests itself during the second watch.

de bzhin rnam pa sna tshogs pa/ / gang gzhan rmi lam dag tu brjod/ / rnam pa sna tshogs ser por snang / / rmi lam mkhris las yang dag byung / / mkhris pas lus can rab gnon pa/ / gnyis pa'i thun la bstan pa yin/ / rnam pa du ma'i gzugs can ni/ / ser por snang ba yang dag 'byung / / 'jig rten gtso bos gsungs pa ni/ / rmi lam mkhris las yang dag byung / / gang yang rlung byung rmi lam ni/ / gsum pa'i thun du bstan pa yin/ / 'khor yug tu ni 'od 'phro ba/ / phyogs rnams kun du rab tu snang / / nam mkha' la ni 'gro ba dang / / nam mkha'i dkyil du thad drang 'gro/ / bar snang nam mkha'i dkyil du ni/ / kun nas 'khor bar rtag tu 'gro/ / rlung byung rmi lam zhes bstan pa/ / 'di lta bu la bya ba yin/ /

“These are the different categories That dreams are grouped into based on color.[1142] Thus, the dreams of the various appearances of yellow Are caused by the humor bile. “The body’s being affected by bile Manifests during the second watch. A great variety of forms Arising out of yellow light “Have been taught by the most eminent of men To originate from bile. As for the dreams that are of the wind type, They are said to occur during the third watch of the night. “If one sees all the directions Completely filled with light, And perceives oneself as moving through space, Traversing the firmament of the sky, “And continually wandering everywhere Through space as far as the expanse of the sky, Such a dream is said to be of the wind type, As it brings this type of experience.

rgal dang mchong dang de bzhin du/ / shing rnams la ni mngon par 'dzeg / bstan bcos ma lus 'don pa dang / / khyad par du ni sngags rnams dang / / bshad dang brjod par byed pa dag / phal cher yang ni rlung las gyur/ / shing rnams tsher ma can 'dzeg dang / / kha ba dag kyang za ba dang / / bza' ba ma lus tsha dang skyur/ / zos pa rlung las gyur pa yin/ / gtsor yang rlung ni yang dag 'byung / / shing thog rlung ni rab bskyed pa/ / de dag za bar rmi lam mthong / / rlung las byung bar yang dag bstan/ / dngos rnams rlung ni skyed pa yi/ / bza' dang bca' ba khyad par ldan/ / de bzhin skye bo sems 'khrugs dang / / reg par byed dang smra bar byed/ / 'byung po rnams ni gar byed dang / / bdag nyid kyang ni gar byed pa/ / gang gis rmi lam mthong na ni/ / de 'dra rlung nad can du shes/ /

“Swimming,[1143] jumping, Climbing trees, Reciting all treatises, The mantras in particular, “And also teaching or speaking, Are generally caused by wind. Also, climbing thorny trees, Or eating food that is very bitter, “Pungent, or sour‍—any such type of food‍— Is caused by wind. Tree fruits that are scattered by the wind Produce masses of the humor of wind[1144]‍— “If they are eaten in a dream, Such a dream is said to be generated by wind. The element wind present in Liquid and solid foods and substances[1145] “Agitates the minds of beings When they touch or eat them. If one sees oneself As being a servant to all beings, “If this vision comes in a dream, Such a person should be known to be of the wind type.[1146]

rnam pa sna tshogs spyod pa dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs 'khyud dang smra/ / rnam pa sna tshogs mi bzad gzugs/ / rmi lam rlung nad can gyis mthong / / de la sogs pa'i rmi lam ni/ / 'jig rten mchog gis gsungs pa yin/ / rnam gsum sbyor ba rab ldan pa/ / 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug yin/ / chags can bad kan can shes bya/ / zhe sdang las byung mkhris pa can/ / rmongs pa rlung las gyur pa yin/ / 'dres pa 'ang rnam par 'dres pa'o/ / grong gi chos ni mthong ba las/ / rmi lam chags pas sa bon byung / /

Different types of movements, Different types of embracing and speaking, “Or different harsh expressions[1147] Indicate that the dream is the wind type. These and other types of dreams Have been taught by the most eminent of men. “Three types of associations have been taught Related to those who are of the attached, hateful, or deluded types: Those with a proclivity to attachment generate phlegm, Bile is the product of hatred, “While wind originates from delusion. A mixture of the three generates a mixture of humors. When attachment is stirred in sleep, It will manifest as sexual dreams.[1148]

der ni bud med la chags pa/ / bad kan las byung rmi lam yin/ / rtsod bcas dang tshul zhe sdang can/ / mkhris pa las byung rmi lam yin/ / ma rig las byung rmongs rnam pa/ / dran pa nyams par mthong ba yin/ / rnam 'dres rnam par 'dres pa ni/ / rmi lam na ni rtag tu mthong / / de bas rnam pa thams cad kyis/ / rmi lam zhes bya yod pa spangs/ / bya ba dus kyi rim pa nyid/ / de nyid gzigs pas bstan pa yin/ /

“Thus, the desire for women will manifest In dreams generated by phlegm. Quarreling based on hatred Will occur in dreams generated by bile. “Torpidity born from delusion Manifests in dreams as the loss of memory. In reality, though, dreams always manifest Based on a mixture of the humors.[1149] “Thus, that which is designated as a dream Is devoid, in all its [three] types, of pure essence.[1150] Those who teach the truth taught the activities and lifespans Particular to each of the [humor-based] category of beings.[1151]

sems can bad kan can gsungs pa/ / mdog ldan snyan par smra ba dang / / tshe ring yid ni gzhungs pa dang / / kha dog snum zhing 'jigs pa med/ / bong tshod ring zhing dkar ba dang / / bud med la phrad rtag tu dga'/ / chos ldan rtag tu dpa' ba dang / / btung ba mang la rtag tu dga'/ / rgyal rigs su ni bstan pa yin/ / ser sna ldan zhing mtshon pa med/ /

“Thus, beings described as being of the phlegm type Have a nice complexion and are soft-spoken. They live long lives, are intelligent,[1152] Have oily skin, and are self-confident. “They are fair skinned, tall, And always fond of intercourse with women. They are virtuous, heroic at any time, And always delight in showing respect.[1153] “When this is indicated by their birth horoscope,[1154] They could be jealous and lack distinction.[1155]

de bzhin sa yi bdag po dang / / dmag dpon don du gnas pa ste/ / longs spyod chen po skye 'gyur zhing / / rang gi las kyis nye bar 'tshe/ / rang gi las 'bras bstan pa ni/ / las kyi sngags ni spang ba min/ / las min sngags ni gtso bo zhes/ / 'jig rten 'dren pas gsungs pa yin/ / de bas sems can bad kan can/ / sa steng grub pa byed pa ni/ / sa bdag 'dod pa byed pa la/ / de la grub pa thob par 'gyur/ /

Some may become kings Fit to take command of an army. “Living according to their prescribed activity, They will attain prosperity. Their activities and their fruits are described as follows: They do not neglect the activity [in favor of] the mantra, As the mantra, according to what the guides of the world have said, Is not the most important thing in terms of activity.[1156] “It is therefore said that in this world Success belongs to those of the phlegm type. They will attain dominion over the land, Great prosperity, and magical powers.[1157]

zlos pas bad kan can gyi zas/ / ma lus bsten par mi bya'o/ / gang phyir shin tu bsten gyur na/ / rmi lam don gyis stong 'gyur bas/ / grub pa'i don du ma brjod pas/ / sngags pas de tshe de mi bsten/ / mkhas pa rigs pa ldan pa yis/ / de yi dus su gnyid log min/ / mkhris pa can gyi sems can gyi/ / rtag tu spyod pa brjod par bya/ / zhe sdang gis ni rnam 'khrugs na/ / kha dog nag dang stobs chung dang / / drag pa drag pa'i las dang ni/ / rtag tu yon por byed pa yin/ / dpa' dang bab col rtag tu byed/ / stobs dang blo dang ldan pa dang / / mang du smra zhing grogs po mang / / bstan bcos ting 'dzin mang po rtogs/ / chos ldan las kyi mtha' brtan zhing / / zhe sdang slong ba rjod par byed/ / yid ldan dgra ni mang ba dang / / zhe sdang mtshon pa skye bar 'gyur/ / nor mang dpa' bo la sdang dang / / 'jig rten shes shing mthong na dga'/ / des grol chags pa med pa dang / / brtan cing sdug bsngal rtag tu bzod/ / nga rgyal phrag dog ma rungs pa/ / bud med rnams la dga' bar byed/ / spro chen brtan dang blon po dang / / longs spyod chen por skye bar 'gyur/ /

“A mantra reciter should not take Any of the phlegm-producing foods in excess. If one overindulges in these foods, One’s dreams will become bereft of meaning. “A mantra practitioner should therefore not indulge in these foods, As they are said not to be conducive to accomplishment. A wise and clever person Should not sleep at that time. “Now the characteristics of a person Of the bile type will be described. “He may be prone to hatred and anger, Of black complexion, and physically weak. He may be cruel and engage in cruel activities And continually display a tendency toward deceit. “He may also be continually valiant and daring And be endowed with strength and intelligence. He is talkative, has many friends, And has a deep understanding of many treatises. “Virtuous and firm in his actions, He is also described as prone to hatred. He is intelligent and possessed of great power, But shows the signs of hatred. “He resents the valorous, is wealthy,[1158] Understands human nature, And is of pleasant appearance, free, detached, Stable, and always tolerant of suffering. “Proud, greedy, and angry, He is always fond of women. Full of great energy and firm in applying the mantras,[1159] He becomes very prosperous.

shes bzhin las kyis nyer spyod pa'i/ / sems can zil gyis mnan nas spyod/ / sngags ni srog la gnod byed pa/ / de ni de la myur 'grub 'gyur/ / mi bzad thub pas spangs pa'i don/ / myur du sgrub par byed pa yin/ / sems can gnod phyir byed pa'i las/ / lus can de la grub par 'gyur/ / cho ga sbyar ba'i chos rnams gang / / sngags pas thams cad rab sbyar na/ / spyod pa des ni 'grub 'gyur te/ / gzhan las sems can de la min/ /

“He engages beings by assaulting them, As they submit to the way he acts.[1160] His mantras‍—those that arrest the life force of beings‍— Are always successful. “He swiftly accomplishes his violent aims That have been rejected[1161] by the Sage. The activities of such an individual‍— Those that harm living beings‍—will succeed. “Rites of any mantra practitioner That involve ritual methods Will be successful when executed carefully, Which is not the case for other individuals and rites.[1162]

sngags pa zhe sdang can dag la/ / sems can gzhan la gnod pa dang / / de bzhin gzhan gyi sngags gcod pa/ / sems can khro ba la grub 'gyur/ / gzhan gyi rdzas ni 'phrog don dang / / gzhan gyi srog ni gcod pa la/ / khro ba'i sngags kyis grub 'gyur te/ / sngags gzhan dag la sbyar mi bya/ / zhe sdang rigs kyi sems can 'di/ / bdag po nyid kyang byed par 'gyur/ / mdog nag pa'am sngo bsangs sam/ / dkar ba'am yang na 'dres pa yi/ / mi ni khro ldan gser gyi mdog / rnam par spangs pa skye bar 'gyur/ / mi ni rtsub mdog du ba'i mdog / ser skya'i mdog tu'ang skye ba yin/ / dpa' dang de bzhin drag pa dang / / 'dab chags sdig pa'i khyim las skyes/ / gza' ni mig dmar zhing bdag gnas/ / bad kan can la phur bu'i bdag / skye 'gyur nyung ngu za ba dang / / tsha dang skyur ba'i ro bsten cing / / de yi tshe ni ring 'gyur zhing / / dran dang ldan pa skye bar 'gyur/ / spyod pa dang ni rjes spyod pa/ / rlung nad can gyi bshad par bya/ / mdog mi sdug dang rtsub mdog dang / / bong tshod med cing shin tu rjud/ / blo nyams shes rab med pa dang / / mi brtan gnas pa med pa dang / / lus ni 'gul dang 'khor ba dang / / skyug cing bshang gci mang du 'byung / /

“So, too, the hateful mantras That oppress other beings Can, by the same token, interrupt the mantras of others And succeed against angry beings. “Wrathful mantras will be successful In seizing the property of others Or arresting their life force; Such activities should not be combined with other mantras. “A being predisposed to hatred Can attain dominion over others; He may be of a black, dark,[1163] White, or mixed complexion. “An ordinary human predisposed to anger Cannot possibly have a golden complexion; Such a person will have a rough and smoke-colored Or tawny complexion. “One born in the sign of Scorpio Is heroic, cruel, and lustful,[1164] Being in the house of the planet Mars. One who is under the influence of Jupiter is predisposed to phlegm. “Such a person will eat little And be fond of pungent and sour tastes. His life will be long And his memory good. “Now I will describe the activities and mannerisms Of a person by nature predisposed to wind. He has an unhealthy or rough complexion But, in general, is not too weak. “He is of feeble intellect and little knowledge, Unstable, and ungrounded. With a trembling body, tottering, He vomits a lot and frequently defecates and urinates.

mang du za zhing rtag par za/ / de dag gang phyir nad mang 'gyur/ / 'jig rten rigs dang mi mthun zhing / / dgra ni mang po skye bar 'gyur/ / de ni sa steng 'di dag tu/ / tshul 'chal sdug bsngal skye 'gyur te/ / mi snang ba yi sngags dag ni/ / de la 'grub par bstan pa yin/ / gang zhig rlung nad 'khrug byed pa'i/ / zas la de ni dga' bar 'gyur/ / zlos pa las ni grub 'dod pas/ / de ni yongs su bsten mi bya/ / sems can rlung nad 'khrug pa la/ / gti mug nye bar zhi ba dang / / rmongs pa'i rigs can la gsungs pa/ / rmongs pa'i sngags ni rab sgrub pa/ / rtag tu de dag rmongs pa la/ / rmongs pa dag ni 'grub par 'dod/ / rgyu skar khyim ni chu skyes dang / / gza' ni bdag po spen par blta/ /

“He eats a lot and all the time, And he talks a lot.[1165] Being hostile to everyone, He has many enemies. “He is undisciplined and unhappy In his life on earth. Mantras for becoming invisible Are said to succeed if used by him. “He delights in foods That stir up the humor of wind. A mantra reciter should, however, never eat them, If he wants his activity to be successful. “Beings agitated due to the humor of wind Are predisposed to the arising of ignorance.[1166] They are described as belonging to the delusion type, And become accomplished in stupefying mantras.[1167] “For those who are of the deluded type, It is always desired to be accomplished in causing stupefaction. One should ascertain the asterisms of the water signs To know the true significance of planetary influences.[1168]

rlung nad skyes pa'i sems can ni/ / dge ba'i las la mi spyod de/ / 'byung po dbang dang 'gugs par byed/ / de bzhin rmongs dang rengs pa'o/ / rlung nad can gyi sems can la/ / gti mug can de sdig pa byed/ / rmi lam bden par mthong ba ni/ / mtshan nyid 'di dag gsungs pa ni/ / sems can rnams kyi don sgrub pa/ / thub pa rnams kyi sngon gsungs pa'o/ / lug glang dang ni sbyor ba dang / / sbal pa seng ge nyid dang ni/ / srang dang bu mo sdig pa dang / / de bzhin gzhu dang chu srin dang / / bum pa nya dang glang po dang / / lha dang spre'u lha ma yin/ / grub dang dri za gnod sbyin sogs/ / mi rnams gang gis rab bsgrags pa/ / sems can rnams kyi khyim mang po/ / gang zag mchog gis gsungs pa yin/ / rnam pa mang po sna tshogs don/ / rnam pa sna tshogs las bstan pa/ / de dag las ni thams cad la/ / yon tan rgya cher sman par 'gyur/ / las las gol ba med par ni/ / lus can yon tan mi smin te/ / yon tan kho na las ldan pas/ / skye bar yang ni byed pa yin/ /

“One should not perform peaceful[1169] activities If one is of the wind type and confused.[1170] Likewise, one should not perform the enthralling, Attracting, stupefying, or destroying of beings. “Regarding the arising of delusion-generated evil In beings dominated by the humor of wind, The following signs have been taught That indicate the truth in dreams. “They have been previously described by sages As serving the interests of beings. Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, “Libra, Virgo, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, Pisces, the elephants, The celestials, the monkeys, the asuras, “The siddhas, the gandharvas, the yakṣas, and so forth‍— All those renowned to humanity‍— The zodiac signs have been taught By the supreme ones to the masses. “Different activities have been described, Of many types and various purposes. In all these activities and the accumulated karma, A wide range of qualities comes to fruition. “It has been taught that for ordinary beings No activity is devoid of such qualities. Thus, one who engages in activities takes rebirth Based on the qualities [of his karma].[1171]

yon tan chos don ldan pa ni/ / sngags la 'grub pa skye bar 'gyur/ / zlos pa sems can yon tan shes/ / yon tan yon tan min las 'ching / / yon tan med la bya min gang / / de yi las ni bya ba min/ / gang phyir bya ba las byed de/ / bya ba yon tan med ma yin/ / bya ba las dang yon tan nyid/ / yang dag ldan pa sgrub par 'gyur/ / cho ga sngon 'gro bya ba'i las/ / stobs bcu ldan pas sngon bstan to/ / rdzas dang sems can spyod pa gzhan/ / bya ba las dang yon tan yin/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rmi lam tshul/ / las las 'byung bar snang ba yin/ /

“When these qualities are infused with religious merit, The practice of mantras will be successful. The reciter who understands the true nature of such qualities Understands the merits and defects of his karmic bonds.[1172] “If the authentic ritual procedure is not performed, The activity will not take place, even if the qualities are present. This is because the ritual produces the activity; Such ritual is not without its qualities.[1173] “One who possesses the karmic qualities For performing rituals will succeed.[1174] Such ritual activities, along with their procedures, Have been formerly taught by those with the ten powers. “The karmic qualities for [performing specific] rites Are indicated by the beings’ behavioral tendencies.[1175] The different forms they see in dreams are regarded, similarly, As the products of their karmic activities.

de bas rmi lam mtshan ma yis/ / rgya che las la rab sbyar bya/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa dang / / yid 'ong blta na sdug pa dang / / bgegs kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa/ / rmi lam rgyur ni snang ba yin/ / mthu che spro ba che ba ni/ / mi ni grub pa 'dod pa yin/ / mchog dang tha ma 'bring dag ni/ / de dag la ni grub par brtag / drag cing ma rungs las rnams ni/ / rmi lam rtag tu 'phral du smin/ / bzang po brtan pa'i las dag ni/ / yun ring dus su grub phyir ro/ / 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das rnams kyis/ / yon tan skye bar yang dag 'byung / /

“Thus, based on the signs received in dreams, One can determine the full range of activities to engage in. Signs of different forms, Some pleasing and nice to look at, “Others ugly, or with forms of obstacles,[1176] Will appear in dreams. People who desire accomplishments Should be very enthusiastic and diligent. “The accomplishments will come to them In terms of being of the highest, medium, or lowest range. Activities that are violent and cruel[1177] Always bring on dreams immediately [indicative] of the ripening fruits. “Regarding the highest, steadfast activities, They will be accomplished after a long time. Worldly activities of those who are predominantly worldly Will produce [corresponding karmic] qualities.[1178]

rmi lam rnam pa sna tshogs snang / / zlos pas sngags rnams 'grub par 'gyur/ / mi 'grub don du sngags rnams ni/ / gnyid dang snyom pa rab tu brtag / bgegs 'joms byed pa'i sngags rnams ni/ / de yi dus su rab tu brtag / de tshe sngags ni rigs tshul gyis/ / zlos pas de tshe rab tu sbyar/ / khro bo chen po phyag drug dang / / zhal drug nyid du brtag par bya/ / sngags chen yi ge bzhi pa ni/ / gzhon nu'i gzugs la gnas pa yin/ / drag po'i gzugs ni gzugs chen po/ / phag gi rnam par yang dag 'byung / / bgegs kun rnam par gzhig bya'i phyir/ / dus mtshan de ni lha yi rgyal/ / stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can/ / sbrul gyi gdengs ka rnam par 'phyang / / lag na ral gri sems dpa' che/ / gzi brjid chen po gshin rje'i gzugs/ / bgegs rnams kun la gtse bar byed/ / log 'dren rnams kyi srog 'phrog byed/ / 'byung po kun ni rab nyon cig / mi bzad sngags ni bshad par bya/ / cho 'phrul chen po bgegs rnams kun/ / ma rungs sems can 'jig par byed/ / sngags rnams kun ni sgrub byed pa/ / lha yi tshogs rnams nga la nyon/ /

“There are many dreams that occur to mantra reciters That indicate their accomplishment of the mantra. Lethargic sleep portends that The mantra will not be accomplished. “In that situation it is recommended to recite The mantra that destroys the obstacles. One should employ at that time A mantra that is appropriate for reciters. “The prescribed [mantra] is the six-armed And six-faced [Mañjuśrī] Mahākrodha. His four-syllable great mantra Resides within his youthful form. “He is of a terrible aspect and very frightening,[1179] Manifesting in a form of a boar In order to destroy the obstacles; Black as night,[1180] he is the king of gods. “He is dressed in a tiger skin And adorned with snakes with expanded hoods. This great being holds a sword in his hand And appears in the form of Death of great splendor. “He is tough on all obstacle makers And ends the life of vināyakas. Hear, all the beings, his mantra, The fiercest in the tantras.[1181] “This mantra removes all obstacles From any given being.[1182] It accomplishes all mantras. Assembled gods, hear me!

na maHsa man+ta bud d+hA nAM/ a pra ti ha ta shA sa nA nAM/ tad+ya thA/ he he ma hA kro d+ha Sha Na mu khA Sh+Ta tsa ra Na/ sarba big+ha na big+hA na g+hA ta ka hU~M hU~M/ kiny+tsi ra ya si bi nA ya ka dzI bi tAn+ta ka raduHswA b+naM me nA sha ya/ la hu la hu sa ma ya ma nu sma ra phaT phaT swA hA/

“Homage to all the buddhas, the perfect teachers! The mantra is: “He he, Mahākrodha! The six-faced, six-legged destroyer of all obstacles, hūṁ hūṁ! Why do you tarry? O destroyer of the life of vināyakas, destroy my bad dreams! Lunge forward, lunge! Remember your pledge! Phaṭ phaṭ, svāhā!”[1183]

khro bo'i rgyal po chen pos 'di gsungs ma thag tu bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad 'jigs shing nyam thag nas/ snying gas te yid shin tu skrag nas/ bcom ldan 'das shAkya thub pa dang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed cing dam tshig la gnas par gyur to/ / de nas bcom 'das shAkya thub pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang la gzigs nas/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ /

As soon as this king, the Lord of Wrath,[1184] was pronounced, all the vināyakas and obstructers became disturbed and frightened. With fainting hearts and panicked minds, they paid homage to Lord Śākyamuni and Mañjuśrī, the divine youth, and remained samaya-bound to them. Lord Śākyamuni then looked at the entire realm of the Pure Abode, and said this to the great assembly of his followers:

kye kye lha'i tshogs chen po dag khro bo'i rgyal po 'di ni/ 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi sngags rnams 'don par byed pa na gang zhig ma rungs pa'i sems can gyi gzugs can gyis rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa de la/ khro bo'i rgyal po 'dis ni rigs rgyud thams cad 'dul bar byed cing / srog kyang 'dzin par mi byed de/ yongs su gdung bar byed cing / yongs su skem par byed pa'i rnam par gzhag par bya ba la 'jog par byed cing / zlos pa dag la yang srung ba dang sba ba dang sbed pa la gnas par 'jog par byed cing / rjes su 'phel bar byed pa dang gang zhig dam tshig 'di las 'da' bar byed pa dang khro bo'i rgyal pos sgrub pa po srung bar byas pa la rnam par tho 'tsham par byed na/

“Ho ho, assembly of gods! He is the Lord of Wrath. While any of the worldly or transcendent mantras are being accomplished, the Lord of Wrath will tame any evil being that causes harm to the reciter, along with the culprit’s family. He will cause them to wither but will not take their lives.[1185] Having burnt them and dried them up, he will assign a role to them, appointing them to protect, support, and guard the reciter. The being thus appointed will have to sustain the reciter. Any such being who would transgress this obligation and harm the practitioner who is under the protection of the Lord of Wrath

mgo bo a rdza ka'i dog pa bzhin du rnam pa bdun du 'gas par 'gyur ro/ / thub pa mchog gis de gsungs nas/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs la de tshe gsungs/ / gzhon nu khyod kyi sngags rnams la/ / ma lus don ni rgya chen don/ / sngags rgyud don dang ldan pa dang / / sgrub pa rnams la khyad par du/ / bgegs rnams ma lus 'joms pa yi/ / rgyud la khro rgyal bstan pa yin/ / 'jig rten mgon gyis sngon 'di ni/ / de bzhin du ni yang dag sbyar/ / ma lus bgegs rnams 'jig bya'i phyir/ / dgra rnams kyi ni khro ba sel/ / zlos pas rtag tu 'don byas na/ /

“Will have his head split into seven pieces by the Lord of Wrath, Like a garland of arjaka tree blossoms.”[1186] Having spoken thus, the foremost one among sages Said this to Mañjughoṣa: “Divine youth! Your mantras fulfill All aims, the whole range of aims, Especially for practitioners who Pursue the aims of the mantra system. “This mantra has been taught by the Lord of Wrath in the tantras As the one that destroys all obstacles. It has been formerly employed For this purpose by the lords of the world, the buddhas, “Namely for destroying evil obstacle makers And appeasing the anger of enemies. For the reciters it is necessary To always recite it at nighttime.[1187]

sems can rnams ni srung don dang / / rmi lam ngan pa sel bar byed/ / sngags rnams ma lus sgrub pa la/ / 'jig rten mchog gis gsungs pa yin/ / de nas gzhan yang rab bshad pa/ / skyes bu'i mtshan nyid bzang po yin/ / gang la sngags rnams 'grub 'gyur ba/ / mchog dang tha ma bar ma 'o/ /

“It affords protection to sentient beings And destroys bad dreams. It has been taught by the supreme among people, the buddhas, As being able to accomplish the aims of all mantras. “I will further teach The auspicious characteristics of men For whom the mantras are successful‍— Those of the highest, medium, and the lowest types.

gzi brjid ldan dang shes ldan dang / / gser mdog gsus pa che ba dang / / dkyus ring mig dang snum pa dang / / chags chung khro ba rnam par spangs/ / mig mtha' dmar zhing snyan par smra/ / de la grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ / pags pa srab cing sngo bsangs mdog / ha cang ring min yan lag phra/ / spro ba che zhing gzi brjid che/ / chog shes kun nas dge ba byed/ / skye gnas bzang po dag pa dang / / 'dod pa chung zhing cung zad dge/ / las rnams kun du snang ba ni/ / de la nges par grub pa mchog / yan lag thams cad ma tshang med/ / dUr ba sngo sangs gzi brjid che/ / nyon mongs med sems shes pa can/ / rtag tu gtsang zhing tshangs par spyod/ / phra ba'i gos la rtag tu dga'/ / chos kyi ngang tshul 'jig rten shes/ / grogs mang rtag tu gtong ba dang / / zas tshod rig dag rtag gtsang ldan/ / shes nyen tshul khrims spyod pa dang / / gtsang ba'i spyod la rtag tu dga'/ / bden par smra zhing snying rje can/ / de la grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ /

“One who is energetic and intelligent; Has a golden complexion, a large belly, Elongated eyes, and smooth skin; Is dispassionate and free of anger; “Has red eye-corners and speaks nicely, For him accomplishment is of the highest type. One with delicate skin, a dark complexion, And slim limbs that are not too long; “Who is full of enthusiasm and energy, Content, virtuous in every respect, And pure on the account of his high birth; Who has few desires, and is of weak constitution,[1188] “His accomplishment is certain‍— It will be of the highest kind in all activities. One whose body is not in any way inferior; Who is dark as panic grass, full of vigor, “Untroubled in mind, intelligent, Always celibate and pure, And always fond of fine[1189] clothes; Who knows the ways of the world, is disciplined, “Has many friends, is always detached, And eats moderately;[1190] And who is pure, skilled, and moral, Always enjoys pure conduct, “Speaks the truth, and is compassionate Will reach the highest type of accomplishment.

yon tan rgya che yan lag tshang / / rigs ldan rtag tu chos dang ldan/ / ma dang pha la gus pa dang / / bram ze la ni mchod pa byed/ / shin tu snying rje ldan zhing brtan/ / de la'ang grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ / sngo sangs dkar dang snum pa dang / / rtag tu gtsang zhing nyung ngu smra/ / bsod pa'i kha zas la dga' zhing / / gtsang ba'i spyod pas mngon par 'gro/ / mang 'dod sems can 'jig rten shis/ / de la'ang grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ /

One not missing any limbs, full of qualities, Born to a good family, always adhering to the Dharma, “Devoted to his mother and father, Reverential toward brahmins and guests,[1191] Very compassionate, and steadfast Will reach the highest type of accomplishment. “One of pure, dark complexion and smooth skin, Who speaks little and always remains pure, Wants only the food and drink that are pure, Has sex only with pure partners,[1192] “Knows the ways of the world, and is highly respected Will reach the highest type of accomplishment.

ha cang mi thung ring ba'ang min/ / sku ni mig sman bzhin du gnag / mig dang mig 'bras rab tu snum/ / gtsang zhing rtag tu khrus la dga'/ / dkon mchog gsum la shin tu dad/ / de yi grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ / mchog gi las ni rab ston cing / / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes/ / bzod ldan snyan par smra ba dang / / rgyal ba'i sras la rab tu dga'/ / de tshe 'jig rten 'das pa grub/ / de la 'bras bcas grub par 'gyur/ /

One who is neither too short nor too tall, Has hair[1193] as black as antimony powder, “Has loving eyes, is pure, Always enjoys bathing, And is propitiatory toward the Three Jewels Will reach the highest type of accomplishment. “One who engages in noble activities, Who is a refuge to sentient beings and knows their minds, And who is forbearing, polite in speech, And reverent toward bodhisattvas‍— He will reach a supramundane accomplishment That is rich in results.[1194]

sems dpa' che zhing brtson 'grus che/ / gzi brjid che zhing brtul zhugs che/ / longs spyod che zhing sngags rnams shes/ / sngags rnams kun la de nyid rig / rigs kyi mchog ni rgyal rigs sam/ / bram ze shes dang ldan pa dang / / bud med la brten de la chags/ / de bzhin gser gyi mdog dang ldan/ / bong tshod che zhing dkar ba dang / / sna ni mtho zhing lag pa che/ / dpa' zhing lag pa ring ba dang / / rgyal po che la mngon par 'dod/ / rgyal ba'i sras la dad pa dang / / bud med mig ldan lha la mchod/ / dkon mchog gsum la gus pa dang / / byang chub sems kyis brgyan pa yin/ / lhag par snying rje brtan pa dang / / cung zad khro zhing cung zad rmongs/ / longs spyod che zhing gtong ba che/ / gzi brjid che zhing thul bar dka'/ / bud med rnams ni dga' dang dpa'/ / de yi grub pa'ang mchog yin no/ /

“One who is very honest, heroic, And full of vigor; who has undertaken solemn vows; Who is endowed with good fortune, knows the mantras, And understands the essence of all the tantras;[1195] “Who belongs to the kṣatriya caste Or is an exemplary brahmin; who is intelligent, Cavorts with women, is always passionate, Has a golden complexion, “Appears tall and fair skinned, And has a long nose, big arms, And dangling forearms; who is valiant, Aspires to rule a great kingdom, “Is reverent toward bodhisattvas, Has a woman’s name,[1196] worships goddesses,[1197] And is devoted to the Three Jewels, Adorned with bodhicitta, Very compassionate, steadfast, And has a certain amount of anger and ignorance; “And who is endowed with good fortune, profoundly detached, Of great vigor, difficult to subdue,[1198] Beloved by women, and valiant Will also win accomplishment of the highest type.

shin tu btung dang dga' dang dpa'/ / rtag tu bud med la chags dang / / gser gyi mdog dang byin pa phra/ / rked pa che zhing gtsang ba dang / / brtse dang snying rje ldan mkhas pa/ / yon tan mang 'dod 'jig rten shes/ / rtag tu sngags rnams zlos la gus/ / rgyal ba la ni srog kyang gtong / / de bzhin nyan thos sras rnams dang / / bse ru la yang rtag tu gtong / / stobs ldan 'jig rten gtso bo dang / / rigs ni gnyis pa bzang po yin/ / yan lag thams cad ma tshang med/ / ma rungs rtag tu bab col byed/ / gtong ldan tshul ldan dgra las rgyal/ / chos dang chos min rnam dpyod byed/ / ha cang sbom min rjud pa'ang min/ / ha cang ring min thung ba'ang min/ / bar ma'i mi ni mchog yin te/ / de yi grub pa mchog tu 'gyur/ /

“One who is valiant, delights in drinking, Always is in the company of women, Is of golden complexion, lives on little food,[1199] Has broad hips, and is pure, “Compassionate, caring, skillful, Knowing in the ways of the world, highly esteemed for his qualities, Always dedicated to reciting the mantras, Willing to give up his life for the victorious lords[1200] “And also for their sons, the śrāvakas, As well as to the pratyekabuddhas; Who is mighty, eminent among men, Belongs to the pure second caste,[1201] “And is complete with all the limbs of his body, Always cruel and rash,[1202] Detached, disciplined, victorious over his enemies, And able to distinguish between virtue and nonvirtue; “And who is not too hefty and not too lean, Not too tall and not too short, And preeminent among the average Will attain accomplishment of the highest kind.

sen mo zangs mdog legs snum dang / / lag mthil dmar dang gtsang ba dang / / rkang pa'i mtha' dmar snum pa dang / / 'khor lo swa sti kas brgyan dang / / rgyal mtshan rta babs nya dang ni/ / ba dan pad+ma tho ba dang / / mi gang rkang pa lag pa la/ / mtshan ni 'di dag yod gyur pa/ / de 'dra'i skyes bu dam pa la/ / grub pa mchog tu brtag par bya/ /

“One with copper-colored, smooth fingernails, With the palms of his hands red and clean, With the extremities of his feet red and smooth, And adorned with circles, swastikas, “Banners, archways, fish, Flags, lotuses, and water lilies Visible on his hands and feet‍— A person marked with these signs “And fitting this description is the most excellent, And to his lot will fall the best accomplishment.

mche ba dkar zhing bzang ba dang / / mtho ba'i ri bo dang 'dra dang / / sna bzang mtho zhing mig dkyus ring / / smin ma stug cing kos ko bzang / / ba yi rdzi ma 'jig rten mtshan/ / nag pa'i lta ba'i mig 'bras mtshan/ / dpral ba'i dbyes gang rgya che zhing / / mgo bo gdugs 'dra'i rnam pa bzang / / mgo bo gtsug tor 'dra ba dang / / rna ba bzang ba dam pa yin/ / rtag tu seng ge'i 'gram 'dra dang / / ma mchu bim pa smin 'dra'i mdog / gang gi lce ni rab snang ba/ / pad+ma 'dab ma dmar 'dra'i mdog / mgrin pa bum pa 'dra ba dang / / thal gong rgyas shing yang dag 'phags/ / mchan khung thong ka bzang ba mchog / de bzhin brla ni rgya che dang / / lte ba'i phyogs kyang chung ba dang / / rked pa rgya che bzang ba dang / / lte ba zab cing g.yas su 'khyil/ / kun nas dkar med ba spu dang / / lag ring lag ni che ba dang / / rked pa seng ge 'dra ba'i mtshan/ / gang gi brla ni zlum pa dang / / gru mo nyams med zlum pa dang / /

One with white, cavity-free, And long teeth that resemble mountains; “With a long nose, elongated eyes, Knitted brow, a beautiful chin, Eyelashes distinguished in the world like those of a cow, Black, beautifully outlined eyes, “A broad forehead, A beautiful head shaped like a parasol Or shaped like a turban, Beautiful ears, “Jaws shaped like those of a lion, Lips the color of ripe bimba[1203] fruit, A tongue the color of a lotus petal, An intensely red palate,[1204] “A neck resembling a conch,[1205] Full, muscular shoulders,[1206] Exquisitely beautiful flanks and bosom, A broad chest, “A slim torso, Broad, beautiful hips, A deep navel with hair curling to the right, A network of straight veins,[1207] “Dangling forearms, and big arms and hips;[1208] Who is distinguished by a lion’s chest, Has round thighs, And elbows free of blemish;[1209]

byin pa e na ya lta bur/ / zlum pa'i nang ni zlum por grub/ / rkang pa sha dang ldan pa dang / / sor mo rnams kyi ring ba dang / / dmar zhing sen dmar snum pa dang / / sha rgyas pas ni snum pa yin/ / nang stong ma yin mthil mnyam gnas/ / dge zhing mthong na dga' ba dang / / 'jam zhing kha dog dag pa dang / / rab bsngags 'jig rten bkra shis dang / / de dag gi ni steng dag tu/ / rtsa yi dra ba mngon pa med/ / bshang ba 'byung ba'i lam dag tu/ / ri mo zab cing g.yas su 'khyil/ / mchig pa rab bsngags shin tu chud/ / rtag tu zlum zhing dge ba yin/ / ma 'brel dum bu ma yin dang / / gcig min nyid du bstan pa yin/ / gang tshe skyes dbang gtsang ba dang / / rtse mo dmar la yang dag gnas/ /

“Whose calves, like those of an antelope, Are said to be well proportioned and round; Who has fleshy feet With red, upraised toes[1210] “With red, smooth toenails‍— Feet that are nicely arched and adorned with flesh; Whose head . . . the surface of the earth;[1211] Who has beautiful ears,[1212] nice to behold,[1213] “Smooth,[1214] of nice color, clean, Praiseworthy and distinguished in the world, Above which there is a network of veins That are not bulging; “Whose two pathways for voiding excreta Are deep[1215] and turn toward the right; Who has two fine testicles,[1216] Small, round, beautiful, “Without injuries or cracks, And nicely separated; Whose member becomes drawn in After voiding the bodily fluid at the end of physical passion;[1217]

skye bo nyal khar kha zas ni/ / ro ni rtsa bar byed pa za/ / bshang ba kha dog sngo ba 'am/ / gal te dmar por rab snang zhing / / mang po ma yin snum pa dang / / dge ba'i mtshan gyi rab mtshan pa/ / de lta'i sems can gang yin pa/ / grub pa mchog tu 'dod pa yin/ / lan gsum bshang zhing sngags drug dran/ / gtsang sbra'i spyod dga' yongs su gtsang / / gang zhig thun ni tha mar nyal/ / tho rangs ldang ba'i skye bo rnams/ / de yi grub pa rtag tu mchog / las kun byed par snang ba yin/ /

“Who, during sleep,[1218] after the eating of Aphrodisiacs contained in food or drink, Profusely releases a fluid That appears blue or red; “And whose [penis] releases much fluid, is smooth,[1219] And is marked with signs of beauty‍— The person of this kind Will attain the highest accomplishment. “One who defecates three times and urinates six times [a day[1220]],[1221] Is pure and enjoys performing purificatory observances, Goes to bed at the end of the watch,[1222] And gets up early Will attain the highest accomplishment With regard to all activities.[1223]

'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs dang / / phun tshogs rnam pa mang po la/ / mi rnams rjes su 'dod pa yang / / mtshan nyid kyis ni mngon mtshan pa'o/ / rgyu skar dag la'ang skyes pa ni/ / rgyal dang nam gru gred bo dang / / mchu dang lha mtshams dag dang ni/ / nag pa snar ma smin drug dang / / nus pa'i gza' rnams kyis mtshan pa/ / de dag la ni skyes mthong dang / / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char kha ni/ / tho rangs dus su gang skyes dang / / gang tshe de yi dus su skyes/ / de la grub pa rab tu snang / /

“One will enjoy A variety of results And great prosperity again and again. One is marked with medium characteristics,[1224] If one is born in the asterisms Of Puṣya, Revatī, Phalgunī, “Maghā, Anurādhā, Citrā, Rohiṇī, or Kṛttikā. One born in them is handsome, And marked by the planets as capable.[1225] One that was [born under the aforementioned stars] at dawn Will manifest accomplishment.[1226]

nyin phyed dang ni tho rangs dang / / nyi ma'i mthar yang gza' bzang po/ / dkar ba zla ba pa wa sangs/ / ser ba gza' lhag phur bu yin/ / skye bo rnams kyis mthong na ni/ / 'bras bu 'grub phyir nus pa yin/ / mi ni gang zhig dge las kyis/ / 'di la skyes par gyur pa yi/ / sngags don ma lus sgrub pa la/ / de dag 'bad med 'grub par 'gyur/ / nyi ma phyed ni 'das pa dang / / rtag tu nyi ma nub pa na/ / lus can rnams kyi rtag de la/ / ma rungs gza' mthong gang yin pa/ /

“If the auspicious planets‍— The pure white moon,[1227] The yellow Mercury, and Jupiter‍— Are observed at the end of the day, at midday, or at dawn, They indicate, for all people born at that time, That they will be fit for attaining accomplishment. “If people born in such periods Engage in virtuous activities, Their mantras will easily succeed In accomplishing all their aims. “After noon has passed And always when the sun is setting‍— Always during these periods‍— Planets exercise cruel influence upon beings.[1228]

ma rungs nyi ma mig dmar dang / / mjug rings sgra gcan spen pa dang / / gang yang gza' ni gtso bo dang / / las ni ngan 'joms skar mda' can/ / skar ma shin tu mi bzad nyid/ / de bzhin nag po 'chi ltas dang / / dus min 'chi ba sa la ni/ / mi bzad de tshe snang ba yin/ / nyi ma 'char ba'i dus su ni/ / gza' lhag gis ni sa rnams mthong / / gnya' shing gang tsam nyi mas phyin/ / phur bus sa de mthong bar 'gyur/ / de nas pha rol gnya' shing tsam/ / pa sangs nor spyan gyis de mthong / / nyi ma phyed ni yongs rdzogs na/ / zla bas lus can ma lus mthong / / gza' lhag dus su rgyal thabs thob/ / phur bus nor dang longs spyod byed/ / pa sangs nor ni nges sgrub dang / / rgyal srid tshe dang longs spyod ldan/ / zla ba de bzhin tshe ring zhing / / dbang phyug dang ni 'bras bu bcas/ / de bzhin nyin phyed nyi ma ni/ / nyi ma phyed du mnyam par mthong / /

“Sun and Mars are, [at that time], inauspicious, As are comets, Rāhu, and Saturn, The chief among planets, Earthquakes, hurricanes, and meteors.[1229] “At that time the stars are very inauspicious. Black omens boding misfortune And fearful portents of death Will appear at that time. “If, at the time of the sun’s rising, Mercury looks upon Earth;[1230] If at a yoke’s distance[1231] from the sun, Jupiter looks upon Earth;[1232] “If Venus, a further yoke’s distance away from the sun, Is looked upon by Kubera; If, at the height of noon, The moon’s aspect affects the beings, “Then, respectively, Mercury’s influence will bring kingship; Jupiter will bring wealth and pleasures; Venus will bring wealth, Kingdom, and pleasures; “And the moon will bring long life, Power, and achievements. Similarly, when the sun marks the midday, Its corresponding midday aspect manifests.[1233]

rtag tu nyin phyed rnam 'das na/ / nyi mas phyogs ni mthong bar byed/ / thung 'gyur nyi ma gnya' shing tsam/ / byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni/ / sgra gcan spen pa nyid dag yin/ / mun pa dus dang dus mthar byed/ / de nas phar ni thung ba na/ / 'chi ltas skar mda' sa 'gul byed/ / li khri tshogs kyis mdog bsgyur ba'i/ / nyi ma nub kar zangs ma'i mdog / gza' yi gtso bo gang yin de/ / byis pa gzhon nu'i tshul 'dzin cing / / lag na mdung thogs ma rungs pa/ / mig dmar nyid kyis mthong ba yin/ / de nas nyi ma gnya' shing 'das/ / dge ba'i gza' ni 'byung ba yin/ / nyi mas mthong ba las skyes pa/ / ma rungs bab col byed par 'gyur/ / spen pa mig dmar las skyes pa/ / khro ldan skam zhing nga rgyal can/ /

When noon has passed, The sun always looks upon the quarters. “If Ketu[1234] is said to be within One angular yoke [above the horizon], not higher,[1235] And if Rāhu and Saturn Create darkness at noon,[1236] Soon after evil omens will occur, Such as meteors or earthquakes.[1237] “If the setting sun is of copper color, With a strong tint of vermillion,[1238] One born under this aspect of the chief planet[1239] Will be a handsome male child. “He will look like Mars himself, Very fierce, with a javelin in his hand. Then, when the sun has passed a yoke’s length, The auspicious planets will emerge. “One born after the sun has appeared Will be cruel and impetuous. If it is Saturn or Mars, One will be cruel, lustful, and proud.

mjug rings 'chi ltas dud rnams la/ / skyes pa nad ni yang dag 'byung / / dbul zhing nad btab glen pa dang / / de bzhin du ni rtag tu rmongs/ / dus dang mun pa 'gul byed dang / / skar mda' can dang gza' ngan dang / / 'gul byed sgra drag dmar ba'i mdog / gnam lcags nyid kyang rab rdung byed/ / de bzhin rdo rje 'chi ltas dang / / gzhan yang khyim sogs rab tu mthong / / skye bo kun gyis sgra gcan ni/ / mi bzad rab tu mthong gyur na/ / dbul zhing mgon med tshul khrims 'chal/ / mi ni rtag tu sdig pa spyod/ /

“Harm will come to those born Under the smoke-like omens of Ketu. Such people are poor, violent, and greedy,[1240] And are always ignorant. “In the time of darkness, when the earth shakes, Meteors streak, and planets are inauspicious; When there are earthquakes and hurricanes, Light-phenomena, and burning thunderbolts;[1241] “When ominous lightning and other signs Appear in place of the Pleiades and other stars; When all beings behold The terrifying sight of Rāhu,[1242] “At that time people are poor, without a protector, undisciplined, And constantly engage in evil and dishonest acts.[1243]
