bdag nyid chen po ci 'dra ba/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po zhi ba'i gzugs/ / sdug bsngal blo ngan mi 'gyur bar/ / de 'dra bdag ni 'jig rten shog / las kyi lhag ma zad pa dang / / 'chi 'phos de tshe mtho ris song / / chos kyi bdag nyid de mthar gyis/ / nyan thos de ni byang chub thob/ /

‘May I become the way These magnificent beings are, Steeped in tranquility and endowed with magical powers. May I be free from suffering and unhappy rebirths.’[2959] “When he dies after exhausting his remaining karma, He will, inevitably, be reborn in heaven. In due course he will fully assimilate the Dharma And attain the realization of a pratyekabuddha.[2960]

de bas sngags kyi sgrub pa ni/ / mngon spyod dag ni yong mi bya/ / sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yis/ / mngon spyod rab tu bkag pa yin/ / snying rje mchog ldan sangs rgyas dang / / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che/ / sngags rnams mthu bstan don du ni/ / las rnams thams cad bstan pa yin/ / de bzhin nor bu lta bu'i sngags/ / gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs/ / khro dang chags pas zil mnan pa'i/ / byis pa rmongs pa'i sems dag gis/ / de dag sngags ni mngon spyod la/ / phan tshun rab tu sbyor bar byed/ / sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' ni/ / blo dang ldan pas de bzhin bkag / rnam pa thams cad sngags rnams ni/ / sems can longs spyod 'phel ba dang / / de nas rgyal po dam pa dang / / srung ba che dang dbang phyir dang / / skye gnas sna tshogs la gnas pa'i/ / sems can rnams ni dgug don du/ / sngags kyang bsgrub par bya ba ste/ / 'tsho ba dgag phyir ma yin no/ / dge slong mang du thos pa ni/ / de yi tshe na 'byung 'gyur ba/ / ma khol zhes kyang bya ba ste/ / nga nyid kyi ni stod byed pa/ / ji bzhin yon tan bzang po ni/ / ji lta bzhin du brjod par 'gyur/ /

From this[2961] [one should draw the conclusion] That mantras should not be used in the sādhanas of assault. “Such violent practices are forbidden By the buddhas and the bodhisattvas. The exceedingly compassionate buddhas And the majestic bodhisattvas Taught the implications of the power of mantras For all the practitioners of rites. “The mantras taught by the tathāgatas Are wish-fulfilling gems. However, beings who are by nature immature, Confused, and under the sway of anger and greed Employ these mantras against each other In the violent rites of assault. “Such rites are forbidden by the buddhas And the sagacious bodhisattvas, Since the mantras are meant to increase Beings’ well-being in every possible way. “The mantras raise kingdoms,[2962] Provide protection, and bring wealth.[2963] They can summon beings Of different types of birth. The mantras should never be mastered In order to destroy life. “At that time my monks Will be very learned. One by the name of Mātṛceṭa Will compose a hymn of praise for me That will be recited, whenever appropriate, By those who exemplify good qualities.[2964]
kun nas sems ni rab dang zhing / / sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan la dad/ / sgrub dka'i sngags ni rab bsgrub cing / / 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi de bzhin no/ /
“Having developed complete faith, He will delight in the teachings of the buddhas. A mantra adept, himself inconspicuous, He will only proclaim praises of Mañjughoṣa.[2965]

yon tan ldan zhing tshul khrims ldan/ / mang du thos shing chos kyang smra/ / dud 'gror sngon ni gyur pa na/ / nga yi bstod pa yongs su smra/ / nyams dga' grong khyer rgyal po'i khab/ / 'od ma'i tshal gyi sa steng du/ / slob ma'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu/ / ji ltar bde bar bzhugs pa na/ / der ni bya rog cig yod pas/ / nga la sems ni rab dad byas/ / sems ni nga la dad byas pas/ / lus zhig nas ni mtho ris song / / lha rnams las ni shi 'phos nas/ / mi rnams nang du nye bar skyes/ / mi yi nang du skyes nas kyang / / nga yi bstan la rab tu 'byung / / rab byung bdag nyid chen po de/ / ji bzhin de tshe 'byung bar 'gyur/ / ma khol zhes bya'i brtul zhugs can/ / de ni de tshe 'byung bar 'gyur/ /

He will be a learned proponent of the Dharma, Endowed with good qualities and discipline. “When he was an animal in a past life, He recited the same hymn of praise In the fine city called ‘the King’s,’[2966] In the park called ‘the Grove,’[2967] Where I used to spend my time as I pleased, Together with my disciples. “Living there as a crow, He developed faith in me. He died with thoughts of trust in me And was reborn in heaven. “When his life as a god ends, He will be reborn among humans. Living among them, he will renounce the world For the sake of my doctrine. “Having thus become a renunciant, That great being will praise me, Becoming known, at that time, As Mātṛceṭa who keeps his observances.[2968]
ji bzhin don ni bstod pas mchod/ / rnam pa sna tshogs dpe dag gis/ / 'byung po kun la phan pa'i phyir/ / legs par spyod pa rab byed pa'o/ /
“For the benefit of all beings, He will compose, as necessary, Religious hymns in fine language With examples and allegories.[2969]

sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir/ / bstod pa brjod pa de gtsor byed/ / dus mtha'i 'jig rten smad pa la/ / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / rnam par smin pa de yis ni/ / lus zhig nas ni bde 'gror 'gro/ / blo ldan de ni mthar gyis kyang / / rnam pa sna tshogs bde myong nas/ / bsam gyis mi khyab mchog gsungs pa'i/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub thob/ / de bzhin gshegs pa nga 'das nas/ / lo ni bzhi brgya lon pa na/ / dge slong klu zhes de 'bod 'byung / / bstan pa la ni dad cing phan/ / rab tu dga' ba'i sa thob pa/ / lo ni drug brgya dag tu 'tsho/ / rig pa rma bya chen mo ni/ / bdag nyid chen po des kyang grub/ /

“Out of his kindness for sentient beings, He will dedicate himself to writing inspiring hymns. He will live during the final eon That is reviled by the world. When his body gives out, He will go to heaven due to his ripened karma. “Having experienced various delights, The wise Mātṛceṭa will, in due course, Attain the omniscient awakening‍— The inconceivable absolute truth. “When four hundred years Have passed after my parinirvāṇa, A monk by the name of Nāgārjuna Will delight in this beneficial teaching. He will attain the Joyful stage,[2970] And will live six hundred years. “This great person will accomplish The vidyā called Māyūrī.[2971]

bstan bcos sna tshogs don dang ni/ / dngos po med pa'i don de rigs/ / gang tshe lus de bor ba na/ / bde ba can du'ang skye bar 'gyur/ / de nas mthar gyis sangs rgyas nyid/ / nges pa kho nar yang dag 'thob/ / thogs med ces bya'i dge slong ni/ / bstan bcos de ni don la mkhas/ / mdo sde des don drang ba'i don/ / rnam pa mang po'ang rab tu 'byed/ / 'jig rten rig pa ston bdag nyid/ / gzhung byed ngang tshul can du 'gyur/ /

He will know the meaning of various treatises down to every word[2972] And will understand that in reality there is no independent existence. “When he leaves his body, He will be reborn in Sukhāvatī And in due course Will certainly attain buddhahood. “Then there will be a monk by the name of Asaṅga Who will understand the true meaning of the treatises. He will clearly discern many times over The direct and indirect meaning of the sūtras. “He will educate people, Dedicated to the task and well disciplined.[2973]

de yi rig pa grub pa 'di/ / sA la'i pho nya mo zhes rjod/ / de yi sngags kyi mthu yis ni/ / blo ni bzang po skye bar 'gyur/ / bstan pa yun ring gnas pa'i phyir/ / mdo yi de nyid don sdud byed/ / lo ni brgya dang lnga bcur 'tsho/ / de lus zhig nas lha yul 'gro/ / 'khor ba rnams su 'khor ba na/ / yun ring bde ba rjes myong nas/ / bdag nyid chen po mthar gyis de/ / byang chub thob par 'gyur ba yin/ / de ltar rnam pa mang po yi/ / nga yi bstan la dge slong rnams/ / shes rab ldan nyid chos kyang spyod/ / dus kyi mtha' la de tshe 'byung / / phyi ma de tshe dus dag tu/ / dge slong dgra bcom zhes bya ba/ /

He will accomplish The vidyā[2974] called Śāladūtī. “With his superior intellect Developed by the power of the vidyā mantra, He will distill the true meaning from the sūtras, Ensuring a long survival of the teachings. He will live one hundred and fifty years, And when he leaves his body he will be reborn in heaven. “During his lengthy peregrination through saṃsāra, He will experience happiness for a long time, And in due course this great being Will attain awakening. “There will thus be during that period Many different types of monks who follow my teachings, Including those who possess insight And are disciplined in the Dharma. “There will also come, in the final period, A very learned person called Nanda.[2975]

de ni sngags don bdag nyid ldan/ / rgyud shes de bzhin mang du thos/ / gnod sbyin sngags ni rab brjod pas/ / de la bum pa bzang po 'grub/ / sngon ni ngas ni gang bshad pa'i/ / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yang / / de yi tshe na bum pa las/ / dka' thub chen po 'dren par byed/ /

Conversant with the tantras And wholly dedicated to the quest of mantras, He will accomplish the pot of fortune That is activated with the mantra of the yakṣa.[2976][2977] “Accomplished in austerities, He will draw forth from the pot An important Mahāyāna sūtra That I taught in the past.[2978]

glegs bam de la des bltas nas/ / de la sngags ni zlos pa na/ / gnod sbyin bsgrub pa'i bum pa la/ / der ni bsrung ba ma byas pa'i/ / bag med dran pa nyams pa yis/ / gtsug spyod kyis ni bum pa phrogs/ / de ni de nas sngags grub pa'i/ / dge slong sngags ni zlos byed pa'i/ / bum pa dag ni bltas pa na/ / der ni mngon par mthong ma gyur/ / de nas khro bas mig dmar zhing / / rnam g.yo tshig tu smra ba ni/ / tshangs pa dka' ba'i mthar gyur par/ / brgya byin sogs bcas dbang phyug che/ / sngags kyis ma bkug ma 'ongs na/ / sngags pa bdag min sngags rgyal min/ /

“Reading the volume continually As its nature is that of the mantra,[2979] He will not guard the pot That was obtained through the yakṣa. “Due to his carelessness and lack of attention, The pot will be stolen by Mūrdhaṭaka. The monk [Nanda] who has mastered the mantra Will start reciting it. “He will search for the pot, But will not find it anywhere. Then, his flesh turning red from anger, He will declare in a resounding voice, “ ‘From Brahmā down to the lowest being, Śakra and the others, including Maheśvara, [Everybody] can be summoned by the mantra. If not, I am neither a follower nor a master of mantra.[2980]

gang zhig sangs rgyas sras sngags dang / / rgyal ba mchog gis sngags dag ni/ / tshar gcod don du gang gsungs pa'am/ / gdul dka' 'dul bar byed pa'ang rung / / gal te kun rnams ma bkug na/ / sa steng ma lus de dag med/ / de nas sngags pa chen po langs/ / brtul zhugs brtan zhing las rnams grub/ / ji ltar sngags ni byas pa yi/ / sbyor ba mthong bas rgyud dag kyang / / rkun ma dgug pa de don gtsor/ / sbyor ba rab tu byas par gyur/ /

“ ‘The mantras taught by the Buddha’s heirs And by the supreme victors Are for restraining Those difficult to tame. If I cannot thus bring thieves into my presence, It means that none of them are here on earth.’ “Nanda, accomplished in ritual performance And strict in keeping his observances, will then rise up. Determined to summon them swiftly, He will employ whatever mantra Is prescribed for the summoning From whatever direction.[2981]

skad cig dran pa tsam gyis ni/ / sdom brtson de ni las myur byed/ / yi ge hU~M gi sngags gcig gis/ / tshangs sogs sa sa steng 'dren par byed/ / lha rnams ma lus rab bkug pa/ / tshangs sogs brgya byin dang yang bcas/ / ha ha zhes bya'i sgra 'don cing / / nyam thag 'jigs pa'i sgra yang sgrogs/ / ci bgyi zhes bya'i blo byed cing / / bdag cag 'dir ni nyes med smra/ / myur zhing rab tu rings par yangs/ / blo ldan dge slong 'jigs med pas/ / lha rnams la ni rab smras pa/ / 'dir ni bum pa slar byin zhes/ /

“The moment he merely recollects them, They will arrive, ready to act. With the single syllable hūṁ, He will summon to earth Brahmā and the others. “He will thus summon all the gods, Brahmā and the others, including Śakra. Uttering the shouts of hā! hā! They will make frightening noise, asking, ‘What should I do? Why have you brought me here? I have done nothing wrong!’ “Promptly and hastily, The wise and fearless monk Will address the gods: ‘Bring the pot, wherever it is, back here!’

lha rnams phan tshun thams cad la/ / dge slong des ni rab tu smras/ / gang gis bum pa bzang po khyer/ / khyod kyis myur du rab tu smros/ / lha rnams kun gyis bltas pa na/ / kun tu yang ni ma mthong gyur/ / bum pa 'di ni su yis khyer/ / lha yi dbang pos yang dag dgongs/ / byang chub sems dpa' 'od chen po/ / dpal ldan lag na rdo rje can/ / de yi bu ni mi bzad yod/ / khro ba che zhing shin tu gdug / bgegs kyi gzugs kyis sngags pa la/ / 'gro ba kun la rnam par rgyu/ / bum pa de ni des khyer mthong / / lha yi bdag pos de yang smras/ / rdo rje'i rigs kyi bgegs yod pa/ / sa steng rtse zhing rol par byed/ /

“Passing on the monk’s words,[2982] The gods will all say to one another, ‘Quickly name the fellow Who stole the pot!’ They will thus look for the pot But will not find[2983] it anywhere. “The lord of the gods himself will look Into the matter and ask, ‘Who stole the pot?’ He will see the glorious bodhisattva of great splendor, The holder of the vajra,[2984] “And his terrible son, Very wrathful and terrifying, Who roams the entire world, Manifesting in the form of a vighna.[2985] “Knowing that it was he who stole the pot, The lord of gods will say, ‘There is a vighna in the Vajra family. He playfully sports on earth.

'dis ni bdag la ma mchod pas/ / des ni bum pa de 'dir khyer/ / lha yi bdag pos de smras nas/ / phyir yang lha yi gnas su song / / de tshe rang nyid sngags kyis ni/ / lha rnams ma lus slar gshegs gas gsol/ / skad cig yud tsam nyid kyis ni/ / shin tu legs par yang dag bkug / de tshe dbang med bum par bcas/ / bgegs de nyid dang bcas par 'ongs/ / de nas de ni bgegs de yis/ / yi dgas rnams la bum pa byin/ /

“ ‘He makes offerings to me,[2986] And that’s why he stole the pot.’ After saying this, the lord of gods Will return to his celestial abode. “Nanda will then dismiss all the gods, Using their respective mantras. Immediately, in a mere instant, They will be transported [back to their places].[2987] “He will summon the vighna, Who is powerless and has the pot. He will then employ him To take the pot to the pretas.[2988]

de nas de yi bgegs des ni/ / tshig 'di dag ni rab tu smras/ / yi dgas 'jig rten bum pa khyer/ / nga ni de la dga' ba med/ / sngags pa des ni dka' ba dang / / dka' bas btud de bgegs la smras/ / song shig song shig bgegs chen po/ / phyin cad 'di ltar ma byed cig / de nas des ni yi dgas dag / de yi mod la bkug par gyur/ / ltogs shing ngal ba'i sems dang ni/ / dman zhing de dag khab tsam kha/ / shin tu mi bzad chen po de/ / nyam thag skad kyang rab tu 'don/ / snying rje'i tshig tu smra ba ni/ / bdag nyid chen po yongs su skyobs/ /

“The vighna, guided [there and back], Will say the following: ‘As I have delivered the pot to the preta realm, I[2989] am free from any offense.’ “The great practitioner of mantra Will scold the vighna angrily: ‘Go, go, great vighna, And don’t do this again!’ “Immediately He will summon the pretas, Whose mouths are as small as the eye of a needle And who are disturbed by hunger and distressed. “These very dreadful creatures Will let out wretched cries, Wailing in piteous voices, ‘Protect us, O great being!

khyod kyi bum pa 'dir 'ongs kyis/ / ji ltar 'dod bzhin bdag la byos/ / sngags pa snying rje cher ldan pas/ / yang dag 'dar ba rab tu skyes/ / snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis ni/ / tshig ni 'di dag rab tu smras/ / khyod kyi 'jig rten sdug bsngal ci/ / yun mi ring par rab tu smon/ / dman pa'i yid kyis de smras pa/ / bkres pas yang dag gdungs par gyur/ / yi dgas 'jig rten skom pa yis/ / bdag nyid chen po yin yang rung / / dge slong snying rje chen pos ni/ / de dag la ni bum pa byin/ / de nas de dag yid dga' nas/ / myur bar rang gi gnas su song / / de dag bsam pa tsam gyis ni/ / bum pa las ni bza' btung byung / / dge slong dga' bo'i 'og tu ni/ / tsan+dan skyong ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ / de tshe dus ni tha ma la/ / lo ni sum brgya dag tu 'tsho/ / bdag nyid chen po byang chub ni/ / bgegs med myur du rnyed dka' thob/ /

“ ‘Here is your pot. Having been summoned, we will do whatever you want.’ The mantra adept, filled with great compassion, Will start trembling. “His mind tender with compassion, He will say the following: ‘Tell me without delay About your sufferings in the world.’ “Dejected in their minds, they will say, ‘For a long time, in the realm of the pretas, We have been afflicted with hunger And thirst, O great being!’ “The monk, filled with compassion, Will then present the pot to them. Uplifted in their minds, They will hastily return to their abodes. Food and drink will now appear in the pot Whenever they merely think of it. “The monk Nanda[2990] will dwell On earth in a sandalwood grove. He will live during the debased period For three hundred years. Noble-minded and dedicated to the pursuit of awakening, He will soon attain the realization so difficult to attain.[2991]

rgyal po btsun pa zhes bya ba/ / nga yi bstan pa nub byed pa/ / dus kyi tha ma de yi tshe/ / the tshom med par 'byung bar 'gyur/ / shar phyogs nas ni brtsams nas su/ / kha che'i yul gyi bar dag tu/ / rmongs pas lha khang mchod rten rnams/ / de tshe de bzhin 'jig par 'gyur/ / dge slong tshul khrims ldan pa rnams/ / blo ngan des ni gsod par byed/ / byang gi phyogs su brten nas ni/ / de ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin/ / mi ma yin pa nyid 'khrugs nas/ / yul 'khor phyugs dang gnyen rnams dang / / ri yi dum bus bcom par 'gyur/ / blo ngan de ni sa 'og 'gro/ /

“There will certainly come, at that time During the debased eon, An important Gomin king[2992] Who will [try to] eradicate my teachings. “Starting from the east, And up to the gateway into Kaśmīra, This fool will destroy Monasteries and reliquaries. “In his stupidity, he will kill Monks who are disciplined, Until, having retreated north, The fool will meet his death. “He will be buried in a landslide Caused by an angry nonhuman being, Together with his subjects, animals, and kinsmen. This fool will be reborn in the nether world.

de ni 'og nas 'og tu 'gro/ / dmyal las dmyal ba rab drag par/ / sdug bsngal sdug bsngal drag par ni/ / mi bzad par ni yang dag ltung / / mnar med zhes ni bya ba yi/ / sdig pa'i las kyis dmyal ba ni/ / de nas bskal ba cher 'tshed pa/ / bdag nyid ngan pa go mi shan/ / mi dge'i bshes gnyen la brten nas/ / sdig pa shin tu mi bzad byas/ / de ni nga yi bstan pa la/ / rnam pa kun gyis 'bad nas ni/ / sems ni ma lus rab btang nas/ / phun sum tshogs dang de nas spyod/ / nges par sangs rgyas nyid lam ni/ / yan lag brgyad kyi theg pas ni/ / de tshe de ni rab 'gro zhing / / mya ngan nad med dam pa thob/ /

“Following a downward course, He will fall from one hell to the next, Experiencing ever greater suffering, Intense and terrifying. “That prominent Gomin [king],[2993] Will be rescued after one great eon From the hell called Avīci, Where evildoers go. “Meeting wrong friends, Beings commit terrible evil. Therefore, with all care, You should put all your trust In the teachings of the Tathāgata. You will then enjoy good fortune. “All of you should always follow The eightfold path, Which invariably leads to buddhahood, The city without aging or sorrow.

de yi 'og tu sa srung ba/ / sangs rgyas phyogs zhes rnam par grags/ / phyogs che gtong ba che ba dang / / sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan la dad/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / thams cad mngon dga'i rgyal po ste/ / ston pa'i bstan pa de gtsor byed/ / kun dga' ra ba mchod rten gnas/ / ston pa'i gzugs brnyan bla na med/ / mtshe'u rdzing dang khron pa dang / / mtsho rnams dag ni du ma dag / rgyal po chen pos byas nas ni/ / tshe zad lha yi gnas su song / / des kyang sa steng grub pa ni/ / pad+ma 'chang ba brtson 'grus che/ / bdag nyid chen po sems dpa' la/ / sa yi bdag por don du gnyer/ /

“Next after him will come The king known as Buddhapakṣa.[2994] He will enjoy great support, be truly renounced, And delight in the teachings of the buddhas. He will come, there is no doubt, During the debased eon. “The king will be loved by all And devoted to the teachings of the Teacher. He will build monasteries, lay gardens, and caityas And commission superb images of the Teacher. “He will also construct many Ponds, tanks, and reservoirs. Having done all this, this great king Will go to heaven at a ripe age. “While on earth, he will accomplish The mantra of Abjaketu of great efficacy, And he will ask this bodhisattva, the great being, To protect the earth.[2995]

de yi sngags kyi mthu yis ni/ / lo ni sum brgya dag tu 'tsho/ / de yi las kyi lhag ma yis/ / myur du byang chub 'thob par 'gyur/ / de yi bu ni rgyal po yang / / sde chen stobs ni che ba yi/ / zab mo'i phyogs zhes rnam par grags/ / grong khyer sa ni lnga len 'byung / / rig pa'i bdag nyid rgyal po de'ang / / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / gtsug lag khang dang gnas khang dang / / mchod rten rdzing dang khron pa ni/ / 'od chen sa yi bdag po de/ / du ma byed par the tshom med/ /

“By the power of Abjaketu’s mantra, Buddhapakṣa will live three hundred years. With his accumulation of good karma, He will swiftly attain awakening. “His son will likewise be a king, With a great powerful army. He will be called Gambhīrapakṣa Throughout the entire earth.[2996] “This king, at that time, Will be very dedicated to his work. He will build numerous monasteries, Lodgings,[2997] reliquaries, ponds, and wells. This king of great splendor Will undoubtedly do such things.

blo dang ldan pa 'jam dbyangs kyi/ / sngags kyang des ni rab bsgrubs pa/ / de dag yi ge drug ces bya/ / don chen longs spyod 'phel byed pa'o/ / de yi sngags kyi mthu yis ni/ / de ni longs spyod che bar 'gyur/ / blo dang ldan pa mthar gyis ni/ / myur du byang chub gzhol bar 'gyur/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan 'di la/ / rnam pa sna tshogs bya ba byed/ / byang gi phyogs la brten nas ni/ / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / lha ldan yul zhes bya ba yi/ / gangs can ri yi nang gnas pa'i/ / rgyal po mi yi lha zhes pa/ / lits+tsha bI rnams rigs su byung / / de yang sngags kyi don bsgrubs te/ / longs spyod che dang ldan par 'gyur/ / rig pa longs spyod ldan zhes bya/ / mi yi bdag pos de yang grub/ / lo ni brgyad cur rgyal srid byas/ / des ni rkun ma rnam par spangs/ /

“He will accomplish the mantra Of the sagacious Mañjughoṣa‍— The phrase known as the six syllables, Pregnant in meaning and conducive to well-being. “By the power of this mantra He will experience great comforts. In due course he will obtain intelligence And swiftly travel the path to awakening. He will do various works Related to the Tathāgata’s teachings. “At that time, In the north, In the country called Nepāla[2998] Nestled at the foothills of the snowy mountains, There will be King Mānavadeva, Born to the Licchavi clan. “He too, having accomplished his mantric quest, Will come to enjoy great comforts.[2999] This king will accomplish The vidyā called Bhogavatī. During his reign of eighty years, The kingdom will be free from thieves.

rgyal po de ni srog spangs nas/ / der yang sngags ni myur 'grub ste/ / zhi dang rgyas pa bsil byed pa'o/ / 'jig rten sgrol ma zhes grags dang / / lha mo gos dkar ma dang ni/ / dkar mo chen mo gzhan phan brtson/ / rtag tu yid ni mi skyo ba'o/ / de la sogs pa gsungs pa yi/ / de bzhin rgyal po mang po ni/ / rnam pa du ma mang po dag / kha dog sna tshogs sna tshogs gzugs/ / kha ba can gnas kla klo'i rgyal/ / de yang ston pa mchod byed pa'o/ /

“When his life ends, The king will go to heaven.[3000] The mantras especially effective at that time Will be the peaceful mantras for pacifying and nourishing. “The world-renowned Tārā, The goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī, And Mahāśvetā will strive to benefit others, Never growing weary in their minds. “These and many other kings Will come at that time, it is said. They will be many, of many types, Described according to their varying natures. “The kings of the mlecchas[3001] in the snowy land[3002] Will also worship the Teacher.

khyu mchog khyu mchog bzang po dang / / sa 'od de bzhin sa 'od bzang / / de bzhin pha rol gnon nyid dang / / rkang pa'i 'gros zhes bstan pa yin/ / sa srung dang ni be'u dang / / 'od ldan nyid ni phyi ma yin/ / tha mar char rgyal ngang tshul te/ / kla klo rnam pa sna tshogs yin/ / de 'og lugs ni rnam zhig cing / / phyi rol skye dgus nye bar spyod/ /

They are Vṛṣa,[3003] Suvṛṣa, Bhūbhāsa, Subhūbhāsa, Bhākrama, Padakrama, And the one known as Kamala.[3004] “There will also be the western[3005] kings: Bhāgupta, Vatsaka, Bhāsvat, Udaya, and Jiṣṇu being the last. These too are the various kings of the mlecchas. After that, the kings will defy propriety By serving the interests of foreigners.[3006]

de tshe bal yul bdag po ni/ / mtshon gyis 'thab pas rnam par 'jig / kla klo'i rkun po bsten pa yi/ / der ni rgyal po rnam par 'jig / sa bdag du ma gsungs pa rnams/ / sna tshogs lha dang bram ze dag / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / rgya yul kun la brten pa yi/ / rgyal po dbyig gi snying zhes bya/ / sde chen stobs kyang che ba dang / / blon po rgya che nyid dang ni/ / skye bo rtsa lag rab tu mang / / kla klos btud dang rnam par rgyal/ / ston pa'i bstan pa de gtsor byed/ / gzhon nu bdag nyid chen po nyid/ / de yi sngags ni rab bsgrubs pa/ / mthu ni chen po dang ldan pa'i/ / rig pa'i rgyal po yi ge brgyad/ / dpa' bo che zhes rnam par grags/ / phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas chen yin/ / de yi byis pa'i blo yis ni/ / rgyal srid phyir ni rab smon byas/ / gang gis dran pa tsam gyis ni/ / sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'gyur ba/ / mi bdag rgyal thabs nyid kyi phyir/ / de ni skal ba mi nyung 'gyur/ / mchog gi sbyin pa bla na med/ / bsam pa tsam gyis thob pa nyid/ /

“At that time, the king of Nepāla Will perish from armed onslaughts. The vidyās will be lost, and so will be the kings Who served the mleccha[3007] rogues. “Many different kings have been foretold, Including some partial to the brahmins,[3008] Whose rule will extend All around Tibet.[3009] “The king Hiraṇyagarbha will have A great and very powerful army. He will be a friend to many people, And his government will extend far and wide. “He will be honored by the mlecchas as a conqueror And devoted to the teachings of the Teacher. He will accomplish the mantra Of the divine youth of great splendor[3010] “And will derive from it great power. He will employ the eight-syllable vidyārāja Known as ‘Great Hero,’[3011] Which confers great fortune and authority. “With this mantra, which is certain to confer Buddhahood merely by recollecting it, The king will naively focus On the affairs of his realm, “Occupying himself with small matters For the sake of his kingdom[3012] While wishing to obtain Supreme boons.[3013]
tshangs sogs lha rnams thams cad la/ / ma lus lung ni rtsol byed na/ / lha ngan phal pa dag dang ni/ / mi yi 'jig rten smos ci dgos/ /
“He will command, at all times, All the deities such as Brahmā and so forth, Let alone the people in the world Or other beings in reviled states of existence.[3014]

lo ni brgya dang lnga bcur 'tsho/ / grags chen lha yi gnas su 'gro/ / chos kyi bdag nyid de mthar gyis/ / byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur/ / gzhon nus yongs su bshad pa yi/ / rig pa 'di ni de yul du/ / de ni myur du 'grub 'gyur gyis/ / rig pa gzhan ni nam yang min/ / byang chub sems dpa' dpa' bo che/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni 'od chen po/ / mngon sum de yi yul dag na/ / byis pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa yin/ / grub pa'i zhing mchog dam pa la/ / mi ni yongs su sgrub par 'gyur/ / rgyal po tu ruSh+ka zhes bya/ / byang phyogs la ni yang dag brten/ / sde chen brtson 'grus che ba ste/ / de yi gnas su 'byung bar 'gyur/ / shing shun gyon yul ma gtogs pa/ / kha che'i mthar thug ka shir bcas/ / de ni dpag tshad bdun brgya dang / / 'bum phrag gnyis kyi sa bdag tu/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / de tshe the tshom med par 'gyur/ /

“This great king will live one hundred and fifty years, And then go to heaven. In due course he will fully assimilate the Dharma And attain supreme awakening. “The vidyās taught by the divine youth Will be efficacious in that country. These vidyās and none other Will swiftly lead to success. “The valiant bodhisattva Mañjughoṣa of great splendor Will be manifestly present In that country in his youthful form. It is the place of supreme accomplishment, And people there will accomplish the state of divinity. “A king by the name Turuṣka Will rise in the country up north. Valiant and commanding a great army, He will rule the area extending Up to the gateway of Kaśmīra And including Baṣkala, Udyāna, and Kāviśa.[3015] “This king will rule an area Extending over one hundred and seven[3016] leagues [With a population of] Two hundred and seventy-seven thousand.[3017] This will happen, there is no doubt, During the debased eon.

de yang sngags ni grub pas na/ / lo ni sum brgya dag tu 'tsho/ / blo ldan mi yi spyan gyur pas/ / skra can ma yi rig pa bsgrubs/ / bdag nyid dge bar bya ba'i phyir/ / lha khang dag ni mang po byas/ / stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi/ / mchod rten mchog ni de bzhin byas/ / theg pa chen po mchog chos dang / / de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi yum/ / 'jig rten shes rab pha rol phyin/ / de yi yul du rab gnas byas/ / rgyal po de ni lus zhig nas/ / mtho ris 'jig rten 'gro bar 'gyur/ / sa bdag de ni mthar gyis su/ / rdzogs pa'i byang chub bla med 'thob/ / de 'og sa bdag rgyal po ni/ / chen po tu ruSh+ka zhes bya/ / blo ldan mang pos bkur zhes bya/ / rtag tu dge zhing mchod la dga'/ / lha mo sgrol ma rdzu 'phrul che/ / de yi sngags kyang rab tu bsgrubs/ / des kyang sngags ni rab bsgrubs pa/ / sa steng rgyal po'i ched du'o/ / phyogs che dpung ni chen po dang / / rgyal po grags pa chen po ste/ / gnyen dang rigs dang rgyal pos kyang / / de ni bkur ba nyid du 'gyur/ /

“Turuṣka will master the mantras And will live three hundred years. This wise king who watches over the people Will accomplish the vidyā Keśinī. “Adding to his glory, He will establish monasteries And build eighty-six thousand[3018] Great stūpas. “The excellent Mahāyāna Dharma Will be established in that country, Including the mother of the buddhas‍— The Prajñāpāramitā. “When King Turuṣka leaves his body, He will go to the celestial realm, And in due course he will attain Supreme awakening. “After him, there will be another king By the name of Mahāturuṣka. He will be wise, highly esteemed, And wholeheartedly devoted to his teachers. He will accomplish the mantra Of the powerful goddess Tārā. “His mantra accomplishment will also [serve] The interests of his kingdom on earth. This king, with powerful vassals and a great army, Will be called ‘great lord’ on earth.[3019] “He will be accepted as king Even by his own relatives.[3020]

rtsa brgyad stong gi gtsug lag khang / / de yi dus su yod par 'gyur/ / de yi sngags kyi mthus yis ni/ / lo ni nyis brgya dag tu 'tsho/ / gang tshe de lus zhig pa na/ / dga' ldan du ni skye bar 'gyur/ / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che/ / lha yi bus kyang bkur bar 'gyur/ / chos kyi bdag nyid de mthar gyis/ / byang chub yan lag mngon rdzogs nas/ / 'bad pas de ni mthar gyis kyang / / mnyam med byang chub thob par 'gyur/ / dus kun de yi yul du ni/ / gsung rab mang po gnas 'gyur ba/ / sngon gyi rgyal ba dag gis gsungs/ / da ltar ngas kyang gsungs pa yin/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po klu dang ni/ / 'dod chags bral bas rnam par gnas/ / de bzhin 'jig rten skyong ba dang / / gnod sbyin bstan pa srung byed dang / / sa steng dam chos srung byed pa/ / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / de ltar rnam pa mang po bstan/ / sa bdag 'jig rten rnam grags pa/ / bstan dang ston par 'gyur ba yin/ /

At that time, there will be Eight thousand[3021] monasteries [in his domain]. “Through the power of his mantra He will live two hundred years. When he leaves his body, He will be reborn in Tuṣita And revered by the gods there As a powerful bodhisattva. “In due course he will fully assimilate the Dharma By perfecting the limbs of awakening And, with due effort and care, Will attain the unequaled awakening. “In that country the teachings Will always proliferate, Whether those taught by the victors in the past Or those taught now by me. It will be filled with desireless beings And powerful nāgas.[3022] “At that time, there will be on earth The guardian deities and the yakṣas[3023] Who will guard the teachings of the Teacher And protect the sacred Dharma. “Kings of many different types have been foretold Who will be renowned throughout the world. Having been taught themselves, They will teach [the Dharma] at that terrible time.[3024]

nub phyogs yul ni mtha' yas pa/ / 'phags rgyal zhes bya'i pha rol tu/ / la da'i yul gyi skye bo ni/ / ngang tshul zhes bya'i rgyal po yod/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan la dad/ / grong khyer phyin nas yang dag zhugs/ /

“In the country of the Lāḍas,[3025] Which extends from Ujjain To the westernmost part Bordered by the ocean,[3026] “There will be a Dharma king By the name of Śīla, who will take delight In the teachings of the Buddha. He will be based in the city of Vallabhī.[3027]

chos kyi rgyal por 'gyur ba ste/ / mchod rten sna tshogs gtsug lag khang / / de bzhin srog chags dge bar ni/ / sa bdag chos la mnyes gshin pas/ / rig pa'i bdag nyid byed par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba'i gzugs brnyan yid 'ong la/ / rnam pa sna tshogs mchod pa byed/ / 'jig rten mgon po grags chen gyi/ / mchod rten mchog la'ang mchod pa byed/ / des na de ni sngags kyang grub/ / rgyal po las skyes kho na ni/ / de yi yul du yang dag grags/ / dge slong bsod snyoms byed pa ni/ / tshul khrims ldan zhing blo dang ldan/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan la dad/ / bdag nyid chen po dus su rgyu/ / de ni bsod snyoms rab zhugs rgyu/ / rgyal po'i khab bzang rab mthong ba/ / rgya che skye bos gang ba la/ / bslang ba'i don du der yang zhugs/ / bkres pa dang yang yang dag ldan/ / ngal zhing ltogs pa'i yid gyur kyang / / de tshe bsod snyoms rnyed ma gyur/ / rgyal po'i skyes bus de myur bzung / / khyim de las ni phyung bar 'gyur/ / de nas de ni yid byung nas/ / rgyal po'i mi la rab khros te/ /

“The king, fond of the Dharma, Will apply himself[3028] wholeheartedly To the task of building fine monasteries and reliquaries And to improving the lives of sentient beings. “He will perform various pūjās And make beautiful images of the Victorious One. He will worship the finest reliquaries Of the most illustrious among the lords of the world. He will not be a master of mantras[3029] But only reap the supreme benefits of his past karma. “[His story is as follows:] In that country, there was once A well-known monk who subsisted on alms. He was disciplined, intelligent, And took delight in the teachings of the Buddha. “In the course of time, this great being Entered [the royal city] on an alms round. He beheld a splendid royal palace, Sprawling and bustling with people. “Seeking alms, he entered there, Afflicted by hunger, thirsty, And weary in his mind. He did not obtain any alms. “He was seized by guardsmen, Swiftly expelled from the house, And escorted away by the king’s soldiers In a state of mental distress.[3030]

grong khyer de las nges byung nas/ / mod la de yi rang gnas phyin/ / ltogs shing skom pa nyid gyur pas/ / sdug bsngal yid mi bde bar gyur/ / de nas de ni zas chad nas/ / mtshan phyed du ni langs gyur nas/ / sdom brtson de ni sems chud pas/ / de tshe srog ni gtang bar rtsom/ / de tshe smon lam byed pa ni/ / la da'i yul gyi bdag por shog / de nas dge slong dus las 'das/ / spu gri zhes bya'i rgyal rigs su/ / bdag nyid chen po de skyes gyur/ / ston pa'i bstan pa mchod par byed/ / lo ni sum cu dag tu yang / / rgyal srid gnod pa med par byas/ / brkam chags rang mi'i sbyor ba yis/ / ma zhu'i nad kyis btab par gyur/ / de tshe rgyal po lus zhig nas/ / dus byas lha yi gnas song ba/ / byams pa gang du bzhugs pa yi/ / dga' ldan lha yi gnas mchog tu/ / bdag nyid chen pos chos 'chad par/ / de nyid du ni skye bar 'gyur/ / 'od chen byams pa chen po la/ / bsnyen bkur byed cing chos kyang nyan/ / bdag nyid chen po de mthar gyis/ / rnyed par dka' ba'i byang chub thob/ / tshul khrims zhes bya'i rgyal po'i 'og / g.yo ba zhes bya 'byung bar 'gyur/ / lo ni lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang / / de bzhin zla ba lnga ru 'tsho/ / de srid rgyal srid des byas nas/ /

“He then left that city And went to his own place, Hungry and thirsty. In his pain, his mind grew dim. “Deprived of nourishment, The ascetic breathed out his last At midnight. Quick in his mind, He made an aspiration at that time, To be reborn as the king of the Lāḍas. “After some time has passed, the monk will be reborn In the royal Dhara family [as King Śīla]. This great being will worship The teachings of the Teacher. “He will rule for thirty years, Making the kingdom trouble-free. As the result of a plot by his greedy kinsmen, He will develop indigestion and fall unconscious. “When his body fails and the king dies, He will be reborn in the god realm Where the gods are ‘supremely happy’[3031] And where Maitreya resides. “He will be reborn where this great being Teaches the Dharma, And he will respectfully listen To the teachings of the splendorous Maitreya. In due course, he will attain the awakening That is so difficult to obtain. “Within half a year Of King Śīla’s demise, There will be another one called Capala. Having ruled for five months, He will be killed By armed mercenaries.[3032]

mtshon chas 'tsho bas rab bsad pa/ / bud med byas pa'i skyon nyid kyis/ / de ni mtshon chas bsad par 'gyur/ / de yi nu bo brtan zhes bya/ / brtan pa chos ni brtan par 'gyur/ / sngon ni bkren pa zham ring gyur/ / yul ni la da'i bdag por gyur/ / lhag ma rgyal po thams cad dang / / skye dgu kun kyang zham ring pa'o/ / tshul khrims zhes bya rab 'das nas/ / de ni de dag kun gyi sngar/ / sa bdag thams cad 'byung 'gyur ba/ / dpa' bo rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro/ /

“He will fall, slain with a sword, Because of problems brought on by women. Then Dhruva, his junior,[3033] Will firmly establish himself.[3034] “A naive and heartsick womanizer,[3035] He will become the king of the Lāḍas. All the remaining [Lāḍa] kings, however, Were womanizers only prior [to becoming kings].[3036] “After King Śīla’s demise, The lines of these former [servants] Will all become kings Over the maritime provinces as far as Persia.[3037]

rgyal po dbang po zla mdzes dang / / de bzhin du ni gzhu dang tog / me tog gzhu dang rgyal po'i bu/ / res ldan grong las byung ba yin/ / dang po'i dang po snga ma dag / ba la'i grong du 'byung ba yin/ / 'od ces bya ba stod rnams dang / / de bzhin khyab 'jug ces bya ba/ / rgyal po mtha' yas gsungs pa ni/ / ya nga ba yi rigs su 'byung / / de dag phyi ma'i rgyal po ni/ / khyab 'jug ces ni bya ba 'byung / / grong dang skye bo gnyen dang bcas/ / drang srong dmod pas gnod gyur pas/ / blo ldan rgyal po med par 'gyur/ / grong khyer chu yis rab tu gang / / de tshe de yi res ldan grong / / rgya mtsho chen pos rab tu gang / / byang gi phyogs ni thams cad du/ / rtsom pa sna tshogs ri zhol brtan/ / sna tshogs rigs la gnas pa yi/ / rgyal po rnams ni mtha' yas gsungs/ / nyi shu gcig dang sum cu yi/ / mi yi rgyal por shes par bya/ /

“In the city of Vāravatī There will be the kings Foretold under the names of Indra, Sucandra, Dhanus, Ketu, and Puṣpa.[3038] “They will come to the city of Vallabhī And start their own line [of kings], Thousands of whom will have the name Prabha or Viṣṇu.[3039] “There will be countless kings Descending from Yadu.[3040] The last of them Will have the name Viṣṇu. “Cursed by a ṛṣi, This wise king will meet his end Along with his relatives and fellow city dwellers, And his city will be submerged in water‍— His Vāravatī will find Its resting place in the ocean.[3041] “All around the northern area,[3042] In various foothill regions, There will rise, it is said, Countless kings of different origin, Thirty of them known to be Of the royal Śaka line.[3043]

bcwa brgyad sa yi bdag po zhes/ / bar ma'i sa kun bdag po yin/ / mtha' yas klu yi sde la sogs/ / de las tha ma rnam par zhig / de nas khyab 'jug 'phrog byed dang / / mdung zhes bya ba 'phrog byed gzhan/ / dbang ldan dang ni phreng kun dang / / bza' dang brtul zhugs bzang po gzhan/ / dus kun chos lugs rnam par nyams/ / rgyal po de dag dus las 'das/ / des ni bram ze rigs byung ba/ / de tshe longs spyod che nor dang / / bar mthar yi ge dang po b+ha/ / de tshe blon po gnyi ga gtso/ / gnyi ga nor ldan dpal ldan grags/ / bstan pa la ni phan par dga'/ /

“Eighteen kings are foretold as rulers Of the entire middle country.[3044] In the end,[3045] those of the Nāgasena dynasty[3046] And the others will both come to an end. “After them will come Viṣṇu, Hara, Ājita [known] by the name of Kunta,[3047] Īśāna, Śarva, Paṅkti,[3048] Graha, and Suvrata.[3049] “When these kings fall Or otherwise lose importance, There will come two very wealthy and prosperous men Descended from [the king] Viṣṇu.[3050] “They will be from Madhyadeśa, their names will start with Bh, And both will be chief ministers, Renowned as wealthy and prosperous, Who delight in this auspicious teaching.[3051]

gzhon nu khyod kyi sngags rgyal po/ / blon pos de tshe sngags kyang bzlas/ / de nas bzung nas sa yi bdag / gnyi ga mi yi dbang phyug gyur/ / bdun dang brgyad dang de bzhin gsum/ / de tshe dpal mgrin gnas na 'dug / ston pa nyi ma zhes bya ba'i/ / gnas na dbang phyug rab tu gnas/ / thams cad gnas su sa yi bdag / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom ma med/ / yi ge ha zhes rab gsungs pa/ / sa rnams kun la mi yi bdag / de yi yul du sngags 'di dag / de tshe grub par 'gro ba yin/ / zhi dang rgyas pa'i rig pa rnams/ / gang zhig chos rgyal gyis gsungs pa/ /

“They will also recite mantras‍— One that is king among your mantras, O divine youth. Subsequently they will become [kings], Protectors of the land and lords of the people. “The population of Śrīkaṇṭha will be Seven times eight times three hundred.[3052] The vaiśyas with the name of Āditya[3053] Will dwell in [the capital] Sthāṇvīśvara.[3054] “In the end, there will undoubtedly come a king Who will rule over the entire territory. His name will start with the letter H,[3055] And he will be, it is said, the king of all of the land. “The mantras that will be efficacious In that country at that time Will be the vidyās of pacifying and nourishing Taught by the Dharma King.[3056]

longs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs tshogs/ / de bzhin rnam pa sna tshogs ldan/ / sna tshogs gzugs kyi gzungs dang ni/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po gnod sbyin mo/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / der ni grub par 'gyur ba yin/ / lho yi phyogs la yang dag bstan/ / rgya mtsho'i 'gram gyi sa dag la/ / rgyal po dkar dang zla mdzes dang / / sa la yi ni bzhon pa dang / / dbang chen dang ni bde byed dang / / sa bdag de bzhin yid du 'ong / / longs spyod skra bzang skra zhes su/ / lho yi phyogs su rnam par grags/ / bkra shis dang ni rnyed sla dang / / ba lang rnyed dang khyu nyid dang / / gru bzang de bzhin gru dag dang / / dbang chen dang ni zla ba nyid/ / ba lang srung dbang zla ba'i sde/ / 'dod lha de bzhin ma ga d+hA/ /

“[As the result, people] will enjoy Various material comforts and good fortunes. The powerful yakṣiṇīs Manifesting various forms Will be effectively mastered there During the debased eon. “In the southern territories That border on the ocean Will rise King Svātisucandra[3057] Of the Sātavāhana dynasty. “There will be kings Mahendra, Śaṅkara, And the great Vallabha, Also called Sukeśin or Keśin,[3058] In the southern countries. There will be Maṅgala called Vallabha, And also Govinda called Vṛṣaketu. “The king Mahendra will also be called Mahāpota, Pota, and Candra. Gopendra will be also called Indrasena, And Mādhava, Pradyumna.[3059]

grong byed bde byed nyid dang ni/ / stag dang seng ge gza' lhag dang / / sangs rgyas dag pa bum pa dang / / bum pa ma lus nyid du brjod/ / mnyam dang legs par 'jam pa dang / / skra bzang skra ni ldan pa dang / / lho yi phyogs su sa yi bdag / mtha' yas mang por bstan pa yin/ / 'das dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang / / da ltar dag tu rtogs par gyis/ / rnam pa sna tshogs nad btab nas/ / 'di dag rnam pa sna tshogs 'chi/ / mtshon gyis 'debs dang mu ge yis/ / 'chi zhing kha cig phyogs gzhan 'gro/ / de ltar 'di dag rgyal po rnams/ / kan tsi pu rar gnas par bstan/ / de bzhin stong phrag rnam grags pa/ / de tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin/ /

“Gaṇaśaṅkara will be called ‘Tiger,’ And Budha, ‘Lion.’ The pure Budha[3060] will also be known By the names of Kumbha and Nikumbha.[3061] “There will be Mathita, Sumita,[3062] Bala,[3063] and the keśin[3064] kings Pulina and Sukeśin. “There are innumerable kings Said to belong to the southern region‍— They include the past, The present, and the future kings. “They will be afflicted by various diseases And will die different types of death, Including in armed conflicts or from famine. Some of them will go to heaven. “It is said that all these kings Will be given to hostilities. They will end with Mahendra called Pota, Meeting their destruction just like him.[3065]

de dus de tshe phyogs dag tu/ / sngags rnams grub par 'dod na ni/ / khro bo rdo rje'i rigs bstan pa'i/ / sngags 'di dag ni bsgrub par bya/ / mngon par spyod pa'i las dag dang / / de bzhin dbang gi don yang 'grub/ / gzhon nu byis pa'i gzugs can ni/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni bdag nyid che/ / de tshe dus mthar phyin pa na/ / de tshe yul der 'grub par 'gyur/ / ri bo 'bigs byed la brten nas/ / rgya mtsho ba tshwa can 'gram du/ / gdong drug ces ni yang dag bsgrags/ / sems can rnams la mchog sbyin byed/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni blo dang ldan/ / byang chub sems dpas bka' stsal pa/ / sems can rnams la phan 'dod phyir/ / lho yi phyogs su gnas par gyis/ / gdong drug gang gi sngags dag ni/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis rab bstan pa/ /

“Those who so desire will be able To accomplish their mantras at that time and place. The mantras that can be accomplished Will be those of the Vajra family That are beneficial in the activities Of assault and of subduing. “The mantra of the great being Mañjuśrī, The divine prince with a youthful form, Will be effective in that land, At that time, during the lowest eon. “The deity known as Kārttikeya Will grant boons to beings Who dwell between the Vindhyas And the saltwater oceans. “By the command of The sagacious bodhisattva Mañjughoṣa, Kārttikeya will take up his abode in the southern regions, Desiring to bring benefit to beings. “The mantras of Kārttikeya Have been taught by Mañjughoṣa.[3066]

de tshe de phyogs de dus su/ / grub par 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / de tshe dpal gyi ri bo'i phyogs/ / 'bigs byed nang dang ri zhol dang / / gling nyid rnam pa thams cad dang / / ka ling ka zhes rab bsgrags dang / / yon tan gsum dang kla klo dang / / kho ra 'khor yug ko sa la/ / rgya mtsho'i nang dang 'gram dag tu/ / rgyal po dag ni mtha' yas yod/ / cha shas kA ma rU zhes pa/ / kha ba can gyi nang na gnas/ / o Da yul gyi mtshams kun na/ / rgyal po rnams ni mang po gsungs/ / sna tshogs kla klo'i rgyal po ni/ / ston pa mchod byed de gtso byed/ /

There is no doubt that they will bring success At that time and in that region, Including in the country of Śrīparvata And the valleys and ridges of the Vindhyas. “It is said that in all the islands Of the coasts of Kaliṅga, In the countries of the three types of mlecchas, In the areas surrounding Kośala,[3067] And in the ocean’s bays and peninsulas There will be innumerable kings. “The kings of the Kāmarūpa line(s) Will rule at the foot of the snowy mountains. There will be many kings, it is said, All around in the maritime provinces.[3068] “Many kings of the mleccha hordes Will be devoted to worshiping the Teacher.[3069]

dbang po zla ba dga' ba yi/ / rgyal po kla klo'i gnas na gnas/ / de las rgyal po gnyis dag ni/ / bstan pa la ni lo brgyad dang / / ston pa'i sku gzugs mchod byed pa'o/ / de las skyes pa thams cad ni/ / rgyal ba'i bstan la rab dad par/ / the tshom med par 'byung bar 'gyur/ / shar gyi phyogs la brten pa yi/ / rgyal po'i mchog ni mang po gsungs/ / gang zhig 'das dang ma 'ongs dang / / da ltar byung ba thams cad du'o/ / dang po'i rgyal po mchog bshad bya/ / go DA'i rgyud du sa steng skyes/ / grong khyer 'phel byed nyams dga' bar/ / grags ldan de ni rab tu skye/ / de ming 'jig rten zhes bya ba/ / rgyal po go DA 'phel byed byung / / nga ni 'jig rten skyes med 'dir/ / de ni chos la sems pa byung / / sa bdag mang po rnams mnan nas/ / zho shas 'tsho ba dag tu byas/ /

Indra and the great king Sucandra Will live in mleccha countries. “Both these kings will take joy In studying the teachings there for eight years. All the beings[3070] there will have faith in you And worship the images of the Teacher. “They will have faith in the Victor’s teaching, Of this there is no doubt. Many eminent kings based in the eastern lands Have been described, Those of the past, the present, And the future‍—of all the periods. “I will start with the eminent king Born on earth in the dynastic Gauḍa family. He will be born to Yaśasvin In the pleasant city of Vardhamāna. “This king, Loka by name, Will bring prosperity to Gauḍa.[3071] He will care for the Dharma When I arise in this world no more. “Many kings will come, Pursuing various activities in their lives.[3072]

bar ma'i dus su 'di dag mnyam/ / bar ma bar ma'i chos dang ldan/ / rtsod pa'i dus kyi tha ma la/ / mi yi dbang po de nyid nyon/ / rgyal po rgya mtsho zhes bya dang / / rnam par gnon pa nyid dang ni/ / rgyal mchog gtso bo dbang chen dang / / de 'og yi ge sa zhes bya/ / lha yi rgyal po zhes bya ste/ / tha ma'i dus la 'byung bar 'gyur/ / rgyal po'i gtso bo sna tshogs zhes/ / blo ldan chos ni 'phel byed pa'o/ / de yi nu bo byis zhes bya/ / bstan pa 'di la phan zhing dga'/ /

Hear now the true account of the kings Of Madhyadeśa during the middle period[3073] Who will follow the Dharma of the Middle Way And provide comfort[3074] in the final, lowest eon. “There will be the famous kings Known as Samudra and Vikrama, The eminent king Mahendra, And after him, the emperor with the initial S,[3075] “Who will also be known, In this debased eon, by the name Devarāja, As well as other different names. He will be intelligent and will patronize the Dharma. “His younger successor[3076] by the name Bāla Will delight in the auspicious doctrine.[3077]

shar phyogs rgya mtsho'i mthar thug par/ / mchod rten gyis brgyan mdzes pa ni/ / de tshe sa rnams ma lus par/ / byed par 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / lha khang kun dga' ra ba rdzing / / skyed mos tshal dang bkad sa ni/ / de tshe dpal ldan byed 'gyur zhing / / gzings dang zam pa byed pa po/ / de tshe ston pa'i gzugs brnyan mchod/ / de la zhugs pa'ang mchod par byed/ / rgyal srid sa yi bdag po byed/ / gnod pa med cing 'gran zla med/ / lo ni sum brgya dag tu'ang 'tsho/ / zhag ni sum cur rab byung nas/ / pha rol rgol bas pham byas te/ / de nas rgyal pos rang srog bcad/ /

He will beautifully adorn the eastern region As far as the sea with caityas. “He will build, there is no doubt, Monasteries, parks, ponds, Gardens, and of course shelters Throughout the whole country. “This glorious king will establish Road links by building bridges. He will worship the images of the Teacher And cause those with faith to worship them too. “This great king will make the kingdom Trouble-free and without equal. He will live [secular life] for thirty-six years and thirty days, And then he will renounce the world.[3078] “Later, the king will commit suicide By becoming insensible while meditating.[3079]

de 'og de nas lus zhig nas/ / dmyal ba dag tu rab skyes te/ / zhag gsum dang ni gcig dag tu/ / dmyal ba dag gi 'gro bar gnas/ / de nas dmyal ba'i lus bor nas/ / rtag tu rgyal po lha gnas 'gro/ / lha rnams legs sa spyad 'jig rten du/ / gtsang ma'i gnas zhes rab tu dran/ / der ni lha rgyal zhes byar 'gyur/ / dag pa'i bdag nyid byang chub gzhol/ / brgya phrag dang ni stong phrag tu/ / lha yi bde ba rjes su myong / / phyir yang mi lus thob nas ni/ / srid pa gzhan la sangs rgyas 'gyur/ / skye ba gzhan du sems can la/ / de nyid kyis ni las kyang byas/ / grong khyer 'phags rgyal zhes bya ba/ / de tshe ma la bar skye'o/ /

He will become a monk Because of grief for his son.[3080] “When his body gives out, He will fall into the hell realms. Having stayed there For four days,[3081] “After he leaves his hell body behind, The king will be reborn, naturally, In the celestial realm of the pious gods Known as the Pure Abode. Himself pure by nature, he will become The king of gods[3082] destined for awakening. “Having experienced celestial pleasures For hundreds of thousands of years, He will once again be reborn as a human And become a buddha in his subsequent rebirth Due to the acts [of kindness] toward sentient beings Carried out in his previous births. “He lived in the country of Kālava, In the city called Ujjayinī.[3083]

de ni tshong dpon mchog gyur pa/ / ma la bar skyes nor chen ldan/ / 'jig rten stong zhing gnas med pa/ / sangs rgyas 'byung ba med dus su/ / rang sangs rgyas ni 'jig rten du/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po rnam par rgyu/ / sems can rnams la phan don du/ / sa yi steng du rnam spyod de/ / grong khyer 'phags rgyal phyin nas ni/ / bsod snyoms spyod la rab tu zhugs/ / bdag nyid chen po tshogs spyod pas/ / de tshe lam chen grong bar ru/ / de tshe tshong pa de nyid kyis/ / thub pa mngon du mthong bar gyur/ / 'bras chan la ni mgron bos nas/ / de tshe rang gi khyim du khyer/ / de nas thub mchog myur khyer nas/ / stan dag la ni bzhugs su gsol/ / zas kyi dus ni nyer gnas pas/ / bcom ldan de ni dgongs su gsol/ / bdag nyid chen po de dag kyang / / de tshe cang mi smra bar gyur/ / de tshe tshong pa de la ni/ / lhung bzed dag ni zed par gyur/ / tshong pa zur gyis go ba dang / / de tshe blo dang ldan gyur pas/ / rnam pa sna tshogs bza' ba yis/ / lhung bzed rnams ni yongs su bkang / / de nas des ni rang lag gis/ / de dag la ni 'bad pas byin/ / thogs nas de dag thams cad ni/ / mar me'i phreng ba bzhin du mthong / / nam mkha' la ni lus brten nas/ / de dag de yi mod la song / / de nas ba spu langs nas ni/ / de tshe skyo ba mang po gyur/ / yid ni rdzu 'phrul la dad nas/ / sa de la ni rab tu 'gyel/ / smon lam de tshe byed pa yang / / ji ltar tshig tu smra ba ni/ / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yis ni/ / de ring bdag gis gang thob pa/ / des ni thub pa rab mchog ni/ / 'jig rten blo yi mchog 'gyur shog / de tshe sa steng 'khor los sgyur/ / skye ba stong phrag bcu ru 'gyur/ / de nas de yi lus spangs nas/ / bye ba drug cur lha gnas 'gro/ / der ni yun ring bde myong nas/ / lha gnas skye ba yongs bor te/ / de tshe mi yi skye ba ni/ / gzhan gyi dbang gis 'dir yang phyin/ /

There, he became a prominent merchant Of great wealth. “It was a period without a buddha, But some powerful pratyekabuddhas Wandered in the world That was empty and desolate. “Wandering thus in the land Out of the desire to benefit beings, They entered the city of Ujjayinī To seek alms. “While these great beings, the vargacārins,[3084] Were walking along the main street, The merchant, seeing the sages, Approached them “And invited them to his house To partake of some food. Having brought these distinguished ascetics to his home, He promptly offered them seats and said, “ ‘Please join me, venerable sirs! Now is the mealtime.’ The great beings remained silent And did not say a word. “Then they held out their bowls To the merchant for any alms he might give. Communicating with these learned men By gestures, “The merchant filled their bowls With different types of food. He carefully distributed it With his own hand. “Having accepted it, The pratyekabuddhas all went to heaven, Where they can be seen as a string of lights, Nestled in the firmament of the sky. “The merchant, his hair bristling with joy, Very excited, fell on the ground right there, His mind humbled by the great power[3085] [Of the pratyekabuddhas]. “He made an aspiration at that time, Saying the following words: ‘Due to this root of virtue That I have accumulated today, May I become a supreme buddha Just like these eminent sages.’ “Subsequently, he was reborn on earth Ten thousand times as an emperor And, after leaving the human body, Six hundred million times as a god. “When he leaves his existence as a god, Having experienced great pleasures for a long time, He will obtain a human birth in this world, Subject to another’s will.[3086]

de ni rgyal po'i rigs skyes pa/ / thams cad du ni 'dir yang 'gyur/ / rgyal po byis pa zhes bya de/ / shar gyi phyogs su 'byung bar 'gyur/ / skye ba stong phrag brgyad du ni/ / bde ba sgrib med thob 'gyur ba/ / dpal ldan rgyal pos thob pa'o/ / thams cad mkhyen nyid mthar thob 'gyur/ / de ltar rnam mang sems can dang / / de bzhin phun tshogs rgya che ba/ / de tshe mchod dang skul byed pa/ / ston pa la ni su mi byed/ / rig pa dge ba byed pa yi/ / byang chub lam la nges par sbyor/ / de las gzhan pa'i rgyal po ni/ / go DA nus pa'i ngang tshul can/ / gzhon nu zhes bya'i rgyal por gsungs/ / de yang shin tu chos dang ldan/ / de nas gzhan pa dpal ldan bcas/ / yi ge u zhes rnam par grags/ / de las gzhan ni rnam 'byed cing / / de bzhin phan tshun 'jigs par byed/ / de dag go DA drag sems kyis/ / 'di dag 'byed pa chen por byed/ / de nas lha zhes bya ba yi/ / rgyal po lam ni byed par shes/ /

“He will certainly be born In this world into a royal family As the king by the name of Bāla, Who will rule a country in the east. “After thousands of more births Filled with lasting, unadulterated pleasure, This glorious king Will ultimately attain omniscience. “So, knowing how manifold And extensive is the resulting good fortune,[3087] Who would not worship the Teacher And make requests to him? Who would not engage in noble deeds And pursue the path of awakening? “The next king after [Bāla], Who will rule over the Gauḍas,[3088] Will be known under the name Kumāra. He too will be exceedingly virtuous. “After Kumāra, there will be a glorious king Known by the name with the initial U.[3089] After him, the Gauḍas Will fall out with one another “And, with violent thoughts, Will form large factions. Thereafter, there will come the king called Deva, Also known as ‘the Magadhan.’[3090]

dgra rnams kun gyis yongs khyab nas/ / de ni dgra yis bsnun nas shi/ / de'i 'og zla ba zhes ni bya/ / des ni rgyal po nyid kyang byas/ / sngon gyi las kyis bskul nas ni/ / de nas mtshon gyis rmas nas shi/ / de yi bu ni bcu gnyis grangs/ / lo brgyad bcas pa dag tu 'tsho/ /

“He too will be surrounded on all sides, Attacked, and destroyed by his enemies. After him the kingship will fall To the next king called Candra. “[Candra] too will die by the sword Because of his former actions. As for his son Dvādaśa,[3091] He will live on for another several months.[3092]

de yang mtshon gyis rab btab nas/ / de tshe byis pa nyid du shi/ / de dag gcig la gcig sems shing / / drag po phan pa med la dga'/ / rgyal mchog yi ge ta zhes bya/ / de yi tshe na 'byung bar 'gyur/ / go DA'i 'jig rten rnams kyi gtso/ / chen po'i nad kyis yang dag btab/ / nad de nyid kyis nyam thag nas/ / dus byas nas ni 'og tu song / / de 'og yi ge da zhes bya/ / nyin zhag cung zad rgyal po byed/ / go DA'i yul du byung gyur pa/ / gang gA'i 'gram du yang dag gnas/ /

“He too will die by the sword When still a young boy. These kings will relish hostilities, Intent on causing problems for one another. “At that time will rise a stalwart king With the initial of Bh.[3093] The best among the Gauḍa people, He will be stricken with a serious illness. “Overcome by this illness, He will meet his demise. After him, there will be a king with the initial D,[3094] Who will rule only for a few days. “He will be based in the Gauḍa country By the bank of the Gaṅgā.

de 'og yi ge b+ha zhes bya/ / zhag gsum du ni rgyal po byas/ / de nas sa srung rgyal po ni/ / thams cad du ni de tshe 'byung / / rgyal po de ni snyan par smra/ / byas pa gzo zhing stobs kyang che/ / bud med dbang 'gyur bkren zhing glen/ / dgra las rgyal zhing mi phyed 'gyur/ / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas/ / de tshe gtong ba chen por 'gyur/ / mchod rten nyams dga' gtsug lag khang / / kun dga' ra ba rnam mang po/ / rdzing yang chu ni phun sum tshogs/ / bsod nams gang ni legs mdzes pa/ / de dag mang po ston byed cing / / grags dang snyan pa'i don la brtson/ / lha yi stegs ni nyams dga' dang / / phug dang gnas khang dag kyang byas/ / ya mtshan can gyis yang dag gnon/ / sna tshogs mu stegs gnas kyis ni/ / rgya mtsho'i 'gram gyi mthar thug par/ / phyogs de thams cad rnam par gnon/ / brtse ldan longs spyod ldan dpag med/ / rgyal po de ni chos la dga'/ / shar gyi phyogs su rgyas par ni/ / the tshom med par 'byung bar 'gyur/ /

After him there will be a king with the initial Bh,[3095] Who will rule for three days. “After that there will be King Gopālaka, Who will represent everything that a king should‍— He will speak gently, will be compassionate, And will possess great strength. “Under the sway of women as a young man, Heartsick and foolish, he will vanquish his opponents. But when he meets a virtuous friend, He will become very charitable. “He will then build monasteries, caityas, Various pleasant gardens and parks, Ponds full of water, And beautiful hospitals. “Many people will proclaim his fame As one who performs acts of service[3096] Such as building deity shrines, Caves, and dwellings. “The land will be overrun by heretics Belonging to different tīrthika groups. Every place will be overrun by them As far as the ocean’s shore. “This great king, however, being compassionate, Wealthy, and sensible, will patronize the Dharma. This powerful monarch will rule In the eastern territories, there is no doubt.

rtag tu cho gar yang dag ldan/ / ka ba nye bar gnas gyur tshe/ / gang gA'i 'gram la yang dag brten/ / de tshe rgyal thabs byas pa ni/ / lo ni sum cu dag dang bdun/ / lo ni brgyad cu dag ni 'chi/ / de nas de yi lus zhig nas/ / lha rnams dag tu nye bar skye/ /

“In his old age, he will suddenly Fall ill with dysentery.[3097] Having ruled, On the bank of the Gaṅgā, For twenty-seven[3098] years, He will die at the age of eighty. “After his body gives out, He will be reborn in the god realms.[3099]

de nas dpal ldan klu yi rgyal/ / chos kyi bdag nyid chos la dga'/ / mchod rten gang zhig 'di byas dang / / ston pa'i gzugs brnyan yid du 'ong / / de tshe sa steng dge 'dun ched/ / logs su gtsug lag khang dag byas/ / rnam par smin pa de yis ni/ / srid pa tha ma la brten nas/ / nges par sangs rgyas nyid lam dang / / mi g.yo go 'phang thob par 'gyur/ / de yi 'og tu go DAr ni/ / de dag gtsor ni mu stegs gnon/ / shar gyi phyogs su 'byung ba ni/ / grong khyer du ni mu stegs gnas/ / rgyal po'i ming ni bcom ldan zhes/ / go DA'i nang na mthu dang ldan/ / brtul zhugs can ni mthur ldan pa/ / sbyin gnas zhes pas dbang yang bskur/ /

Then[3100] will come a glorious Nāga[3101] king, Devoted to and fond of the Dharma. “He will build caityas and commission Beautiful images of the Teacher. He will also construct monasteries For the saṅgha. “Due to the maturing of this karma, He will, in his final birth, Enter the path to awakening And attain the unshakable state. “From his time onward, the earthly capital of the Gauḍas Will be overrun by tīrthikas. Then, in this eastern city Troubled by the tīrthikas, A king called Bhagavat Will come to power among the Gauḍas. “He will be consecrated by Prabhaviṣṇu, A vow holder from the south.[3102]

der ni rgyal srid byas nas su/ / nub kyi phyogs su yang dag song / / ci 'dod sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i/ / grong khyer nyams dgar rab tu zhugs/ / ma zhu pas ni rab btab nas/ / phyir yang rab tu log par 'gyur/ / shar phyogs rgya mtsho'i mthar thug bar/ / rkun ma rnams kyis yang dag khyab/ / mtshon gyi gnod pas rab bshig nas/ / shi nas yi dgas 'gro bar song / / sa bdag rgyal po mi mang ba/ / des ni lo gsum bar du byas/ / de nas de ni rkun pos bas bsad/ / rdzu 'phrul che ba'i yi dgas song / / de nyid du ni lo gsum bar/ / yi dgas rgyal thabs yongs su byas/ / yi dgas 'jig rten mi bzad pa/ / de nas de ni lus kyang btang / / skye ba de las rnam grol nas/ / rtag tu mtho ris 'jig rten song / / de yi 'og tu rgyal po ni/ / rgya mtsho zhes ni bya bar grags/ / blo ngan lo ni gsum gyi bar/ / blo gros ngan pas rgyal srid thob/ /

Having consolidated his kingship, He will make a [military] foray to the west. “He will wantonly enter The pleasant city of Sāketa But, defeated by the enemy,[3103] Will have to retreat. “In the east, on the ocean’s edge, He will be surrounded by bandits And will die from the blow of a weapon. He will be reborn as a preta. “Having ruled for merely three years Over a small kingdom And then seized and killed by bandits, He will become a powerful preta And rule over the pretas For three years. “He will then leave his preta body And the terrible preta realm. Released thus from his birth as a preta, He will surely go to heaven. “The king that will succeed [Bhagavat] Will be known under the name Samudra.[3104] Dull and feebleminded, He will rule the kingdom for just three days.[3105]

de yi nu bor rnam grags pa/ / thal ba zhes bya'i rgyal po 'byung / / srog gcod pa dang yang dag ldan/ / bab col chen po rab tu byed/ / 'bad pas rang gi lus la yang / / brtse med bag ni med pa'o/ / byis par gyur pas 'di nyid sems/ / pha rol don ni de mi sems/ /

His younger brother who will succeed him Will be known under the name Bhasma. “This mighty lord will engage in excessive killing And commit other despicable acts.[3106] He will be careless and without compassion toward others, But ever careful and vigilant about his own person.[3107] “Unconcerned about the hereafter, He will perform animal sacrificies in this world.[3108]

mi dge'i bshes gnyen la brten nas/ / sdig pa'i las ni mang po byas/ / g.yo ldan de bzhin bkren pa yi/ / bram zes rgyal srid dag kyang gnon/ / mi dang mi ma yin dag gi/ / longs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs/ / rgyal po des kyang rab tu thob/ / de ni mthar gyis song ba dang / / rgyal po nub kyi phyogs dag tu/ / kha che'i sgo yi mthar thug bar/ / byang gi phyogs la brten nas ni/ / der yang g.yul las rnam rgyal nas/ / rgyal thabs de tshe byas pa ni/ / bcu gnyis lo dang zla ba lngar/ / sa la rgyal srid de tshe byas/ /

Having met a nonvirtuous friend, He will accumulate a lot of evil karma. “His kingdom will be overrun With brahmins and pathetic logicians. The people and the pitṛs will enjoy Luxuries of various types, And also the king will obtain Good fortune of many kinds. “This king will gradually Advance toward the west, Until his territory extends up to[3109] The gateway of Kaśmīra. “Victorious in battles there, He will rule his entire kingdom For twelve years And fifteen months.[3110]

de nas de ni nad kyis btab/ / yang dang yang du brgyal bar gyur/ / sdug bsngal chen pos zil mnan nas/ / lus ni zhig nas shi 'phos 'gyur/ / rgyal srid phyir ni rab chags nas/ / de dag phan tshun zhe sdang zhing / / mtshon chen tshogs kyis 'phen pa ni/ / de dag phan tshun byas par 'gyur/ / yi ge sa ming byis pa khye'u/ / de tshe rgyal srid dbang yang bskur/ / mtshan ma tsam zhig de byas nas/ / phyir yang de ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ / bram ze'i gtso bo gnyis kyis ni/ / de dag phan tshun phye nas ni/ / ma ga d+hA yi yul phyin zhing / / u dum bA ra'i grong zhes par/ / bram ze'i gtso bo byis pa gnyis/ / sa steng rang gis dbang yang bskur/ / de nas mthar gyis de song nas/ / shar phyogs su ni yang dag brten/ / go DA'i yul gyi mir yang phyin/ / de tshe 'gran zla med par gyur/ / bdag nyid ngan pa'i rtsod rgyal gyis/ / byis pa'i gtso bo de gnyis pos/ / mi dge'i bshes gnyen la brten nas/ / srog chags mang po rab tu bsad/ /

“When struck with an illness, He will faint again and again, collapsing onto the ground.[3111] Overcome by great pain and with his body failing, He will die and be reborn in lower realms. “Mutual enmities will [then break out in Bengal] Among those greedy for the crown. They will engage in armed struggle, Fighting one another. “At that time, they will consecrate To kingship a young boy with the initial S. The brahmins who will do this Will be divided among themselves, So they will make him a ruler in title only, And then remove him.[3112] “A brahmin will arrive In the province of Magadha, in the city Udumbara, And will consecrate as rulers upon earth Two boys. “They will gradually extend their rule To include the eastern provinces. Once they reach the Gauḍa province, They will have no rivals. “The two boy leaders will be killed By a rogue from Kaliṅga Who, because of his association with bad friends, Will commit many murders.[3113]
gang zhig sngon gyi rgyal pos bkur/ / dpa' bas nga rgyal byed pa gang / / go DAr skye bo gnas pa dag / thams cad dag ni gsod par rtsom/ /
“He will kill All the inhabitants of Gauḍa Who formerly sided With the arrogant, warring kings.[3114]

de nas rgyal po zla ba zhes/ / dpa' bo gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur/ / gang gA'i 'gram gyi mthar thug dang / / bA rA Na sI de las gzhan/ / ston pa'i gzugs brnyan nyams dga' ba/ / blo ngan gyis ni 'jig par 'gyur/ / chos kyi stegs ni mi nyung ba/ / rgyal ba rnams kyis sngon bstan pa/ / blo ngan dag gis bsreg 'gyur zhing / / mu stegs rnams ni gsod par dga'/ / de nas de ni khro dang chags/ / mi sdom log pa'i nga rgyal can/ /

“After him, King Soma, A hero without equals, Will rule as far as the river Gaṅgā, In Vārāṇasī, and beyond. “In his ignorance, he will destroy The beautiful images of the Teacher And, as prophesied earlier by the Victorious One, Will burn the great Bridge of the Dharma “This ignoramus will delight In the teachings of the tīrthikas And will be despised as a cruel And greedy person who holds wrong views.[3115]

mchod rten kun dga' ra ba gnas/ / sa steng gcer bu'i gnas dag kyang / / de nas thams cad 'jig byed cing / / 'tsho ba 'gog pa'ang byed par 'dod/ / yul gyi dbus su rgyal po gzhan/ / de yi dus su 'byung 'gyur ba/ / yi ge ra ming rigs bdag nyid/ / rje rigs kyis 'tsho de las gzhan/ / ston pa'i bstan pa 'di la dad/ / zla ba zhes bya'i rgyal mchog des/ / gcer bu'i rigs gyur rgyal po ni/ / da yang rab tu bsad par gyur/ /

“He will demolish, throughout the land, All the monasteries, gardens, caityas, And shelters for mendicants, And he will also destroy people’s livelihoods. “At that time, there will rise In Madhyadeśa a fine king with the initial R.[3116] He will be dedicated to his work[3117] And unwavering in his vaiśya ways. “This king, capable to follow this teaching,[3118] Will equal the one called Soma But will be overthrown By that king of the Nagna caste.[3119]

yi ge ha ming de'i nu bo/ / dpa' bo gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur/ / dpung ni chen por yang dag ldan/ / dpa' zhing zil gnon rnam par gnon/ / rgyal po yi ge ha bya bas/ / zla bar rnam grags gnas las bton/ / de nas rgyal po rje'u rigs spyod/ / sde chen stobs ni che ba dang / / de tshe shar gyi phyogs dag ni/ / bsod nams che ba'i grong mchog song / / rgyal rigs chos la gnas nas ni/ / chos kyi don shes brtser ldan pas/ / de ni nga rgyal khro tshul gyis/ / srog chags mang po gsod byed cing / / sems can gnod pa byed pa dang / / chad pa byed la rab dga' zhing / /

“Then, his younger brother with the initial H[3120] Will become a hero without equals. He will have a great army And be brave in his conquests. “This H-initialed king from the vaiśya caste, With his powerful army and many soldiers, Will take action to uproot the king Known as Soma. “He will advance against the eastern country And its capital city called Puṇḍra.[3121] He will assume the duties of a kṣatriya With respect to [Soma], who cannot control his pride and anger. “[It is with] compassion, dedication to the Dharma, And understanding [that] he will take many lives But will rejoice only at defeating [Soma], Who is wont to oppress living beings.[3122]

las ngan rjes su spyod byed pa'i/ / zla ba zhes bya pham par byas/ / zla ba zhes bya de phyung nas/ / rang gi gnas na rab tu 'dug / yi ge ha ming slar log nas/ / kla klo'i rgyal pos rab tu mchod/ / yi ge ha bya dge dang ldan/ / dge ba'i don gyi las kyis ni/ / ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'gros dag gis/ / rang gi yul ni nyid du phyin/ / de nyid kyis ni las byas pas/ / rgyal srid dga' dang ldan pa thob/ /

“He will thus defeat Soma, This perpetrator of evil acts. Soma will henceforth be confined To his own country, where he will remain. “The H-initialed king will [then] withdraw, Honored in the kingdom of the mlecchas,[3123] Pleased about his work, and basking in the glory Of someone who dutifully attends to his affairs. “He will go back to his own country, Free to travel wherever he wants to. The task will thus be accomplished By those who took joy in kingship.[3124]

yang na rgyal srid spyod gnas pas/ / longs spyod rab tu thob ldan pa/ / snga mar rang sangs rgyas la ni/ / bza' dang gos ni byin pa dang / / de tshe lham ni byin pa dang / / gos kyis brgyan pa'i gdugs kyang byin/ / de yi las kyi mthu yis ni/ / lha mi'i rgyal srid chen po thob/ / lha dang mi yi phun sum tshogs/ / longs spyod phun sum tshogs ldan spyod/ / zla ba zhes bya'i bram ze'i rigs/ / longs spyod cher ldan gang phyir de/ / bram ze dag la longs spyod byin/ / de tshe rgyal thabs byed pa ni/ / lo ni bcu dang bdun dag dang / / de bzhin gzhan ni zla ba gcig / nyin zhag bdun dang brgyad dag tu/ / kha yi nad kyis yang dag btab/ / srin bu rnams kyis zos nas ni/ / dus byas nas ni 'og tu 'gro/ / mi ma yin pas zil mnan nas/ / de tshe grong de bshig par 'gyur/ /

“[Soma][3125] will now obtain The comforts that attend the royal life, Because he offered in the past Food and clothes to a pratyekabuddha. “He presented him with a pair of shoes And adorned him with a parasol and a whisk. By the power of this karma,[3126] He will become a great king[3127] “And will enjoy a complete array Of pleasures, both human and divine. This brahmin called Soma Will thus be endowed with great pleasures. “He will thus rule his kingdom, Bestowing benefits on the brahmins, For seven and a half years.[3128] “After seventeen years, One month, And seven or eight days, He will develop a mouth disease. “Eaten by parasites, he will die And fall into the lower realms. His capital will then Be destroyed by nonhuman beings.

mi ma yin pas nyen pa yi/ / rims kyis nyam thag nad kyis brgyal/ / sngags kyi sbyor bas 'chi ba ste/ / de tshe rgyal po dus las 'das/ / mnar med pa zhes bya ba yi/ / dmyal bar sdig pa'i las byed rnams/ / sdig pa'i las rnams rjes spyod pa/ / de ni de ru skye bar 'gyur/ / dmyal bar de tshe bskal chen du/ / ma rungs sems ldan 'tshed par 'gyur/ / de nas so thams kyi hud zer/ / yang sos dang ni thig nag dang / / mi bzad ral gri'i nags tshal yang / / yang dang yang du myong bar 'gyur/ / yi dgas 'jig rten dud 'gro nyid/ / de bzhin gshin rje'i 'jig rten du'ang / / de ltar skye ba stong rnams su/ / 'khor bar yang ni 'khor 'gyur yang / / des ni bde ba mi thob cing / / rtag tu sdug bsngal bsten par 'gyur/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la/ / de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis/ / sems ni kun gyis dad byas te/ / nad med phun sum tshogs par song / /

“Due to the ills of his human condition,[3129] The king, his time having come, Will develop fever and a debilitating illness. He will die killed by the mantras used against him. “This evildoer Will then fall Into the hell called Avīci, Propelled by his bad karma. “That evil-minded one Will burn in the Avīci hell for one great eon. After that, he will stay in the hells called Aṭaṭa, Hahava, Sañjīva, Kālasūtra, “And the terrible hell of Asipattra. He will experience these places again and again, And then the worlds of animals, Pretas, and the world of Yama, again and again. “In this way he will circle in saṃsāra, Born there thousands of times, again and again. He will not find any pleasure, But will continually experience suffering. “You should therefore apply yourselves With effort to the doctrine of the Tathāgata, Generating faith with every thought, So that you may go to the place free from the fever of afflictions.

sangs rgyas phan 'dogs byed pa yis/ / 'bras bu mtha' yas 'byung 'gyur bas/ / sangs rgyas la ni dang bar bya/ / chos dang dge 'dun de bzhin no/ / rgyal pos dkon mchog gsum mchod na/ / 'jig rten gyi ni mchog tu 'gyur/ / rgyal thabs chen po'i grags pa thob/ / nor gyi dbang phyug longs spyod che/ / rgyal pos phun tshogs rgya che ba'i/ / bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'thob/ / 'jig rten mchog ni mchod byas na/ / 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid du 'gro/ / de nas brgya byin 'thab bral nyid/ / tshangs pa nyid du'ang yang dang yang / / nyan thos rang rgyal nyid dang ni/ / sa steng sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur/ / theg pa gsum gyi mchog thob cing / / theg pa la ni chags med 'gyur/ /

“Assisting the Buddha, or offending against him, Has infinite karmic results. One should therefore cultivate faith In the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha. “Kings who worship the Three Jewels Become the foremost in the world‍— Great lords with great kingdoms, Many pleasures, and great wealth. “They obtain various types of happiness And vast good fortune. By worshiping the best among men, They attain the status of a sovereign in the world. “They can further attain the status Of a Śakra, a Yāma, or a Brahmā. Here on earth, they can become A śrāvaka, a pratyekabuddha, or a buddha, Obtaining excellence in the three vehicles And arriving at non-attachment following the two.[3130]

de ltar sangs rgyas bsam mi khyab/ / sangs rgyas ye shes bsam mi khyab/ / de dag 'bras bus bsam mi khyab/ / rnam par smin pa'ang bsam mi khyab/ / de nas gzhan yang rgyal po ni/ / zla ba sa steng med pa na/ / phan tshun 'khrug pa'i ngang tshul du/ / go DA'i rgyud ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ / phan tshun ltos pa med par ni/ / de tshe mtshon ni 'debs par 'gyur/ / zhag ni bdun po gcig dang ni/ / de bzhin gzhan ni zla ba gcig / de tshe tshogs kyi rgyal srid rgyud/ / de tshe sa steng byed par 'gyur/ / gang gA'i 'gram gyi grong der ni/ / gtsug lag khang gi gnas kyang byas/ /

“The buddhas are inconceivable; The buddhas’ wisdom is inconceivable; The results they reap are inconceivable; The ripening of the results is inconceivable. “After King Soma’s departure From the earthly realm, There will be mutual discord Within the government of the Gauḍa state, With weapons ever at the ready And without any mutual regard.[3131] “This will last For seven days, one month, or more, Until, inevitably, a people-supported rule[3132] Is established throughout the land On this bank of the Gaṅgā‍— The site of many monasteries.

de nas zla ba zhes bya ba'i/ / bram ze'i khye'u de yi bu/ / zla ba brgyad dang zhag lnga dang / / phyed dang gnyis zhag 'das nas 'chi/ / de'i mthar rgyal po 'dug pa ni/ / klu yi rgyal po zhes bya ba/ / go DA'i yul gyi rgyal po 'byung / / dang por dza ma'i rigs bram ze/ / kun nas rje'u rigs kyis bskor ba'i/ / klu zhes bya ba de yang 'byung / /

“Next after [Soma] Will be his son, Mānava.[3133] He will rule for eight months and five days and will die at night; It will take him one and a half days to die.[3134] “The next king of Gauḍa Will be named Nāgarāja[3135]‍— A young boy of the vaiśya caste.[3136] “Close to him there will be Jaya and the other brahmins.[3137] The so-called Nāgas will all be vaiśyas, And will be surrounded by [other] vaiśyas.[3138]

de yang mu ges gnod pa dang / / de bzhin pha rol dmag tshogs gnod/ / de dag rgyal srid thob pa na/ / chom rkun chen pos kun tu khyab/ / des kyang de yi lugs nyams te/ / der ni lo ni lnga dang gcig / rgyal srid kun nas 'khrugs bzhin spyod/ / srog gcod mang po byas nas ni/ / de tshe srog la gnod par byed/ /

“When stricken by famine, They will be attacked by a foreign army. Without an [adult] king, The kingdom will be plagued by many bandits And will politically deteriorate. “For five years they will Experience a lot of fear and danger. Having killed many beings, They will perish themselves.[3139]

snga ma'i las kyi nyes pa yis/ / rje'u rigs spyod pa de dag byed/ / phan tshun 'khrugs pa'i ngang tshul du/ / de tshe de ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ / de dag de tshe nus ldan tshul/ / rgyal rigs spyod la gnas pa yi/ / go DA'i rgyud kyi mi yi bdag / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / kha cig de tshe mtshon gyis 'chi/ / nad rnams kyis kyang yang dag 'debs/ / de nas dus byas rgyal po rnams/ / dmyal ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur/ / bud med gtso bo'i byis pa ni/ / de yang phyis ni rgyal por 'gyur/ /

“Because of their past transgressions, These vaiśya people Will be predisposed To mutual discord. “At that time, without a doubt, Prabhaviṣṇu of the kṣatriya caste Will become the king Who will govern Gauḍa. “Some [Gauḍa] kings will die by weapons And some will succumb to illness.
