When they die, They will fall into the hell realms. “The next king will be Śiśu, who will defer to women.[3140]

de dag de bzhin zla phyed nas/ / mtshon gyis bsnun nas de nyid bsad/ / mu ge chen po yang dag 'byung / / pha rol dmag tshogs dag gis dkrugs/ / yid ni skrag par gyur pa yis/ / shar phyogs yul mi nyams par gyur/ / de yi yul du mi bdag ni/ / the tshom med par 'byung 'gyur ba/ / bcom brlag skyes pa'i rgyal po mchog / yangs pa can gyi tshong pa sngon/ / de yang lus la mchod pa yi/ / ma ga d+hA yi rgyal por 'gyur/ / de'i yang nu bo yi ge b+ha/ / shar gyi phyogs la yang dag gnas/ / de bu yi ge pra zhes bya/ / shar phyogs nyid du yang dag skyes/ / rgyal rigs mchog tu skyes par bstan/ /

He will rule merely for a fortnight, And then be slain by a weapon. “A great famine will follow, As will an invasion by a foreign army. The eastern provinces will thus become dismembered, And the people terrorized and driven insane.[3141] “These kings will rise in that country, There is no doubt. One born in Mathurā and known to be a vaiśya, Formerly a merchant, Will become the king of Magadha. A superior king, he will become an object of worship. “His descendant, with the initial Bh,[3142] Will live in the eastern country. His son, with the initial P,[3143] will be born, Too, in the eastern provinces. He will be described as a prominent[3144] kṣatriya.

legs par spyod pas byis par bcings/ / lo ni bcu dang bdun dag tu/ / 'ching ba dag la yang dag bzhag / glang rdzi zhes bya'i rgyal pos bcings/ / bcom ldan zhes bya des ni bkrol/ / yi ge ha zhes rgyal chen ni/ / nub kyi phyogs na yang dag 'ongs/ / shar gyi phyogs ni mtha' med par/ / gang gA'i 'gram du gnas par gyur/ / dmangs rigs gzi brjid che ba dang / / sde chen stobs ni che ba dang / / de ni de yul 'gram gnas nas/ / kun tu yang ni rab tu gnas/ / go DA'i skye bo zhes grags grong / / mu stegs zhes kyang rnam par grags/ / rgyal pos de ni rnam mnan nas/ / stobs chen de ni 'dug par gyur/ /

When a young boy, he will be imprisoned.[3145] “He will thus spend seventeen years In prison under supervision. Imprisoned by the king called Gopa, He will be released by the king called Bhagavat. “A great king with the initial H[3146] Will come from a western country And occupy the Gangetic plain As far as the eastern frontier. “This great king will be from the śūdra caste And will have a powerful army with many soldiers. Having consolidated his rule on the banks [of the Gaṅgā], He will then extend it all around. “This very powerful king Will besiege and occupy The city in Gauḍa Known as Tīrtha.[3147]

der ni rgyal rigs byis pa de/ / tshong pa dang ni lhan cig 'ongs/ / der ni nam phyed zhugs nas ni/ / nam gyi mthar ni de yang mchod/ / dmangs rigs rgyal po zhes bya bas/ / slar nyid du ni ldog par byed/ / gang gA'i 'gram gyi mthar thug par/ / grong khyer dga' ba zhes bya bar/ / de tshe rgyal srid ma ga d+hAr/ / byis pa de ni bzhag par gyur/ / bA rA Na sI'i pha rol tu/ / kA shi yul gyi mir yang phyin/ / stobs chen sa yi bdag po ni/ / dmangs rigs der ni zhugs par gyur/ / sdug bsngal nyam thag nad chen pos/ / de tshe bu ni dbang yang bskur/ / byis pa khye'u phug ces pa/ / de tshe rgyal thabs dbang yang bskur/ / chen po'i nad kyis zil mnan nas/ / de tshe sa yang 'khor bar mthong / /

“A kṣatriya youth will arrive, Accompanied by a merchant, And will enter the city at night. At dawn, honors will be bestowed upon him. “The king described as a śūdra Will then return back to The banks of the Gaṅgā, To the city called Nanda. “He will, at that time, appoint that boy To the kingship of Magadha. The śūdra king will proceed to the country of Kāśī And will advance into the city of Vārāṇasī. “Having entered the city, This great and mighty king of the śūdra caste Will fall ill with a serious disease; He will then consecrate his son to kingship. “Having thus been consecrated to kingship The young boy with the name of a planet,[3148] The śūdra king, will succumb to severe illness And fall down upon the earth.

de nas 'bad pas shugs nar phyung / / lus zhig nas ni dud 'gror song / / de tshe zla ba bdun dang brgyad/ / dud 'gro dag tu gnas par gyur/ / de yi skye ba las grol nas/ / lha rnams kyi ni nang du skyes/ / de tshe skye ba nyi shur ni/ / lha yi phun sum tshogs pa thob/ / chos kyi bdag nyid de mthar gyis/ / rang rgyal byang chub thob par byed/ / sngon gyi skye ba'i dus dag tu/ / 'di nyid las ni nye bar bsags/ / bdag nyid chen po rang rgyal la/ / gos kyis kun nas bkab pa dang / / glang po rta dang shing rta'i rgyur/ / lham ni rab tu phul bar gyur/ / de las blo ldan sems dang bas/ / de tshe de la bza' ba byin/ / rnam par smin pa de yis ni/ / lha yi rgyal po brgya byin du/ / skye ba bye ba phrag dgur ni/ / lha yi 'jig rten dag tu gyur/ /

“Struggling, he will breathe his last. His body broken, he will pass to another existence And spend eight months and fifteen days In the animal realm. “When released from his birth as an animal, He will be born among the gods, where, For twenty births, he will experience Various celestial enjoyments. “In due course, after devoting himself to the Dharma, He will attain the realization of a pratyekabuddha. This will happen because of the karma That he accumulated in his former births. “He provided clothes To a great being pratyekabuddha. He gave him shoes, And draft elephants, and horses. He offered him food With all due attention. “By the ripening of this karma He became Indra, the lord of gods. In that celestial realm He passed three hundred million[3149] lives.

sa steng 'ong nas rgyal po ni/ / de nas skye ba 'di la gyur/ / gzhan gyis rjes bsgrubs rgyal thabs ni/ / rjes su spyod par 'gyur ba yin/ / de yi bu yang rgyal po ni/ / bA rA Na sIr rab tu gnas/ / chags 'og rgyal phran gyis bcom pa'i/ / rgyal thabs rnam 'jig 'byung bar 'gyur/ /

When he descends onto earth again, He will become, in that birth, this king.[3150] “He will enjoy a kingdom That has been won by others. His son [Soma] will be installed As king in Vārāṇasī. “The kingdom will be attacked From all sides, pillaged, and destroyed.[3151]

de yi rgyal srid dgra dang ni/ / bram zes phal chen gnod par 'gyur/ / bag med 'dod pa spyod pa dang / / rgyal po de ni gdon gyis 'dzin/ / phyi ma yi ni dus dag tu/ / de nas mtshon gyi brgyab nas 'chi/ / ma ga d+hA rgyal de dag ni/ / phan tshun du ni gnod byed pas/ / zla ba zhes bya'i rgyal po 'das/ / shar gyi phyogs kyi kun nas kyang / / gang gA'i 'gram gyi mthar thug par/ / bA rA Na sI de las gzhan/ / yi ge pra zhes rgyal rigs ni/ / de yi tshe na rgyal po 'byung / / gang zhig dmangs rigs gyur pa ni/ / yi ge ha yis yongs su mchod/ / grong khyer dga' ba zhes bya bar/ / gang gA'i 'gram la yang dag rten/ / sngon gyi las kyis yongs bskul nas/ / rgyal rigs rgyal por 'byung bar 'gyur/ / de nyid las byas byed bcug dang / / rjes su yang ni yi rang byas/ /

It will be filled with brahmins to excess And overrun by enemies. “The king designated as a ‘planet’[3152] Will be careless and pleasure seeking. In the end, he will die After being struck by an enemy. “When King Soma is dead, There will now be mutual strife Everywhere in the eastern region For the kingship of Magadha. “A kṣatriya with the initial P,[3153] Honored [earlier as king] By the śūdra [king] with the initial H,[3154] Will become king in the territory Right up to the bank of the Gaṅgā, Across from Vārāṇasī. “He will rule in the city called Nanda, Nestled on the bank of the Gaṅgā. He will become a kṣatriya king Propelled by the former deeds That he performed and rejoiced at After they were performed.[3155]

de tshe dus ni 'das pa na/ / gser thub ces bya'i ston pa 'byung / / bA rA Na sI'i grong khyer du/ / nor chen ldan pa'i tshong dpon yod/ / tshong dpon bu ni byis pa de/ / byis pa dag gis yang dag bskor/ / sa rdul dag la rtse ba'i phyir/ / lam chen dag tu zhugs par gyur/ / rang khyim mchod rten mchog mthong la/ / pha dang ma ni mchod byed pa/ / de nyid yid la bzung byas nas/ / sa rdul gyi ni mchod rten byas/ / de tshe me tog sman mas ni/ / mchod pa yang ni byed par gyur/ / sangs rgyas dad pa'i dran pa yis/ / sangs rgyas de la'ang bstod pa byas/ / byis pa rnams kyis yongs bskor nas/ / der ni byis pa rtse bar gyur/ /

“A long time ago, during the life Of the Teacher called Kanaka,[3156] There was in the great city of Vārāṇasī A distinguished and wealthy person. “The merchant’s son, a young boy, Kept company with foolish boys. One time he went out onto the main road To play in the sand. “Having previously seen the stūpa in his own house, Worshiped by his father and mother, He visualized such a stūpa in his mind And created it from the sand. “He then offered to this stūpa Some flowers from a used garland And praised it, Recollecting the Buddha with faith. “The boy thus played, Surrounded by other children.

ston pa gser thub rgyal ba yi/ / nyan thos mchog de gcig pu zhig / skyon bral bdag nyid grol ba dang / / khams gsum las ni rnam grol blo/ / de tshe dang por skyon bral ba/ / bsod snyoms la ni rgyu bar gyur/ / bA rA Na sI legs mdzes pa'i/ / de tshe grong khyer rab tu zhugs/ / gang du sa steng byis pa yod/ / de tshe chags bral phyogs der phyin/ / der ni byis pa de kun gyis/ / kun nas yongs su bskor bar gyur/ / 'dir gshegs dge slong 'dir spyon cig / ston pa'i mchod rten phyag byos mdzod/ / bdag cag gis ni 'bad byas na/ / bzang po 'di la mi gzigs sam/ / de nas tshong dpon bu khye 'us/ / rtsa yi thag pa blangs nas ni/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po'i 'dod chags bral/ / rtse ba'i tshul gyis de bcings khrid/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po chags bral bas/ / der gnas rnams la yang dag dgongs/ /

At that time, there was an eminent śrāvaka disciple Of the victorious Kanaka who wandered alone. “He was free of faults, focused,[3157] With a mind free from the three spheres. This fault-free śrāvaka Was doing his alms round. “He entered at that time The beautiful city of Vārāṇasī. Free from attachment, he arrived At the place where the children were. “They all surrounded him On all sides and shouted, ‘Come here monk, come here! Salute the caitya of the Teacher! We carefully built it ourselves. You will not be disappointed.’ “The merchant’s young son Then took a rope of twisted grass And playfully tied it To the dispassionate and very dignified monk. “Dispassionate and dignified, The monk listened attentively.[3158]

sa steng dag tu gzigs pa na/ / de dag gis ni mchod rten byas/ / byis pa'i spyi bor lag byugs nas/ / blo ldan de la 'di skad smras/ / gang du khyod kyi mchod rten byas/ / thong shig khye'u bdag cag 'deng / / gang du sa steng mchod rten ni/ / der yang thams cad 'ong gyur nas/ / de tshe byis pa dang lhan cig / bdag nyid chen po des phyag byas/ / bsod snyoms don du ci 'dod par/ / dpa' bo de ni phyir yang chas/ /

He saw on the ground there The caitya that the children built. Allowing the boy to have his way,[3159] The noble-minded monk said, “ ‘Release me, son! Let us go[3160] where your creation is.’ All of them then went to the place Where the reliquary was. “The dispassionate great being paid homage To the caitya along with the children. The hero then set off again To seek alms as he wished.

de nas tshong dpon byis pa yis/ / chos gos mtha' nas bzung nas ni/ / dge slong de ni bzung khyer ba/ / bshos gsol bya ba'i ched du'o/ / de nas tshong dpon gtso bo des/ / byis pa khye'u de mthong nas/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po chags bral ba'i/ / chos gos mtha' la 'dzin byed la/ / 'jigs shing ba spu ldang ba dang / / nga yi khyim du mchog kyang gshegs/ / myur du rkang gnyis la btud de/ / byis pa yis ni 'dzin pa btang / / bu de yis kyang bzung byas la/ / 'bad pa yis ni bzod gsol byas/ /

“The merchant’s young son, however, Seized the end of the monk’s robe And led him to his own home, Where he arranged for some food. “At this moment the senior merchant, Seeing the boy holding The end of the robe Of the dispassionate and dignified monk, “Became alarmed and his hair bristled. Thinking, ‘An exalted guest has come to my house,’ He fell down at the monk’s feet And promptly made the boy let go of the robe. “Holding back his son, He apologized to the monk in earnest.

skye bo'i mchog gyur phan 'dod pa/ / de yi lhung bzed blangs nas ni/ / sA lu'i tshod ma bza' ba yis/ / lhung bzed dag ni bkang byas nas/ / bu la bos nas smras pa ni/ / yang dag long la 'di la byin/ / de nas byis pa shes ldan pas/ / 'bad pas lag gnyis bkrus nas ni/ / lhung bzed gang ba blangs nas su/ / 'dod chags bral ba la ni phul/ / phul nas myur ba nyid du ni/ / rkang pa gnyis la phyag kyang byas/ / 'dod chags bral bas blangs nas ni/ / gtsug lag khang song zas la spyad/ /

He then took the bowl from the kind [monk], The supreme conqueror of the senses,[3161] “And filled it with food Consisting of rice and condiments. He then ordered his son To take the bowl and pass it to the monk. “The boy, having understood, Carefully washed his hands, Took the full bowl, And handed it to the dispassionate monk. “Having handed it over, He promptly fell at the monk’s feet. The dispassionate one took the bowl, Went back to his monastery,[3162] and ate the food.
bde bar rig pa'i sems kyis ni/ / de tshe 'dod chags bral bar gyur/ / de las byis pa gzhan zhig ni/ / phrag dog sems su gyur nas ni/ / mu stegs rnams la rab dad nas/ / bstan pa la ni de mi mchod/ /
Free from attachment, He obtained a pleasant sense of satisfaction. “Another boy, however, Experienced feelings of envy.[3163]

khro ba'i sems ni kho na yis/ / 'dod chags bral la nyin zhag gzhan/ / bza' bca' ba rnam mang po/ / khyer nas de la rab tu byin/ / khyod la byin pa'i bsod snyoms kyis/ / dge ba cung zad gang yod pa/ / tshong dpon bu ni de bas kyang / / sa steng bdag ni dam par shog /

The next day, Feeling nothing but anger, He took plenty of hard and soft food And offered it to the dispassionate one, saying, “ ‘If there is any virtue In offering alms to you, May I become, through this, Richer than the merchant’s son on this earth.’
de nas mu stegs de kun dang / / de tshe bram ze'i chung ma rnams/ / de nas thams cad 'dus nas ni/ / tha dad par ni 'thab mo'ang byas/ /
“Then all the tīrthikas And all the brahmin wives Gathered together And quarreled, criticizing one another:
byis pa khyed cag yong mi shes/ / ci phyir mgo reg gam du 'gro/ / 'di dag bdag la'ang gnas med na/ / gzhan dag gang du mya ngan zlo/ /
“ ‘Don’t you know this, you fool! How can the “bald heads” get anywhere?[3164] Not abiding in the Self, How could these outsiders ever attain nirvāṇa?’

byis pa de yi sems can la/ / de lta bu yi zhe sdang skyes/ / ston pas nye bar bsngags pa yi/ / chos kyi zam pa grags pa dang / / sa steng lha khang mchod rten mchog / mu stegs rnams kyis de dag bshig / tshong dpon mchog gi bu de la/ / kun nas 'khrug pa'i sems kyang byas/ /

“A similar hatred Arose in the boy. He subsequently destroyed Things that were praised by the Teacher: “The ever-celebrated Bridge of the Dharma And the best monasteries and caityas. He also murdered the son Of that senior merchant.[3165]

mgo reg 'di la byin pa yi/ / sbyin pa'i 'gro ba gang du 'gro/ / ngan 'gro'i 'gro bas zin sems la/ / rnam par gnod pa bdag gis bya/ / gnyis pa byis pa gang yin de/ / zla ba zhes bya'i rgyal po yin/ / rnam smin de yis mi 'dod pa/ / yun ring sdug bsngal rjes su myong / /

“[He said at that time,] ‘What would I gain By giving them a pot of water? I will exterminate these “bald heads” Who are preoccupied with the thoughts of lower rebirth.’ “The boy who said this Will be the king by the name Soma. He will experience pain for a long time, As the inevitable result of his karma.[3166]

tshong dpon mchog gi bu de ni/ / lus zhig nas ni bde 'gror song / / de dang der ni lha gnas su/ / yun ring bde ba rjes su myong / / de tshe de tshe de dang der/ / shi 'phos lha yi 'jig rten gnas/ / de tshe tha ma'i skye ba la/ / thams cad du ni 'ching ba gcod/ /

“The son of that senior merchant Went to heaven when he died. Time after time, he experienced Pleasures among the celestial beings. “Again and again, he lived in the gods’ realms.[3167] When he departs from that realm, In his final birth, He will cut the bonds completely.

tha ma'i skye ba thob pa na/ / mir gyur sa yi bdag por 'gyur/ / las kyis de tshe tshe 'phos na'ang / / de tshe de tshe de dang der/ / 'jig rten dag tu skyes gyur pa/ / sa steng mi yi bdag por byed/ / gang zhig me tog dman ma ni/ / byis pa g.yo ba des phul ba/ / des na longs spyod nyon mongs can/ / de 'di'i 'bras bu nyon mongs ldan/ / sdug bsngal longs spyod thob pa yang / / rgyal po de yi bstan pa nyams/ / mi brtan byis pa'i rang bzhin dang / / ji lta de ltar g.yo sems kyis/ / sa steng ston pa'i mchod rten la/ / mchod pa chen po yongs su byas/ / rnam par smin pa'i las de yis/ / byis pa rgyal po'i dbang phyug byed/ / med par rgyal po byed par 'gyur/ / yod pa rab tu 'jig par 'gro/ /

“In his third[3168] life as a human, He will become the ruler of the land, But, because of his karma, he will fall again and again, At different times and in different places. “His birth will be in this world, Where he will carry out the duties of a king[3169] on earth. Because he had offered to the stūpa, In play, as a child, flowers that had been discarded, “His pleasures will be tainted As the result of his tainted generosity. Like a broken joint,[3170] This king will obtain pleasure with difficulty. “Because his large offering To a Teacher’s reliquary on earth Was done wholly without firmness, naively, And with an unsteady mind, “He will, by the maturing of this karma, Experience instability in his reign‍— Now he will be king, Now he will not.[3171]

byang dang nub kyi bar dag tu/ / de ni rgyal po byed par 'gyur/ / blo gros gang de bcings pa dang / / byis pas yang ni rab dang ba/ / byis pas bcings dang grol ba yi/ / rnam smin las ni de yis su/ / skye ba dag ni lnga brgyar yang / / byis pa bcings dang bkrol bar 'gyur/ / tha ma'i skye ba de yi tshe/ / thams cad du ni 'ching ba bcad/ / lo ni lnga bcu lnga dag gam/ / bdun cu rtsa bdun dag tu 'gyur/ / shar phyogs rgya mtsho'i mthar thug par/ / sa steng de ni rgyal por 'gyur/ / 'bigs byed ri yi nang gnas pa/ / mtha' 'khob kla klo'i rkun ma rnams/ / de dag kun la dbang sgyur ba'i/ / yi ge ba ming rgyal por 'gyur/ / gangs can ri yi nang gnas pa/ / byang gi phyogs la brten pa yi/ / de tshe rgyal rigs rgyal po de/ / yul mi kun la spyod par 'gyur/ /

“He will act as king in the northern, Eastern, and central territories. Because the monk, free in his mind,[3172] Was first bound and then released by the boy, “The boy was, by the ripening of this karma, Bound and released Repeatedly over the course Of five hundred lives. “In his final birth, though, he will Break out of his bondage once and for all. In that life he will rule fifty-five years, Or perhaps seventy-seven. He will be king on earth, Up to the shore of the eastern ocean. “All the mleccha bandits from the borderlands Who live in the Vindhya valleys Will come under the control Of this P-initialed ruler[3173] of the land, “And so will those that live up north, In the foothills of the Himalayas. This kṣatriya king will rule at that time All the provinces.

mi shes byis par gyur pa yi/ / mchod rten sa rdul gyis byas pas/ / 'gran zla med cing gnod med par/ / ma ga d+hA yi rgyal por 'gyur/ / shar phyogs rgya mtshor brten nas ni/ / de 'di 'brog gi mthar thug par/ / blo ldan lo hi ta las gzhan/ / byang du de bzhin kha ba can/ / nub tu kA shi'i nyams dga'i grong / / rtse mo zhes bya'i grong de bzhin/ / 'di yi nang du rgyal po ni/ / ston pa'i bstan pa gsal byed pa/ / de ni seng ge lnga zhes bya/ / pham nas rgyal pos gzhan yang pham/ /

“Because, in his simplicity, He built a stūpa out of sand when still a child, He will become the king of Magadha. He will rule, without rivals and without troubles, Up to the frontier forests And as far as the eastern ocean. “The wise king will propagate The teachings of the Teacher From the west bank of the Brahmaputra To the Himalayas in the north, The pleasant city of Kāśī[3174] in the west, And the city called Śṛṅga [in the south]. “After conquering the two kings Called Pañcakesarī,[3175] The king will consolidate his rule.[3176]

seng ge las skyes thams cad de'ang / / de tshe rtsa nas rnam par bshig / gangs can nang dang shar phyogs dang / / rgya mtsho bcu yi 'gram gnas nas/ / de tshe rgyal rigs brgyad po de/ / yul mi dag ni kun la spyod/ / lha sogs seng ge rgyal po ni/ / g.yon can gzhan la brten pa dang / / 'bigs byed nang na gnas pa la/ / des kyang rang gi rgyal po byas/ / bgrod dka' zhes bya'i yul dbus su/ / dug chen rgyal bas rnam rgyal byas/ / byang shar kun la gnas pa yi/ / seng ge zhes bya de bzhin gzhan/ / zla ba zhes bya'i rgyal po 'das/ / de tshe go DA'i skye bo'ang 'jig / de tshe rgyal rigs sa yi bdag / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ /

The entire [dynastic] family of Siṃha Will be uprooted and destroyed. “This kṣatriya king Will then rule all the provinces In the east including the Himalayan valleys, As far as the banks of the Daśānūpa.[3177] “The Siṃha kings, such as Deva and so forth, Will rule over other rogue peoples, [But] he[3178] will establish himself As the king over [all] the inhabitants of the Vindhyas. “In the middle country said to be difficult to access, An extremely wicked king will rule. There will likewise be another king named Siṃha, Who will rule over the north and the east. “At that time, when even the people of Gauḍa are afraid, There will be, there is no doubt, This kṣatriya king[3179] Described as ‘born prosperous.’

rgyal po mngon 'phel skye zhes bya/ / de yi longs spyod 'phel bar 'gyur/ / de tshe rgan por gyur pa na/ / de yang g.yo ba med par song / / lo ni brgyad cur 'tsho ba ste/ / de bzhin gzhan ni bdun dang bdun/ / de nas 'khogs pas zil mnan nas/ / dus byas lha yi gnas su song / / yun ring lha yi bde ba ni/ / de tshe rgyal pos rjes su myong / / sngon ni kun nas nyon mongs pas/ / las kyi yang ni shi 'phos te/ / rdzu 'phrul chen po klu yi rgyal/ / blo ldan dud 'gro'i nang du gnas/ /

“Born into increasing prosperity,[3180] The king will likewise experience increasing comforts. Even in his old age, His enjoyments will not change. “He will live for eighty years, Seven [months], and seven [days].[3181] Then, overcome by old age, The king will die and go to heaven, “Where he will experience happiness For a long time in the gods’ realms. However, due to his past karma That was tainted by afflictive emotions, He will fall from this realm and spend one month In the animal realm as a powerful nāga king.[3182]

“When he leaves his body of a nāga, He will be reborn among humans As a wise kṣatriya who will become, In terms of livelihood, an accomplished trader.[3183] “Having met a virtuous friend, He will become a follower of the Victor’s teachings And will accomplish the mantra of the goddess Tārā‍— The vidyārājñī of great power and dignity.

tshong pa sngags ni grub pa ste/ / ji ltar 'dod pa'i blo byed cing / / de tshe rig pa'i rgyal po dang / / de tshe bde 'gro dag tu gyur/ / de yi tshe na 'khor los sgyur/ / sna tshogs tog ces rgyal por 'gyur/ / de bzhin du ni blo ldan de/ / de tshe rig 'dzin chos kyang 'chad/ /

“Having accomplished the mantra, He will be a victor who chooses his own destiny And a sugata who becomes A king of the vidyādharas,[3184] “Also known as a cakravartin.[3185] His name will be Citraketu. [Because of his] exploits as a vidyādhara, He will also be called Sagacious.[3186]

lo ni bye ba brgyad cu dang / / de tshe dgu dang bdun du 'gyur/ / lha dang mi yi bde ba yis/ / 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ba yin/ / de yi 'khor du bu mo ni/ / bye ba drug cu skye bar 'gyur/ / de nas de ni lus zhig nas/ / lha mo sgrol ma mnyes byas te/ / lha rnams bdag por song nas ni/ / der ni chos kyang ston par byed/ / rgyal po de ni mthar gyis su/ / myur du byang chub gzhol bar 'gyur/ /

“As a cakravartin, He will experience divine and human pleasures For eight hundred million years, Nine [months], and seven [days].[3187] He will have a retinue of Six hundred million young girls. “When he leaves his body, he will, Propelled by the goddess Tārā, Become the lord of gods, To whom he will teach the Dharma. Stage by stage, this king will swiftly progress Toward awakening.[3188]
de yang lo ni gsum dag tu/ / rgyal po'i dbang phyug byas nas ni/ / yi ge pa yi rgyal po 'das/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / phan tshun rgyud ni byas nas su/ / rtsod pa chen po la yang gnas/ /
“After the death of the P-initialed king,[3189] At that time, during the debased eon, There will ensue a great, mutually destructive struggle Among the pretenders to the throne.[3190]

P’s minister will rule the kingdom For seven days. “After seven days he will be succeeded By a king with the initial V, Who also, attacked and overthrown, Will be forced to go into exile. “The [king] with the initial Bh, Accepted as the successor of the king P, Will rule the kingdom For three years.
de yi nu bo yig pa zhes/ / brtul zhugs can du rnam par gnas/ / lo ni gsum dang gcig dag tu/ / rgyal srid yongs su 'phel bar byas/ /
“His younger brother,[3191] with the initial V, Will be supervised by a vow holder. He will bring economic growth[3192] Over a period of four years.[3193]

de ma thag tu 'khru bas btab/ / 'di dag gnyi ga 'chi bar gyur/ / 'jig rten dus 'das shi nas ni/ / gnod sbyin dag gi nang du skyes/ / de gnyis mthar gyis chos ldan pas/ / rang rgyal byang chub thob par 'gyur/ / de'i yang nu bo yig pa zhes/ / rgyal rigs kyi ni chos la dga'/ / de yang rgyal po lo gsum du/ / mi yi bdag po byed par 'gyur/ / de'i yang nu bo rgyal po ni/ / yi ge dza zhes rnam par bsgrags/ / de yang yul ni 'di dag tu/ / sa kun gyi ni bdag por 'gyur/ /

“Both of them[3194] will fall ill with indigestion And fall unconscious due to a sudden onset of dysentery.[3195] After they die in this world, They will be reborn as yakṣas. In due course, they will turn toward the Dharma And attain the realization of a pratyekabuddha. “His[3196] younger brother, with the initial Dh,[3197] A kṣatriya devoted to the Dharma, Will be king,[3198] a lord of men, For three years. “After him, his youngest brother,[3199] Widely known by the name beginning with V,[3200] Will become the king of the country, Ruling over the entire territory.

rta dang shing rta glang po dmag / kun nas gru dang theg pa yis/ / g.yul du nye bar gnas nas ni/ / dgra yi tshogs ni kun las rgyal/ / des ni yul 'di ma lus dang / / sa rnams thams cad nyid la ni/ / ston pa'i gzugs brnyan lha khang dang / / de bzhin rgyal ba'i mchod rten dang / / sa rnams dag ni thams cad la/ / thams cad mdzes par byas par gyur/ / de tshe sngon gyi rgyal po de'i/ / bram ze de bzhin shAg rigs skye/ /

“With elephants, horses, chariots, and boats In every direction,[3201] He will conquer all the enemies That he faces in battle. “He will adorn all the provinces And all the land With images of the Teacher, monasteries, And reliquaries of the victorious ones. He will maintain all of them well, And make the entire earth more beautiful. “He will be of royal ancestry, A twice-born of the Śākya line.[3202]
nga rgyal shes rab ldan zhing rno/ / byang chub mthar byed nga rgyal blo/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / de nyid 'di yi grogs nyid 'gyur/ /
He will be noble, of keen intellect, and wise. With his noble intellect, he will be destined for awakening. “At that time, during the debased eon, He will obtain lasting happiness.[3203]

rgyal po chos la dga' ba yi/ / rgyal rigs kyi ni mchog tu gsungs/ / lo ni nyi shu bdun dang brgyad/ / de ni de tshe 'tsho bar 'gyur/ / bud med byas pa'i skyon nyid kyis/ / dus byas nas ni lha gnas 'gro/ / blo ldan de ni mthar gyis kyang / / bla med byang chub thob par 'gyur/ / de nas grags pa dpal zhes bya/ / de bzhin sa yi bdag po ni/ / u DI ya na rgyal po che/ / chos la dga' ba 'byung bar 'gyur/ / u DI yan gyi grong mchog la/ / grong khyer yi ge pa zhes bya/ / der ni rgyal po byed pa ste/ / kun nas dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur/ / der ni de tshe brgyad dag gi/ / gtsug lag khang yang byed par 'gyur/ /

Described as a kṣatriya of outstanding intellect, This king will patronize the Dharma. He will live one hundred and twenty years And, if he takes care, another seven or eight years. “He will die due to problems brought on by women And ascend to the celestial realm. Proceeding through the stages, This wise king will attain the ultimate awakening. “After him, the lord of the land Will be known by the name of Śrī. In his governance of Gauḍa,[3204] This great king will patronize the Dharma. “He will conquer his enemies all around And will rule his kingdom From the capital city of Gauḍa whose name begins with B,[3205] And which has a large population. “He will build seven monasteries there, Followed by another eight.[3206]

bram ze'i gtso bo de bzhin ldan/ / shAkya'i skyes zhes yang dag brten/ / de yi grogs la brten nas ni/ / 'khor yug tu ni rgyal srid byas/ / lo ni brgyad cu gcig bcas par/ / mi yi bdag po der 'tshor 'gyur/ / las byed skyon gyis chos bdag nyid/ / dus byas nas ni lha gnas 'gro/ / lha rnams kyi ni rgyal thabs kyang / / de bzhin mthar gyis byed par 'gyur/ / de nas lus de zhig nas kyang / / mtho ris las kyang mtho ris 'gro/ / de yi byang chub rgyu dag ni/ / dge ba'i chos ni yongs rdzogs byas/ / de yi bran nyid rgyal po ste/ / rgyal srid gnod med byed par 'gyur/ / yi ge'i dang po ya zhes bya/ / sa yi bdag po 'byung bar 'gyur/ / lo ni bdun dang gcig dag tu/ / de yi dus su rgyal srid byed/ / de gcig bud med rnams kyis ni/ / brdegs nas kyang ni shi bar 'gyur/ / yi ge pa rgyud yang byung ba/ / rgyal rigs rgyal por 'gyur ba yin/ / des ni bran tshogs rnams bsad nas/ / rang dbang du ni yongs su gyur/ /

He will form an alliance With a prominent brahmin called Śākaja. “Ruling with him as his ally, He will consolidate his rule throughout. This king will live Eighty-one years. “He will die through his minister’s fault But, devoted to the Dharma, will ascend to heaven. In due course, he will act As king of the gods. “When he dies, he will go to heaven And move on an ever-higher realm, Skillfully fulfilling the conditions For attaining awakening. “On earth, his minister will become the king And will rid the kingdom of troubles. The name of this ruler Begins with Y.[3207] “During that period He will rule the kingdom for eight years. Killed by women, He will proceed to the lower realms. “The next king will be, again, A kṣatriya of the P dynasty.[3208] He will kill a group of ministers Who are closely connected.[3209]

mi dge'i bshes gnyen la brten nas/ / rnam mang srog ni gcod pa yin/ / dpa' zhing 'byor la rmongs par ni/ / 'jig rten kun la 'byung bar 'gyur/ / g.yo zhing myur du byed pa na/ / chang dang g.yo sgyu can la dga'/ / chang gis bag med rnam rmongs nas/ / des na de ni sa la nyal/ / dgra rnams kyis ni brtson byas nas/ / mtshon chas bsnun nas de gsod 'gyur/ / de nas de ni lus zhig nas/ / dus byas nas ni 'og tu 'gro/ / de yi spun zla gnyis pa ni/ / ming ni yi ge ra zhes shes/ / nyin zhag bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad du/ / de tshe sa la rgyal srid byas/ / bram ze rnams la nor byin nas/ / the tshom med par dus kyang byas/ / de nas gzhan yang sa bdag ni/ / de tshe rgyal po bzang po byung / /

“Having met a nonvirtuous friend, He will kill many beings. Infatuated with his great power, He will rule the entire realm. “He will be quick to act, fickle, And a drunkard fond of rogues. He will pass out on the floor In a drunken stupor. “He will be struck and slain with weapons By enemies ready to kill. With his body thus destroyed, He will die and fall into the lower realms. “On earth, one of his brothers,[3210] Known by the name beginning with R,[3211] Will then rule the kingdom For forty-eight days. “He will provide the brahmins with wealth, Without a doubt, until his death. The king next after him Will be a ‘dog eater,’ and so forth.[3212]

de yang dmangs rigs skye nas ni/ / yan lag ma tshang ngan pa nyid/ / chos min phal cher tshul khrims 'chal/ / 'thab pa la yang rtag tu dad/ / bram ze'i tshogs dang rgyal phran dang / / sdom brtson de bzhin rab byung ba/ / kun la yang ni gnod byed cing / / rtag tu tshar gcod dag la'ang dga'/ / drag pos 'dul bar byed pa dang / / de bzhin rkun ma rnams kyang gsod/ / ma rungs thams cad gnod byed cing / / ya mtshan can gyi brtul zhugs sten/ / rnam par grol la'ang sbyin mi byed/ / de tshe rgyal srid byed par 'gyur/ / lo ni bcu dang bdun gyi bar/ / der ni sa bdag 'tsho bar 'gyur/ / mdze yi nad kyis sdug bsngal nas/ / de nas dus byas dud 'gror 'gro/ / dud 'gro dag las klu rgyal du/ / gdengs ka che ldan mgyogs par 'gro/ /

“He will be from the śūdra caste, Crippled, and thoroughly reviled. He will be averse to the Dharma, undisciplined, And always delighting in war. “Not only will he neglect all his vassals, The brahmins, the ascetics, And the Buddhist monks, But he will always delight in oppressing them. “He will mete out severe punishments And execute bandits. He will suppress all the rogues Adhering to wrong vows. “He will thus rule the kingdom Without making any provision for final liberation. This king will live Seventeen years only. “After succumbing to the ravages of leprosy, He will die and be reborn in the animal realm, Where he will be a bold king of the nāgas With a big hood.[3213]

mchog tu 'jigs rungs lus ldan zhing / / de tshe sgra ni drag par sgrogs/ / de la lor ni mi 'dod pa/ / yun ring sdug bsngal rjes su myong / / sa srung 'jig rten 'phel byed pa/ / 'jig rten kun gyis shes pa ste/ / lus can shar phyogs gnas pa yin/ /

“His form, with an expanded hood,[3214] Will inspire utter dread.[3215] He will experience suffering for a long time As an inevitable result[3216] of Dharmic laws. “Described as they [here have been], These kings, who will make the people prosper, Will have their base in the eastern region And will be known throughout the entire world.[3217]

rgyal po yi ge pa zhes pa'i/ / rgyud rnams rgyud du skyes pa gzhan/ / rgyal rigs dpa' bo rnam par gnon/ / de bzhin rgya mtsho gsum gyi bdag / bde chen stobs ni che ba dag / shar gyi phyogs su 'byung bar 'gyur/ / ston pa'i mchod rten bzang po dang / / gtsug lag khang dang 'dug gnas khyim/ / rnam pa sna tshogs skyed mos tshal/ / rdzing dang khron pa bkad sas bskor/ / de bzhin rtag tu bsod nams khang / / sa ni mdzes par byed par 'gyur/ / de nas thub mchog dam pa dang / / theg pa bla na med la brten/ / shAkya'i rab byung de nyid ni/ / rtag tu de ni rab gnas byed/ / mi khom rnams ni spong byed cing / / dal ba nyid kyang legs par thob/ / yi ge ka zhes rnam par bsgrags/ / 'jig med dran dang ldan pa nyid/ / lo ni nyi shu gcig bar du/ / sa skyong rgyal srid byas par 'gyur/ / de nas gsud nad kyis btab ste/ / dus byas nas ni lha gnas 'gro/ / blo ldan de ni mthar gyis su/ / myur du byang chub gzhol bar 'gyur/ / de yi lhag ma'i rgyud las kyang / / gzhan la rab gnas 'tsho byed pa/ / de yi 'og tu sa skyong ba/ / sa srung 'tsho bas gnas pa yin/ / bram ze bkren pa'i skye bo ni/ / the tshom med par 'byung bar 'gyur/ /

“Born to a hereditary line Branching off from that of King P, There will be another king, a mighty kṣatriya hero Who will rule over the three seas.[3218] “With a great and powerful army, He will rule in the same eastern region And adorn the earth With divine reliquaries of the Teacher, “Monasteries, houses, temples, And gardens provided with various Ponds, well, pavilions, And, of course, hospitals and shelters. “Devoted to the supreme victors, He will follow the supreme vehicle And certainly become A Śākya renunciant. “He will avoid the unfree conditions And cultivate the free conditions.[3219] He will be known by the name beginning with K,[3220] Will have a good memory, and be skillful. “This king will rule the kingdom For twenty-one years, Until he dies of cholera. He will be reborn in the celestial realm. “This wise king will progress through the stages, Destined to attain awakening before long. The remaining members of his royal line Will live in subordination to others. “The kings after him Will be the Gopālas[3221] of the servant caste. The people, without a doubt, Will be stingy toward the twice-born.

de yi dus su chos min ldan/ / ston pa'i bstan pa nges par nyams/ / sngags kyi bstan pas sems can rnams/ / dge ba'i don du nges par sbyor/ / gang zhig gzhon nus bstan pa yi/ / sngags ni longs spyod 'phel byed pa/ / rgyal po'i dbang phyug don du ni/ / de tshe de'i yul phyogs su yang / / grub pa mchog ni bsgrub bya min/ / chos kyi 'khor lo nyams dga' dang / / de bzhin 'od ma'i tshal chen dang / / gang du bcom ldan de zhi bar/ / phung po med par rab zhugs pa/ / sngags gnyis 'di dag bsgrub bya ba/ / lha mo sgrol ma khro gnyer can/ / rtag tu rgya mtsho'i 'gram dang ni/ / snying po med pa'i 'bab chu mchog / gang gA'i 'gram ni thams cad du/ / pad+ma 'byung ba bsgrub par bya/ / sa bcu thob pa'i bdag po ni/ / gang yang byang chub sems de yang / / sems can rnams ni 'dul byed pa/ / zla ba zhes ni rnam par bsgrags/ / rig pa'i rgyal mo rdzu 'phrul che/ / de ni sgrol ma zhes kyang bstan/ / bud med gzugs 'chang lha mo ni/ / 'gro ba kun tu rnam par rgyu/ / snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis ni/ / sems can rnams la phan don du/ / mi mjed 'jig rten khams gnas nas/ / bud med ming gis 'jug par byed/ / sa bcu la ni rab gnas thob/ / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul che/ /

“During that lawless period When the teachings of the Teacher are lost, One will, [nevertheless], be able to bring Benefit to beings by reciting mantras. “The mantras that bring prosperity That were taught by the divine youth Will be accomplished during that time In order to guarantee the king’s sovereignty. The supreme accomplishment, however, Will not be accomplished at that time in that country. “The mantras that will be accomplished In the places where the Dharma wheel was turned, The pleasant grove of Mahābodhi[3222] Or the place where the Blessed One attained The peace that is free from rebirth, Are those of the deities Tārā and Bhṛkuṭī. “As always, the [mantras of] the Lotus family Will be effective in places such as the ocean’s shore, Near the supreme thundering river,[3223] And everywhere along the banks of the Gaṅgā. “The bodhisattva known by the name Candra Is said to be Tāra, the savior. With this name, he is also Tārā,[3224] The vidyārājñī of great power and majesty. “Having morphed into a goddess with a female form, He wanders throughout the entire world In order to benefit beings, With the mind tender with compassion. “In the world sphere of Sahā, He abides in the form called ‘woman,’ Who, nevertheless, is a powerful bodhisattva lord Abiding on the tenth level.[3225]

sems can rnams ni 'dul byed pa/ / lha mo sgrol ma zhes su bstan/ / 'di ni 'bad med grub pa ste/ / srung dang skyob dang sbed par byed/ / longs spyod dbang phyug 'phel byed pas/ / 'di ni lha mo bsgrub par bya/ / byang chub tshogs kyi ched du ni/ / skyed pa nyid nas brtsam par bya/ /

“Famed as the goddess Tārā, He guides sentient beings And provides protection, shelter, and cover With his effortless magical power. “One should strive to accomplish [the mantra Of] this goddess who brings opulence and power And constitutes the cause for accumulating [The merit and wisdom] necessary for awakening.[3226]

snying rjes brlan pas lus can la/ / de tshe lha mo rjes 'brang ba/ / sngags kyi gzugs kyis sems can la/ / byang chub tshogs ni bya phyir ro/ / re ba thams cad dga' rgyas phyir/ / shar gyi phyogs su gnas pa yin/ /

“This goddess, at that time, will be connected, Through her compassion, to living beings, Constituting, in the form of the mantra, The cause for their accumulations that lead to awakening. “She resides in the eastern region,[3227] Bringing happiness and nourishment to everyone.[3228]

bdag nyid rnam pa stong dang ni/ / rnam pa mang por byas nas kyang / / rgya mtsho bzhi yi mthar thug par/ / sa rnams kun tu rnam par rgyu/ / de nas shar gyi phyogs su 'am/ / yang na bA rA Na sIr 'grub/ / lha mo de yi zhing du ni/ / shar gyi phyogs su rab tu bstan/ / 'od chen po ni dzam b+ha la/ / gnod sbyin rgyal po yang dag 'grub/ / de tshe longs spyod ma lus 'dod/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / lha mo sgrol ma gnod sbyin rgyal/ / de nor rgyas pa 'dod pas sgrub/ / de tshe khro bo'i sngags dag ni/ / lho phyogs dag tu bsgrub par bya/ / kla klo rkun ma'i gling dang ni/ / de bzhin rgya mtsho'i nang du ni/ / stobs chen sgrol ma gnod sbyin rgyal/ / de bzhin du yang 'grub par 'gyur/ / ha ri kel ka da raM tsa/ / kA ma rU pa gA dA hA ya hi/

She manifests in five hundred forms[3229] That [each] emanate many more. “She wanders the entire earth, As far as the four oceans. Her accomplishments will manifest Throughout the eastern region, in Vārāṇasī and beyond. “The eastern region is famed As the territory of this goddess. There, too, can be accomplished Jambhala, A yakṣa king of great splendor. “At that time during the debased eon, Those who desire affluence will be successful In accomplishing the yakṣa king and the goddess Tārā, Who fulfill the wishes for prosperity. “Similarly, the wrathful mantras Will be effective in the southern region, Including the islands in the middle of the ocean Inhabited by mlecchas and pirates. “Tārā and the powerful yakṣa king Will be accomplished also[3230] In Harikela, Karmaraṅga, Kāmarūpa, and Kalaśa.

pho nya mo tshogs rnam mang dang / / gnod sbyin rdzu 'phrul chen mo 'grub/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis gang gsung sngags/ / longs spyod kyi ni rgyur 'gyur ba/ / de bzhin yul der grub pa ste/ / gzhan yul de bzhin ma yin no/ / shar phyogs dang ni phyogs mtshams su/ / rnam pa sna tshogs sngags kyi rgyur/ / de yi dus su bstan pa ni/ / lus can rnams kyis bsgrub par bya/ / dbus kyi yul du de bzhin sngags/ / de bzhin sa srung mang po ni/ / rgya che thams cad nyam chung ba'i/ / blo chung rnams kyis rtogs par byed/ / rgyal po'i gtso bo mdor bsdus nas/ / ming ni 'di dag nges par brjod/ / dang po'i yi ge sha dang na/ / dang po'i yi ge par yang bstan/ / dang po'i yi ge ba dang e/ / dang po'i yi ge ar yang bstan/ / dang po'i yi ge har bstan te/ / dang po'i yi ge par yang bsgrags/ /

“The mantras of all the various dūtīs And the powerful yakṣiṇīs, And the wealth-bringing mantras Chanted by Mañjughoṣa, Will be effective in those places And no other. “There, in the eastern and the intermediate directions, The mantras that serve different purposes Taught for that particular time Will be also accomplished by living beings. “In Madhyadeśa, there will be Various ministers[3231] and kings Who, generally, will be of weak character, Limited intelligence, and inferior understanding. The most important of them Are briefly enumerated below. “Known by their initials, Their names begin With the letters M, N, P, D, I, S, and A. “Further, there will be those With the names of Graha, and Kīrti[3232] And those with the initials H and Ś.[3233]

dang po'i yi ge dza dang ba/ / dang yig d+ha ni zla ba'i rigs/ / yi ge ha nyid rnam bsgrags dang / / de bzhin yang ni dang po'i a/ / dang po'i yi ge sa la yang / / bud med rigs min 'jig rten sdang / / dang po'i yi ge a dang ma/ / 'jig rten rnams la mthu dang ldan/ /

“There will be those from the lunar dynasty[3234] With the initials J, B, and L,[3235] And those with the initials H, Pra, and A.[3236] “There will be those with female names Beginning with S and L, respectively, who will antagonize the people, And those with the initials S and M Will enjoy full sovereignty over the people.[3237]

rim gyis rim gyis rigs dag ni/ / bram ze rje'u rigs dag tu 'jug / phal cher chos min las byed cing / / rnam sdang bud med la brkam chags/ / sa srung skyon ni rab mang bar/ / de tshe dus kyi tha ma la/ / yul gyi dbus su mi yi bdag / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / dus kyi tha mar 'di dag tshe/ / lo ni brgya dang nyi shu nyid/ / de yi tshe na mi rnams kyi/ / tshe ni ring bar rab tu bstan/ / de dag bar ma bzang po las/ / khyad par ring dang thung ba yin/ /

“Gradually, concerning their typical occupation, The brahmins will take on the lifestyle of the vaiśyas. Most of them will commit acts contrary to the Dharma, Sowing discord and lusting after women. “At that time, in this debased eon, The kings will have huge retinues. This will no doubt be the case With the kings of Madhyadeśa. “At that time, during this debased eon, A human lifespan Of one hundred and twenty years Will be extolled as long. “Among the prominent people of Madhya[deśa], There will be those long- and short-[lived].[3238]

rgyal po rnams ni tshe thung bar/ / de tshe dus su bstan pa ni/ / gang gA'i 'gram gyi ngogs dang ni/ / gangs can gyi ni ri zhol dang / / de tshe kA ma rU yul du/ / de 'dra'i rgyal po 'byung bar 'gyur/ / dang po bar ma tha ma yi/ / rigs kyi lhag ma brjod bya ste/ / dang po'i gtso bo chen po ni/ / rna can rgyal por rab tu bsgrags/ / tha ma ang ga'i bdag po dang / / der ni 'byor bzad 'byor pa dang / / legs byin srid pa byin pa ni/ / kA ma rU pa'i yul du byung / / tha mar legs 'byor gzhon nu dang / / yi ge ba dang tha gnyis ni/ / yangs pa can du yang dag byung / / gang du thub pa de skyes pa/ / ser skya zhes bya'i grong mchog tu/ / tha mar zas gtsang shAg rigs kyi/ / nyi ma bu ram rigs skyes pa/ / tha mar zas gtsang rnam bsgrags pa/ / shAkya shAkya'i rnam 'phel byed/ /

All the kings foretold for this eon Will have a short lifespan. “On the banks of the Gaṅgā, In the valleys of the Himalayas, And also in the country of Kāmarūpa, There will be kings as listed below. “They are the first, the middle,[3239] and the last. Those specified for the country of Aṅga Are as follows: the first one, Vṛtsudhāna, Will be known as Karmarāja,[3240] “And the last Aṅga king Will be Subhūtibhūti.[3241] In Kāmarūpa, there will be Sudaha[3242] and Bhavadatta, Who will be casteless.[3243] “In Vaiśālī, at the time of V and Th, The last crown princes were Subhū and Mṛga.[3244] In the fine city of Kapilavastu, Where the Sage was born,[3245] “The Śākya-born kings that ended with Śuddhodana Are said to descend from the solar Ikṣvāku dynasty. Śuddhodana is generally regarded as the last Śākya king Under whom the Śākyas prospered.[3246]
sems can brtson 'grus chung bar ni/ / 'jig rten skyes mchog bstan pa yin/ /
“The most eminent of men Also taught the mantras of the lesser capacity.[3247]

gang zhig rgyal bas gsung sngags dang / / de bzhin bran po'i tshogs kun dang / / pho nya'i tshogs kun du ma dang / / rdo rje pad+ma'i rigs dag kyang / / rgyud rnams kun gyi don rig pas/ / bsgrubs na 'grub par 'gyur ba yin/ / 'jig rten kun gyi sngags dag ni/ / yul gyi dbus der grub par 'gyur/ / dbus yul gnas par khyad par du/ / rgyal bas gsungs pa bsgrub par bya/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rtags dang ni/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rgyud dag dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs sbyor bar ldan/ / lus can rnam pa sna tshogs 'grub/ /

These mantras, taught by the victors, Namely the mantras of all the ceṭa groups, “The various dūtī groups, And all such mantras that belong to the Vajra and Lotus families, Will all succeed when employed By the adepts of the mantra system. “All these worldly mantras Will be effective in Madhyadeśa, Particularly those that the victors Said reside[3248] in Madhyadeśa. “With their different characteristics And different modes of function, These mantras are employed in various manners, Bringing to beings various accomplishments.[3249]

dbus kyi yul du de bzhin sngags/ / longs spyod 'phel ba bsgrub par bya/ / de bzhin lus can bsrung don dang / / skyob dang dbang dang dgug pa 'grub/ / dbus kyi yul du mi yi bdag / 'das dang ma 'ongs rab tu gsungs/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rtags dang ni/ / rnam pa sna tshogs tshe dang rigs/ / rgyal po thams cad gsungs pa ni/ / mchog dang tha ma bar ma yin/ / de bzhin rnam gsum grub pa ste/ / dus kyang gsum du sbyar bar bya/ / de bzhin sngags kyang rnam gsum du/ / de bzhin thub pa mchog gis gsungs/ /

“Thus, the mantras particular to Madhyadeśa Are effective in bringing prosperity. They are also used for the sake of protection, Succor, and enthralling and attracting living beings. “The past and the future kings Of Madhyadeśa that have been listed Are distinguished by their various characteristics, Such as different lifespan or family lineage. “All these kings are said to be Of either superior, middling, or inferior types. The accomplishments, likewise, are of three types. The mantras that were taught by the most eminent of sages Are, accordingly, of three types And should be employed at three different times.[3250]

rgyal po mtha' yas gsungs pa ni/ / dbus kyi yul dang nub phyogs dang / / byang phyogs dang ni shar phyogs dang / / de bzhin phyogs mtshams thams cad dang / / rnam pa bzhi ru mtshon pa yi/ / gling dag de bzhin kun tu yang / / sa bdag mtha' yas rab gsungs pa/ / mtha' yas sngags ni sgrub pa dang / / mtha' yas yul la gnas pa dag / mtha' yas sngags ni yongs su 'grub/ / thub pa'i bstan pa nub pa na/ / tshar gcad rjes su gzung bar byed/ / dus su rgyal po dag la sngags/ / 'jam dpal gyis ni gsungs pa yin/ / rdzu 'phrul rtse dang rnam 'phrul dang / / 'dir ni dus kyi spyod pa'ang bstan/ / sngags kyi bdag nyid sems can gyi/ / 'gro ba skye gnas rgyal po'i ming / /

“Innumerable kings have been specified For Madhyadeśa; the west, The north, the south, and the east; For all the intermediated directions; And also for the outer islands, All divided into four groups.[3251] “The kings are said to be innumerable, And so are the mantra practices; The mantra accomplishments, ascribed To innumerable regions, are also innumerable. “When the teachings of the Sage have disappeared, For that particular time, Mañjughoṣa taught, with reference to kings,[3252] The mantras intended for suppressing or fostering. “Taught here are also time-specific performances For the sake of play, protection, or magic; The great [benefits of] the mantras; the types of birth of beings; And the names of the kings.[3253]

sngags ni sgrub par 'dod rnams la/ / yul dang dus ni yang dag bstan/ / bstan pa nub pa'i 'og tu ni/ / zhar la rgyal po rnams kyis bstan/ / yon tan bdag nyid che sngags rnams/ / tha mar 'bras bu rtogs par byas/ / rgyal po gzhan ni theg pa dang / / sngon ni 'gal ba med par bstan/ / dus kyi tha ma de dus su/ / rab tu gnas par the tshom med/ / de dag phyogs la gnas par ni/ / rgyal po thams cad gsungs pa yin/ / de bzhin shAkya'i gsung rab la/ / nges par rab byung gnas nas ni/ / 'jig rten mig gcig gyur pa yi/ / thub pa mchog ni med pa na/ / rtag tu sngags smra la dad pas/ / bstan pa'i don ni byed par 'gyur/ / de dag gzhon nu bshad par bya/ / rtse gcig yid kyis mnyan par gyis/ /

“For those intending to do a formal mantra practice, There is a prescribed time and place. When the teachings of the path have disappeared, There are kings foretold who will, As required in these circumstances, teach about The greatness of mantra qualities and the final fruit.[3254] “These kings, previously instructed In the two transcendent vehicles, Will establish themselves at that time, during the debased eon, As foretold, there is no doubt. All of these kings are specified For their [respective] regions. “Having renounced the world and adhering firmly To the doctrine of Śākyamuni, They will serve the cause of the instructions And always delight in the mantra teachings.[3255] “I will now speak, O divine youth, about those who will come After the best of sages‍—the one whose supreme vision Is uniquely focused on the world‍—has departed. Please listen with undivided attention.[3256]

ston pa'i gsung rab sa steng du/ / dus mthar 'jig rten nyams pa na/ / sdom brtson rgyal po'i tshul gyis ni/ / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / dper na ma khol zhes bya dang / / me tog ces byar rnam par grags/ / yi ge ma zhes gzhon nu zhes/ / dang por tha mar chos la dga'/ / klus bos zhes bya rnam par grags/ / rin chen 'byung zhes bya ming dang / / yi ge ga zhes gzhon nu zhes/ / yi ge ba zhes chos sems byed/ / yi ge a ming bdag nyid che/ / ston pa'i bstan pa gces 'dzin byed/ / blo ldan yon tan kun gyis bkur/ / dang po'i yi ge la zhes bstan/ / rgyal po sangs rgyas pa yi phyogs/ / ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed/ /

“At the end of the eon, when the Teacher’s doctrine Has disappeared on earth and the world is corrupt, There will come, there is no doubt, Ascetics involved in affairs of state. “There will be one by the name Mātṛceṭa, One known as Kusuma, One with the initial M, and one with the initial Ku,[3257] Exceedingly fond of the Dharma; “Also, one referred to as Nāga[3258] With the name of Ratnasambhava, One with the initial G, one called Kumāra, And one with the initial V who will care for the Dharma; “Also, a powerful person with the initial A‍— An irresistible defender of the Teacher’s teachings‍— And one known by his initial L, Endowed with virtue and intelligence; “Also, one with the initial R, One known by the initial N,[3259] And King Buddhapakṣa, during whose reign The doctrine of the Teacher will shine brightly.

sdom brtson yi ge a zhes bsgrags/ / bram ze las ni rab tu byung / / grong khyer gnas bcas gnas pa ste/ / de bzhin tshe ni brgyad cur 'tsho/ / dang yig yi ge a dge slong / / lho yi phyogs su 'byung bar 'gyur/ / blo ldan tshe ni drug cur 'tsho/ / ka shi zhes bya'i grong du gnas/ / yi ge d+ha zhes sdom brtson nyid/ / lho yi phyogs su rnam par bsgrags/ / pha rol rgol ba bzlog nas kyang / / de bzhin sdom brtson sngags kyang grub/ /

“There will be a brahmin ascetic with the initial A[3260] Who becomes a Buddhist monk‍— A citizen of the city of Sāketa Who will live eighty years. “In the southern region there will be An ascetic with an initial A[3261] Who is a citizen of Kāśī, is intelligent, And will live sixty years. “Also in the southern region there will be A well-known ascetic with the initial Th. This ascetic, accomplished in mantra, Will suppress the doctrines of other systems.

gzhan yang rab byung dam pa ni/ / sing ga la yi grong na gnas/ / 'phags pa min la 'phags pa'i ming / / sing ga la yi gling na gnas/ / pha rol rgol ba bzlog nas ni/ / mu stegs rnams kyi sngags sun phyung / / de dus 'jigs su rung ba yi/ / dus kyi mtha' las 'byung bar 'gyur/ / yi ge da dang la dang por/ / sdom brtson gang zhig rab gsungs dang / / yi ge ra dang ba dang por/ / dge slong gang zhig rab byung gsungs/ / ston pa'i bstan pa gsal byed pa/ / 'byung bar 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / rgyal po nag po zhes bya bar/ / yi ge sa zhes sdom brtson 'byung / / mchod rten kun dga' ra ba gnas/ / rdzing dang khron pa'ang thams cad du/ / ston pa'i gzugs brnyan de bzhin rtags/ / gzings dang zam pa nyid rnams ni/ / byed par 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / mtshon gyis lus zhig mtho ris 'gro/ /

“Another[3262] eminent renunciant Will be a citizen of the city of lions.[3263] This inhabitant of the island of Siṃhala Will be able to tell the ignoble from the noble, “And he will refute the tenets of the tīrthikas And suppress the doctrines of others. These people will come at that terrible time At the end of the eon. “There will be one ascetic with the V[3264] initial, One with the L initial, One with the R initial, And also a renunciate monk with the V initial, “Who will be, without a doubt, Wholly devoted to the Teacher’s teachings. During [the reign of] a king called Bālāka, There will be an ascetic with the initial S. “He will build monasteries, ashrams, caityas, Ponds, and wells everywhere. He will make banners and images of the Teacher And construct bridges and ferry crossings. “He will be remembered, there is no doubt, as the one Who was slain with a weapon and ascended to the higher realms.[3265]

After him there will be one with the initial M, One known by the name beginning with K, “One with the initial N, Sudatta, Suṣeṇa known as Sena,[3266] Dattaka, and Dinaka who will refute The doctrines of other systems,[3267] “And also a former merchant and a former physician, Both concerned about the welfare of the poor. Another ascetic, with the initial M, will also be born, Who is intelligent and has faith. “Various ascetics [such as those] mentioned And innumerable [others] will come at that time. All of them will be known As torchbearers of the Teacher’s instructions.

“When the instructions have disappeared And the earth is deprived of their light, These ascetics will make, without a doubt, Beautiful images of the Teacher.

“All of them have been prophesied to attain awakening And will certainly become models of attainment. “Now I will tell about the brahmins, Disciplined in the Dharma, Who will be involved in affairs of state By directly applying the mantra methods. During that terrible time They will exist all over the world. “There will be an eminent brahmin with the initial V, Wealthy and fully conversant in the Vedas, Who will wander the earth to its farthest limits In order to debate others. “He will delight in controverting other schools As far away as the lands beyond the three oceans. When facing others in debate, He will recite the six-syllable mantra,[3272] “Which the divine youth conveyed in song Out of his desire to benefit beings. This famous [mantra] from his extensive manual Is for [helping those] of slow intellect.[3273]

“There will be Jaya and Sujaya, And after them, the celebrated Śubhamata,[3274] Well-born and virtuous, And the good and hard-working Mādhava.[3275] “Further, there will be, at that time, Madhu, Sumadhu, Siddha, and Nama.[3276] There will be Rāghava of the śūdra caste, And others, of Scythian ancestry.[3277] “While debating, all of them will recite The mantra of the divine youth present here. All of them will be honest, Intelligent, and learned. They will be involved in affairs of state Alongside the ministers. “Another brahmin, known by the name Beginning with Vi,[3278] Will live in the Flower City.[3279] He will accomplish [the mantra of] Krodha.[3280]
